intrinsic.name: __RDTSCP
intrinsic.desc: Copy the current 64-bit value of the processor's time-stamp counter into dst, and store the IA32_TSC_AUX MSR (signature value) into memory at mem_addr.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := TimeStampCounter MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := IA32_TSC_AUX[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _ADDCARRY_U32
intrinsic.desc: Add unsigned 32-bit integers a and b with unsigned 8-bit carry-in c_in (carry flag), and store the unsigned 32-bit result in out, and the carry-out in dst (carry or overflow flag).

intrinsic.name: _ADDCARRY_U64
intrinsic.desc: Add unsigned 64-bit integers a and b with unsigned 8-bit carry-in c_in (carry flag), and store the unsigned 64-bit result in out, and the carry-out in dst (carry or overflow flag).

intrinsic.name: _ADDCARRYX_U32
intrinsic.desc: Add unsigned 32-bit integers a and b with unsigned 8-bit carry-in c_in (carry or overflow flag), and store the unsigned 32-bit result in out, and the carry-out in dst (carry or overflow flag).

intrinsic.name: _ADDCARRYX_U64
intrinsic.desc: Add unsigned 64-bit integers a and b with unsigned 8-bit carry-in c_in (carry or overflow flag), and store the unsigned 64-bit result in out, and the carry-out in dst (carry or overflow flag).

intrinsic.name: _ALLOW_CPU_FEATURES
intrinsic.desc: Treat the processor-specific feature(s) specified in a as available. Multiple features may be OR'd together. See the valid feature flags below:
intrinsic.oper: _FEATURE_GENERIC_IA32 _FEATURE_FPU _FEATURE_CMOV _FEATURE_MMX _FEATURE_FXSAVE _FEATURE_SSE _FEATURE_SSE2 _FEATURE_SSE3 _FEATURE_SSSE3 _FEATURE_SSE4_1 _FEATURE_SSE4_2 _FEATURE_MOVBE _FEATURE_POPCNT _FEATURE_PCLMULQDQ _FEATURE_AES _FEATURE_F16C _FEATURE_AVX _FEATURE_RDRND _FEATURE_FMA _FEATURE_BMI _FEATURE_LZCNT _FEATURE_HLE _FEATURE_RTM _FEATURE_AVX2 _FEATURE_KNCNI _FEATURE_AVX512F _FEATURE_ADX _FEATURE_RDSEED _FEATURE_AVX512ER _FEATURE_AVX512PF _FEATURE_AVX512CD _FEATURE_SHA _FEATURE_MPX

intrinsic.name: _BEXTR_U32
intrinsic.desc: Extract contiguous bits from unsigned 32-bit integer a, and store the result in dst. Extract the number of bits specified by len, starting at the bit specified by start.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := ZERO_EXTEND_TO_512(a) dst := ZERO_EXTEND(tmp[start+len-1:start])

intrinsic.name: _BEXTR_U64
intrinsic.desc: Extract contiguous bits from unsigned 64-bit integer a, and store the result in dst. Extract the number of bits specified by len, starting at the bit specified by start.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := ZERO_EXTEND_TO_512(a) dst := ZERO_EXTEND(tmp[start+len-1:start])

intrinsic.name: _BIT_SCAN_FORWARD
intrinsic.desc: Set dst to the index of the lowest set bit in 32-bit integer a. If no bits are set in a then dst is undefined.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 0 IF a = 0 dst := undefined ELSE DO WHILE ((tmp < 32) AND a[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp + 1 dst := tmp OD FI

intrinsic.name: _BIT_SCAN_REVERSE
intrinsic.desc: Set dst to the index of the highest set bit in 32-bit integer a. If no bits are set in a then dst is undefined.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 31 IF a = 0 dst := undefined ELSE DO WHILE ((tmp > 0) AND a[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst := tmp OD FI

intrinsic.name: _BITSCANFORWARD
intrinsic.desc: Set index to the index of the lowest set bit in 32-bit integer mask. If no bits are set in mask, then set dst to 0, otherwise set dst to 1.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 0 IF mask = 0 dst := 0 ELSE DO WHILE ((tmp < 32) AND mask[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp + 1 index := tmp dst := 1 OD FI

intrinsic.name: _BITSCANFORWARD64
intrinsic.desc: Set index to the index of the lowest set bit in 64-bit integer mask. If no bits are set in mask, then set dst to 0, otherwise set dst to 1.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 0 IF mask = 0 dst := 0 ELSE DO WHILE ((tmp < 64) AND mask[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp + 1 index := tmp dst := 1 OD FI

intrinsic.name: _BITSCANREVERSE
intrinsic.desc: Set index to the index of the highest set bit in 32-bit integer mask. If no bits are set in mask, then set dst to 0, otherwise set dst to 1.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 31 IF mask = 0 dst := 0 ELSE DO WHILE ((tmp > 0) AND mask[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp - 1 index := tmp dst := 1 OD FI

intrinsic.name: _BITSCANREVERSE64
intrinsic.desc: Set index to the index of the highest set bit in 64-bit integer mask. If no bits are set in mask, then set dst to 0, otherwise set dst to 1.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 31 IF mask = 0 dst := 0 ELSE DO WHILE ((tmp > 0) AND mask[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp - 1 index := tmp dst := 1 OD FI

intrinsic.name: _BITTEST
intrinsic.desc: Return the bit at index b of 32-bit integer a.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a[b]

intrinsic.name: _BITTEST64
intrinsic.desc: Return the bit at index b of 64-bit integer a.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a[b]

intrinsic.name: _BITTESTANDCOMPLEMENT
intrinsic.desc: Return the bit at index b of 32-bit integer a, and set that bit to its complement.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a[b] a[b] := ~a[b]

intrinsic.name: _BITTESTANDCOMPLEMENT64
intrinsic.desc: Return the bit at index b of 64-bit integer a, and set that bit to its complement.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a[b] a[b] := ~a[b]

intrinsic.name: _BITTESTANDRESET
intrinsic.desc: Return the bit at index b of 32-bit integer a, and set that bit to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a[b] a[b] := 0

intrinsic.name: _BITTESTANDRESET64
intrinsic.desc: Return the bit at index b of 64-bit integer a, and set that bit to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a[b] a[b] := 0

intrinsic.name: _BITTESTANDSET
intrinsic.desc: Return the bit at index b of 32-bit integer a, and set that bit to one.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a[b] a[b] := 1

intrinsic.name: _BITTESTANDSET64
intrinsic.desc: Return the bit at index b of 64-bit integer a, and set that bit to one.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a[b] a[b] := 1

intrinsic.name: _BLSI_U32
intrinsic.desc: Extract the lowest set bit from unsigned 32-bit integer a and set the corresponding bit in dst. All other bits in dst are zeroed, and all bits are zeroed if no bits are set in a.
intrinsic.oper: dst := (-a) BITWISE AND a

intrinsic.name: _BLSI_U64
intrinsic.desc: Extract the lowest set bit from unsigned 64-bit integer a and set the corresponding bit in dst. All other bits in dst are zeroed, and all bits are zeroed if no bits are set in a.
intrinsic.oper: dst := (-a) BITWISE AND a

intrinsic.name: _BLSMSK_U32
intrinsic.desc: Set all the lower bits of dst up to and including the lowest set bit in unsigned 32-bit integer a.
intrinsic.oper: dst := (a - 1) XOR a

intrinsic.name: _BLSMSK_U64
intrinsic.desc: Set all the lower bits of dst up to and including the lowest set bit in unsigned 64-bit integer a.
intrinsic.oper: dst := (a - 1) XOR a

intrinsic.name: _BLSR_U32
intrinsic.desc: Copy all bits from unsigned 32-bit integer a to dst, and reset (set to 0) the bit in dst that corresponds to the lowest set bit in a.
intrinsic.oper: dst := (a - 1) BITWISE AND a

intrinsic.name: _BLSR_U64
intrinsic.desc: Copy all bits from unsigned 64-bit integer a to dst, and reset (set to 0) the bit in dst that corresponds to the lowest set bit in a.
intrinsic.oper: dst := (a - 1) BITWISE AND a

intrinsic.name: _BND_CHK_PTR_BOUNDS
intrinsic.desc: Checks if [q, q + size - 1] is within the lower and upper bounds of q and throws a #BR if not.

intrinsic.name: _BND_CHK_PTR_LBOUNDS
intrinsic.desc: Checks if q is within its lower bound, and throws a #BR if not.

intrinsic.name: _BND_CHK_PTR_UBOUNDS
intrinsic.desc: Checks if q is within its upper bound, and throws a #BR if not.

intrinsic.name: _BND_COPY_PTR_BOUNDS
intrinsic.desc: Make a pointer with the value of q and bounds set to the bounds of r (e.g. copy the bounds of r to pointer q), and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _BND_GET_PTR_LBOUND
intrinsic.desc: Return the lower bound of q.
intrinsic.oper: dst := q.LB

intrinsic.name: _BND_GET_PTR_UBOUND
intrinsic.desc: Return the upper bound of q.
intrinsic.oper: dst := q.UB

intrinsic.name: _BND_INIT_PTR_BOUNDS
intrinsic.desc: Make a pointer with the value of q and open bounds, which allow the pointer to access the entire virtual address space, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _BND_NARROW_PTR_BOUNDS
intrinsic.desc: Narrow the bounds for pointer q to the intersection of the bounds of r and the bounds [q, q + size - 1], and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _BND_SET_PTR_BOUNDS
intrinsic.desc: Make a pointer with the value of srcmem and bounds set to [srcmem, srcmem + size - 1], and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _BND_STORE_PTR_BOUNDS
intrinsic.desc: Stores the bounds of ptr_val pointer in memory at address ptr_addr.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[ptr_addr].LB := ptr_val.LB; MEM[ptr_addr].UB := ptr_val.UB;

intrinsic.name: _BSWAP
intrinsic.desc: Reverse the byte order of 32-bit integer a, and store the result in dst. This intrinsic is provided for conversion between little and big endian values.

intrinsic.name: _BSWAP64
intrinsic.desc: Reverse the byte order of 64-bit integer a, and store the result in dst. This intrinsic is provided for conversion between little and big endian values.

intrinsic.name: _BZHI_U32
intrinsic.desc: Copy all bits from unsigned 32-bit integer a to dst, and reset (set to 0) the high bits in dst starting at index.
intrinsic.oper: n := index[7:0] dst := a IF (n < 32) dst[31:n] := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _BZHI_U64
intrinsic.desc: Copy all bits from unsigned 64-bit integer a to dst, and reset (set to 0) the high bits in dst starting at index.
intrinsic.oper: n := index[7:0] dst := a IF (n < 64) dst[63:n] := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _CASTF32_U32
intrinsic.desc: Cast from type float to type unsigned __int32 without conversion. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _CASTF64_U64
intrinsic.desc: Cast from type double to type unsigned __int64 without conversion. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _CASTU32_F32
intrinsic.desc: Cast from type unsigned __int32 to type float without conversion. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _CASTU64_F64
intrinsic.desc: Cast from type unsigned __int64 to type double without conversion. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _CVTSH_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the half-precision (16-bit) floating-point value a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point value, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := Convert_FP16_To_FP32(a[15:0])

intrinsic.name: _CVTSS_SH
intrinsic.desc: Convert the single-precision (32-bit) floating-point value a to a half-precision (16-bit) floating-point value, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := Convert_FP32_To_FP16(a[31:0])

intrinsic.name: _FXRSTOR
intrinsic.desc: Reload the x87 FPU, MMX technology, XMM, and MXCSR registers from the 512-byte memory image at mem_addr. This data should have been written to memory previously using the FXSAVE instruction, and in the same format as required by the operating mode. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: (x87 FPU, MMX, XMM7-XMM0, MXCSR) := Load(MEM[mem_addr])

intrinsic.name: _FXRSTOR64
intrinsic.desc: Reload the x87 FPU, MMX technology, XMM, and MXCSR registers from the 512-byte memory image at mem_addr. This data should have been written to memory previously using the FXSAVE64 instruction, and in the same format as required by the operating mode. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: (x87 FPU, MMX, XMM7-XMM0, MXCSR) := Load(MEM[mem_addr])

intrinsic.name: _FXSAVE
intrinsic.desc: Save the current state of the x87 FPU, MMX technology, XMM, and MXCSR registers to a 512-byte memory location at mem_addr. The clayout of the 512-byte region depends on the operating mode. Bytes [511:464] are available for software use and will not be overwritten by the processor.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511*8:mem_addr] := Fxsave(x87 FPU, MMX, XMM7-XMM0, MXCSR)

intrinsic.name: _FXSAVE64
intrinsic.desc: Save the current state of the x87 FPU, MMX technology, XMM, and MXCSR registers to a 512-byte memory location at mem_addr. The layout of the 512-byte region depends on the operating mode. Bytes [511:464] are available for software use and will not be overwritten by the processor.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511*8:mem_addr] := Fxsave64(x87 FPU, MMX, XMM7-XMM0, MXCSR)

intrinsic.name: _INVPCID
intrinsic.desc: Invalidate mappings in the Translation Lookaside Buffers (TLBs) and paging-structure caches for the processor context identifier (PCID) specified by descriptor based on the invalidation type specified in type. The PCID descriptor is specified as a 16-byte memory operand (with no alignment restrictions) where bits [11:0] specify the PCID, and bits [127:64] specify the linear address; bits [63:12] are reserved. The types supported are: 0) Individual-address invalidation: If type is 0, the logical processor invalidates mappings for a single linear address and tagged with the PCID specified in descriptor, except global translations. The instruction may also invalidate global translations, mappings for other linear addresses, or mappings tagged with other PCIDs. 1) Single-context invalidation: If type is 1, the logical processor invalidates all mappings tagged with the PCID specified in descriptor except global translations. In some cases, it may invalidate mappings for other PCIDs as well. 2) All-context invalidation: If type is 2, the logical processor invalidates all mappings tagged with any PCID. 3) All-context invalidation, retaining global translations: If type is 3, the logical processor invalidates all mappings tagged with any PCID except global translations, ignoring descriptor. The instruction may also invalidate global translations as well.
intrinsic.oper: CASE type OF 0: // individual-address invalidation retaining global translations OP_PCID := descriptor[11:0] ADDR := descriptor[127:64] BREAK 1: // single PCID invalidation retaining globals OP_PCID := descriptor[11:0] // invalidate all mappings tagged with OP_PCID except global translations BREAK 2: // all PCID invalidation // invalidate all mappings tagged with any PCID BREAK 3: // all PCID invalidation retaining global translations // invalidate all mappings tagged with any PCID except global translations BREAK ESAC

intrinsic.name: _LOADBE_I16
intrinsic.desc: Loads a big-endian word (16-bit) value from address ptr and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[ptr] FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := addr[15-i:15-i-7] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _LOADBE_I32
intrinsic.desc: Loads a big-endian double word (32-bit) value from address ptr and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[ptr] FOR j := 0 to 4 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := addr[31-i:31-i-7] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _LOADBE_I64
intrinsic.desc: Loads a big-endian quad word (64-bit) value from address ptr and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[ptr] FOR j := 0 to 8 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := addr[63-i:63-i-7] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _LROTL
intrinsic.desc: Shift the bits of unsigned 64-bit integer a left by the number of bits specified in shift, rotating the most-significant bit to the least-significant bit location, and store the unsigned result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a count := shift BITWISE AND 63 DO WHILE (count > 0) tmp[0] := dst[63] dst := (dst << 1) OR tmp[0] count := count - 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _LROTR
intrinsic.desc: Shift the bits of unsigned 64-bit integer a right by the number of bits specified in shift, rotating the least-significant bit to the most-significant bit location, and store the unsigned result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a count := shift BITWISE AND 63 DO WHILE (count > 0) tmp[63] := dst[0] dst := (dst >> 1) OR tmp[63] count := count - 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _LZCNT_U32
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of leading zero bits in unsigned 32-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 31 dst := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst := dst + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _LZCNT_U64
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of leading zero bits in unsigned 64-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 63 dst := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst := dst + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _M_EMPTY
intrinsic.desc: Empty the MMX state, which marks the x87 FPU registers as available for use by x87 instructions. This instruction must be used at the end of all MMX technology procedures.

intrinsic.name: _M_FROM_INT
intrinsic.desc: Copy 32-bit integer a to the lower elements of dst, and zero the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_FROM_INT64
intrinsic.desc: Copy 64-bit integer a to dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_MASKMOVQ
intrinsic.desc: Conditionally store 8-bit integer elements from a into memory using mask (elements are not stored when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 IF mask[i+7] MEM[mem_addr+i+7:mem_addr+i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PACKSSDW
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[31:0]) dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[63:32]) dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[31:0]) dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[63:32])

intrinsic.name: _M_PACKSSWB
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[63:48]) dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[15:0]) dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[31:16]) dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[47:32]) dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[63:48])

intrinsic.name: _M_PACKUSWB
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[63:48]) dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[15:0]) dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[31:16]) dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[47:32]) dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[63:48])

intrinsic.name: _M_PADDB
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PADDD
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PADDSB
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_Int8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PADDSW
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PADDUSB
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PADDUSW
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PADDW
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PAND
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 64 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PANDN
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of 64 bits (representing integer data) in a and then AND with b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PAVGB
intrinsic.desc: Average packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := (a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] + 1) >> 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PAVGW
intrinsic.desc: Average packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := (a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] + 1) >> 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PCMPEQB
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b for equality, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := ( a[i+7:i] == b[i+7:i] ) ? 0xFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PCMPEQD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b for equality, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] == b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PCMPEQW
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b for equality, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := ( a[i+15:i] == b[i+15:i] ) ? 0xFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PCMPGTB
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b for greater-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := ( a[i+7:i] > b[i+7:i] ) ? 0xFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PCMPGTD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b for greater-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] > b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PCMPGTW
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b for greater-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := ( a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] ) ? 0xFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PEXTRW
intrinsic.desc: Extract a 16-bit integer from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in the lower element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PINSRW
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 16-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _M_PMADDWD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate 32-bit integers, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PMAXSW
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PMAXUB
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] > b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PMINSW
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] < b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PMINUB
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PMOVMSKB
intrinsic.desc: Create mask from the most significant bit of each 8-bit element in a, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[j] := a[i+7] ENDFOR dst[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _M_PMULHUW
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PMULHW
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PMULLW
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the low 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[15:0] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_POR
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of 64 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PSADBW
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute differences of packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, then horizontally sum each consecutive 8 differences to produce four unsigned 16-bit integers, and pack these unsigned 16-bit integers in the low 16 bits of dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PSHUFW
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PSLLD
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 IF count[63:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] << count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSLLDI
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a left by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 IF imm8[7:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] << imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSLLQ
intrinsic.desc: Shift 64-bit integer a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: IF count[63:0] > 63 dst[63:0] := 0 ELSE dst[63:0] := ZeroExtend(a[63:0] << count[63:0]) FI

intrinsic.name: _M_PSLLQI
intrinsic.desc: Shift 64-bit integer a left by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: IF imm8[7:0] > 63 dst[63:0] := 0 ELSE dst[63:0] := ZeroExtend(a[63:0] << imm8[7:0]) FI

intrinsic.name: _M_PSLLW
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSLLWI
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF imm8[7:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRAD
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 IF count[63:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+31:i] := SignExtend(a[i+31:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRADI
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 IF imm8[7:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+31:i] := SignExtend(a[i+31:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRAW
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+15:i] := SignExtend(a[i+15:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRAWI
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF imm8[7:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+15:i] := SignExtend(a[i+15:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRLD
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 IF count[63:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRLDI
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 IF imm8[7:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRLQ
intrinsic.desc: Shift 64-bit integer a right by count while shifting in zeros, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: IF count[63:0] > 63 dst[63:0] := 0 ELSE dst[63:0] := ZeroExtend(a[63:0] >> count[63:0]) FI

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRLQI
intrinsic.desc: Shift 64-bit integer a right by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: IF imm8[7:0] > 63 dst[63:0] := 0 ELSE dst[63:0] := ZeroExtend(a[63:0] >> imm8[7:0]) FI

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRLW
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSRLWI
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF imm8[7:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSUBB
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 8-bit integers in b from packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSUBD
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 32-bit integers in b from packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSUBSB
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 8-bit integers in b from packed 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_Int8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSUBSW
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSUBUSB
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 8-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSUBUSW
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 16-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PSUBW
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _M_PUNPCKHBW
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8-bit integers from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PUNPCKHDQ
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32-bit integers from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PUNPCKHWD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_WORDS(src1[63:0], src2[63:0]){ dst[15:0] := src1[47:32] dst[31:16] := src2[47:32] dst[47:32] := src1[63:48] dst[63:48] := src2[63:48] RETURN dst[63:0] }
dst[63:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_WORDS(a[63:0], b[63:0])

intrinsic.name: _M_PUNPCKLBW
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8-bit integers from the low half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PUNPCKLDQ
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32-bit integers from the low half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PUNPCKLWD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the low half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_PXOR
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of 64 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_TO_INT
intrinsic.desc: Copy the lower 32-bit integer in a to dst.

intrinsic.name: _M_TO_INT64
intrinsic.desc: Copy 64-bit integer a to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MAY_I_USE_CPU_FEATURE
intrinsic.desc: Dynamically query the processor to determine if the processor-specific feature(s) specified in a are available, and return true or false (1 or 0) if the set of features is available. Multiple features may be OR'd together. This intrinsic does not check the processor vendor. See the valid feature flags below:
intrinsic.oper: _FEATURE_GENERIC_IA32 _FEATURE_FPU _FEATURE_CMOV _FEATURE_MMX _FEATURE_FXSAVE _FEATURE_SSE _FEATURE_SSE2 _FEATURE_SSE3 _FEATURE_SSSE3 _FEATURE_SSE4_1 _FEATURE_SSE4_2 _FEATURE_MOVBE _FEATURE_POPCNT _FEATURE_PCLMULQDQ _FEATURE_AES _FEATURE_F16C _FEATURE_AVX _FEATURE_RDRND _FEATURE_FMA _FEATURE_BMI _FEATURE_LZCNT _FEATURE_HLE _FEATURE_RTM _FEATURE_AVX2 _FEATURE_KNCNI _FEATURE_AVX512F _FEATURE_ADX _FEATURE_RDSEED _FEATURE_AVX512ER _FEATURE_AVX512PF _FEATURE_AVX512CD _FEATURE_SHA _FEATURE_MPX

intrinsic.name: _MM_ABS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := ABS(a[i+15:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ABS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ABS(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ABS_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 64-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ABS(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ABS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ABS_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := ABS(a[i+15:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ABS_PI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ABS(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ABS_PI8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ACOS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cosine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ACOS(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ACOS_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cosine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ACOS(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ACOSH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse hyperbolic cosine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ACOSH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ACOSH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse hyperbolic cosine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ACOSH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + b[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Add packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + b[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_PI32
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_PI8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Add packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Add the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Add the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_SD
intrinsic.desc: Add the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Add 64-bit integers a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Add the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_Int8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDS_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDS_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDS_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDS_PI8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_Int8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDS_PU16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDS_PU8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Alternatively add and subtract packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to/from packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] - b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ADDSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Alternatively add and subtract packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to/from packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_AESDEC_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Perform one round of an AES decryption flow on data (state) in a using the round key in RoundKey, and store the result in dst."
intrinsic.oper: state := a a[127:0] := InvShiftRows(a[127:0]) a[127:0] := InvSubBytes(a[127:0]) a[127:0] := InvMixColumns(a[127:0]) dst[127:0] := a[127:0] XOR RoundKey[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_AESDECLAST_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Perform the last round of an AES decryption flow on data (state) in a using the round key in RoundKey, and store the result in dst."
intrinsic.oper: state := a a[127:0] := InvShiftRows(a[127:0]) a[127:0] := InvSubBytes(a[127:0]) dst[127:0] := a[127:0] XOR RoundKey[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_AESENC_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Perform one round of an AES encryption flow on data (state) in a using the round key in RoundKey, and store the result in dst."
intrinsic.oper: state := a a[127:0] := ShiftRows(a[127:0]) a[127:0] := SubBytes(a[127:0]) a[127:0] := MixColumns(a[127:0]) dst[127:0] := a[127:0] XOR RoundKey[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_AESENCLAST_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Perform the last round of an AES encryption flow on data (state) in a using the round key in RoundKey, and store the result in dst."
intrinsic.oper: state := a a[127:0] := ShiftRows(a[127:0]) a[127:0] := SubBytes(a[127:0]) dst[127:0] := a[127:0] XOR RoundKey[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_AESIMC_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Perform the InvMixColumns transformation on a and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := InvMixColumns(a[127:0])

intrinsic.name: _MM_AESKEYGENASSIST_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Assist in expanding the AES cipher key by computing steps towards generating a round key for encryption cipher using data from a and an 8-bit round constant specified in imm8, and store the result in dst."

intrinsic.name: _MM_ALIGNR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 32-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 32-bit elements, and store the low 16 bytes (4 elements) in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ALIGNR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 32-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 64-bit elements, and store the low 16 bytes (2 elements) in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ALIGNR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate 16-byte blocks in a and b into a 32-byte temporary result, shift the result right by count bytes, and store the low 16 bytes in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ALIGNR_PI8
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate 8-byte blocks in a and b into a 16-byte temporary result, shift the result right by count bytes, and store the low 16 bytes in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_AND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_AND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_AND_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_AND_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 64 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ANDNOT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and then AND with b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ((NOT a[i+63:i]) AND b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ANDNOT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and then AND with b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ((NOT a[i+31:i]) AND b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ANDNOT_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and then AND with b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ANDNOT_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of 64 bits (representing integer data) in a and then AND with b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ASIN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse sine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ASIN(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ASIN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse sine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ASIN(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ASINH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse hyperbolic sine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ASINH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ASINH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse hyperbolic sine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ASINH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ATAN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ATAN(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ATAN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ATAN(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ATAN2_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a divided by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst expressed in radians.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ATAN(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ATAN2_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a divided by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst expressed in radians.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ATAN(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ATANH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse hyperbolic tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ATANH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ATANH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse hyperbolic tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ATANH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_AVG_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Average packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := (a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] + 1) >> 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_AVG_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Average packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := (a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] + 1) >> 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_AVG_PU16
intrinsic.desc: Average packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := (a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] + 1) >> 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_AVG_PU8
intrinsic.desc: Average packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := (a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] + 1) >> 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_BLEND_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Blend packed 16-bit integers from a and b using control mask imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF imm8[j%8] dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_BLEND_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Blend packed 32-bit integers from a and b using control mask imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF imm8[j%8] dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BLEND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Blend packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a and b using control mask imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF imm8[j%8] dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_BLEND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Blend packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a and b using control mask imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF imm8[j%8] dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_BLENDV_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Blend packed 8-bit integers from a and b using mask, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF mask[i+7] dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_BLENDV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Blend packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a and b using mask, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF mask[i+63] dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_BLENDV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Blend packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a and b using mask, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCAST_I32X2
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the lower 2 packed 32-bit integers from a to all elements of "dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 n := (j mod 2)*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[n+31:n] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCAST_SS
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from memory to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp[31:0] = MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := tmp[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCASTB_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low packed 8-bit integer from a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[7:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCASTD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low packed 32-bit integer from a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCASTMB_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low 8-bits from input mask k to all 64-bit elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ZeroExtend(k[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCASTMW_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low 16-bits from input mask k to all 32-bit elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(k[15:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCASTQ_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low packed 64-bit integer from a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCASTSD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCASTSS_PS
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BROADCASTW_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low packed 16-bit integer from a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[15:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_BSLLI_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Shift a left by imm8 bytes while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := imm8[7:0] IF tmp > 15 tmp := 16 FI dst[127:0] := a[127:0] << (tmp*8)

intrinsic.name: _MM_BSRLI_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Shift a right by imm8 bytes while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := imm8[7:0] IF tmp > 15 tmp := 16 FI dst[127:0] := a[127:0] >> (tmp*8)

intrinsic.name: _MM_CASTPD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Cast vector of type __m128d to type __m128. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CASTPD_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Cast vector of type __m128d to type __m128i. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CASTPS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Cast vector of type __m128 to type __m128d. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CASTPS_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Cast vector of type __m128 to type __m128i. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CASTSI128_PD
intrinsic.desc: Cast vector of type __m128i to type __m128d. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CASTSI128_PS
intrinsic.desc: Cast vector of type __m128i to type __m128. This intrinsic is only used for compilation and does not generate any instructions, thus it has zero latency.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CBRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cube root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := CubeRoot(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CBRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cube root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := CubeRoot(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CDFNORM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cumulative distribution function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the normal distribution, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := CDFNormal(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CDFNORM_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cumulative distribution function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the normal distribution, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := CDFNormal(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CDFNORMINV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cumulative distribution function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the normal distribution, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := InverseCDFNormal(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CDFNORMINV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cumulative distribution function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the normal distribution, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := InverseCDFNormal(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CEIL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a up to an integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := CEIL(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CEIL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a up to an integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := CEIL(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CEIL_SD
intrinsic.desc: Round the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b up to an integer value, store the result as a double-precision floating-point element in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CEIL_SS
intrinsic.desc: Round the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b up to an integer value, store the result as a single-precision floating-point element in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CEXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed complex single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := e^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CLEVICT
intrinsic.desc: Evicts the cache line containing the address ptr from cache level level (can be either 0 or 1).
intrinsic.oper: CacheLineEvict(ptr, level)

intrinsic.name: _MM_CLFLUSH
intrinsic.desc: Invalidate and flush the cache line that contains p from all levels of the cache hierarchy.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CLFLUSHOPT
intrinsic.desc: Invalidate and flush the cache line that contains p from all levels of the cache hierarchy.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CLMULEPI64_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Perform a carry-less multiplication of two 64-bit integers, selected from a and b according to imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CLOG_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of packed complex single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ln(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 k[j] := ( a[i+15:i] OP b[i+15:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ( a[i+31:i] OP b[i+31:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 64-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ( a[i+63:i] OP b[i+63:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ( a[i+7:i] OP b[i+7:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_EPU16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 k[j] := ( a[i+15:i] OP b[i+15:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_EPU32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ( a[i+31:i] OP b[i+31:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_EPU64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ( a[i+63:i] OP b[i+63:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_EPU8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ( a[i+7:i] OP b[i+7:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPESTRA
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings in a and b with lengths la and lb using the control in imm8, and returns 1 if b did not contain a null character and the resulting mask was zero, and 0 otherwise. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings in a and b with lengths la and lb using the control in imm8, and returns bit 0 of the resulting bit mask. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPESTRS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings in a and b with lengths la and lb using the control in imm8, and returns 1 if any character in a was null, and 0 otherwise. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask
intrinsic.oper:
size := (imm8[0] ? 16 : 8) // 8 or 16-bit characters UpperBound := (128 / size) - 1
dst := (la <= UpperBound)

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPESTRZ
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings in a and b with lengths la and lb using the control in imm8, and returns 1 if any character in b was null, and 0 otherwise. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask
intrinsic.oper:
size := (imm8[0] ? 16 : 8) // 8 or 16-bit characters UpperBound := (128 / size) - 1
dst := (lb <= UpperBound)

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 k[j] := ( a[i+15:i] >= b[i+15:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ( a[i+31:i] >= b[i+31:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 64-bit integers in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ( a[i+63:i] >= b[i+63:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_EPU64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ( a[i+63:i] >= b[i+63:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_EPU8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ( a[i+7:i] >= b[i+7:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] >= b[i+63:i]) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] >= b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPGT_EPI16

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPISTRA
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in a and b using the control in imm8, and returns 1 if b did not contain a null character and the resulting mask was zero, and 0 otherwise. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPISTRC
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in a and b using the control in imm8, and returns 1 if the resulting mask was non-zero, and 0 otherwise. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPISTRI
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in a and b using the control in imm8, and store the generated index in dst. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPISTRM
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in a and b using the control in imm8, and store the generated mask in dst. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPISTRO
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in a and b using the control in imm8, and returns bit 0 of the resulting bit mask. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPISTRS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in a and b using the control in imm8, and returns 1 if any character in a was null, and 0 otherwise. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask
intrinsic.oper:
size := (imm8[0] ? 16 : 8) // 8 or 16-bit characters UpperBound := (128 / size) - 1
aInvalid := 0 FOR i := 0 to UpperBound m := i*size IF b[m+size-1:m] == 0 aInvalid := 1 FI ENDFOR
dst := aInvalid

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPISTRZ
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in a and b using the control in imm8, and returns 1 if any character in b was null, and 0 otherwise. imm can be a combination of: _SIDD_UBYTE_OPS // unsigned 8-bit characters _SIDD_UWORD_OPS // unsigned 16-bit characters _SIDD_SBYTE_OPS // signed 8-bit characters _SIDD_SWORD_OPS // signed 16-bit characters _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ANY // compare equal any _SIDD_CMP_RANGES // compare ranges _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_EACH // compare equal each _SIDD_CMP_EQUAL_ORDERED // compare equal ordered _SIDD_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results _SIDD_MASKED_NEGATIVE_POLARITY // negate results only before end of string _SIDD_LEAST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return last significant bit _SIDD_MOST_SIGNIFICANT // index only: return most significant bit _SIDD_BIT_MASK // mask only: return bit mask _SIDD_UNIT_MASK // mask only: return byte/word mask
intrinsic.oper:
size := (imm8[0] ? 16 : 8) // 8 or 16-bit characters UpperBound := (128 / size) - 1
bInvalid := 0 FOR j := 0 to UpperBound n := j*size IF b[n+size-1:n] == 0 bInvalid := 1 FI ENDFOR
dst := bInvalid

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLE_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 k[j] := ( a[i+15:i] <= b[i+15:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLE_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ( a[i+31:i] <= b[i+31:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0
