intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 64-bit integers in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ( a[i+63:i] <= b[i+63:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 k[j] := ( a[i+15:i] <= b[i+15:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ( a[i+31:i] <= b[i+31:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] <= b[i+63:i]) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] <= b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b for less-than, and store the results in dst. Note: This intrinsic emits the pcmpgtw instruction with the order of the operands switched.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := ( a[i+15:i] < b[i+15:i] ) ? 0xFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b for less-than, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b for less-than, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ( a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ( a[i+63:i] < b[i+63:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_EPI8

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := ( a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] ) ? 0xFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b for less-than, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ( a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_EPU16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b for less-than, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 k[j] := ( a[i+15:i] < b[i+15:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_EPU32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a and b for less-than, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ( a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_EPU64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a and b for less-than, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ( a[i+63:i] < b[i+63:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_EPU8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b for less-than, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ( a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for less-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] < b[i+63:i]) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for less-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for less-than, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPLT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for less-than, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 64-bit integers in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ( a[i+7:i] != b[i+7:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_EPU16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_EPU32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_EPU64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_EPU8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ( a[i+7:i] != b[i+7:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] != b[i+63:i]) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] != b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-equal, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNEQ_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-equal, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNGE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := !(a[i+63:i] >= b[i+63:i]) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNGE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-greater-than-or-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := !( a[i+31:i] >= b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNGE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-greater-than-or-equal, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNGE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-greater-than-or-equal, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNGT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-greater-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := !(a[i+63:i] > b[i+63:i]) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNGT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-greater-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := !( a[i+31:i] > b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNGT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-greater-than, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNGT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-greater-than, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNLE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-less-than-or-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := !(a[i+63:i] <= b[i+63:i]) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNLE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-less-than-or-equal, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := !( a[i+31:i] <= b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNLE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-less-than-or-equal, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNLE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-less-than-or-equal, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNLT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-less-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := !(a[i+63:i] < b[i+63:i]) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNLT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-less-than, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := !( a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNLT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-less-than, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPNLT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b for not-less-than, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPORD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if neither is NaN, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] != NaN AND b[i+63:i] != NaN) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPORD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if neither is NaN, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] != NaN AND b[i+31:i] != NaN ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPORD_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if neither is NaN, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := (a[63:0] != NaN AND b[63:0] != NaN) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 dst[127:64] := a[127:64]

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPORD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if neither is NaN, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPUNORD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if either is NaN, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] == NaN OR b[i+63:i] == NaN) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPUNORD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if either is NaN, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ( a[i+31:i] == NaN OR b[i+31:i] == NaN ) ? 0xffffffff : 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPUNORD_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if either is NaN, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := (a[63:0] == NaN OR b[63:0] == NaN) ? 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF : 0 dst[127:64] := a[127:64]

intrinsic.name: _MM_CMPUNORD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if either is NaN, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMI_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper:
CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _CMP_EQ_OQ 1: OP := _CMP_LT_OS 2: OP := _CMP_LE_OS 3: OP := _CMP_UNORD_Q 4: OP := _CMP_NEQ_UQ 5: OP := _CMP_NLT_US 6: OP := _CMP_NLE_US 7: OP := _CMP_ORD_Q 8: OP := _CMP_EQ_UQ 9: OP := _CMP_NGE_US 10: OP := _CMP_NGT_US 11: OP := _CMP_FALSE_OQ 12: OP := _CMP_NEQ_OQ 13: OP := _CMP_GE_OS 14: OP := _CMP_GT_OS 15: OP := _CMP_TRUE_UQ 16: OP := _CMP_EQ_OS 17: OP := _CMP_LT_OQ 18: OP := _CMP_LE_OQ 19: OP := _CMP_UNORD_S 20: OP := _CMP_NEQ_US 21: OP := _CMP_NLT_UQ 22: OP := _CMP_NLE_UQ 23: OP := _CMP_ORD_S 24: OP := _CMP_EQ_US 25: OP := _CMP_NGE_UQ 26: OP := _CMP_NGT_UQ 27: OP := _CMP_FALSE_OS 28: OP := _CMP_NEQ_OS 29: OP := _CMP_GE_OQ 30: OP := _CMP_GT_OQ 31: OP := _CMP_TRUE_US ESAC
RETURN ( a[63:0] OP b[63:0] ) ? 1 : 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMI_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper:
CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _CMP_EQ_OQ 1: OP := _CMP_LT_OS 2: OP := _CMP_LE_OS 3: OP := _CMP_UNORD_Q 4: OP := _CMP_NEQ_UQ 5: OP := _CMP_NLT_US 6: OP := _CMP_NLE_US 7: OP := _CMP_ORD_Q 8: OP := _CMP_EQ_UQ 9: OP := _CMP_NGE_US 10: OP := _CMP_NGT_US 11: OP := _CMP_FALSE_OQ 12: OP := _CMP_NEQ_OQ 13: OP := _CMP_GE_OS 14: OP := _CMP_GT_OS 15: OP := _CMP_TRUE_UQ 16: OP := _CMP_EQ_OS 17: OP := _CMP_LT_OQ 18: OP := _CMP_LE_OQ 19: OP := _CMP_UNORD_S 20: OP := _CMP_NEQ_US 21: OP := _CMP_NLT_UQ 22: OP := _CMP_NLE_UQ 23: OP := _CMP_ORD_S 24: OP := _CMP_EQ_US 25: OP := _CMP_NGE_UQ 26: OP := _CMP_NGT_UQ 27: OP := _CMP_FALSE_OS 28: OP := _CMP_NEQ_OS 29: OP := _CMP_GE_OQ 30: OP := _CMP_GT_OQ 31: OP := _CMP_TRUE_US ESAC
RETURN ( a[31:0] OP b[31:0] ) ? 1 : 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMIEQ_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for equality, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMIEQ_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for equality, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMIGE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMIGE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMIGT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for greater-than, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMIGT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for greater-than, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMILE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMILE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMILT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for less-than, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMILT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for less-than, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMINEQ_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for not-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_COMINEQ_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for not-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1).

intrinsic.name: _MM_CONFLICT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Test each 32-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit. Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 FOR k := 0 to j-1 m := k*32 dst[i+k] := (a[i+31:i] == a[m+31:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+31:i+j] := 0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CONFLICT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Test each 64-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit. Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 FOR k := 0 to j-1 m := k*64 dst[i+k] := (a[i+63:i] == a[m+63:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+63:i+j] := 0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cosine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := COS(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COS_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cosine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := COS(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COSD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cosine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := COSD(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COSD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cosine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := COSD(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COSH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic cosine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := COSH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COSH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic cosine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := COSH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_COUNTBITS_32
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of set bits in 32-bit unsigned integer r1, returning the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := PopCount(r1[31:0])

intrinsic.name: _MM_COUNTBITS_64
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of set bits in double-precision (32-bit) unsigned integer r1, returning the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := PopCount(r1[63:0])

intrinsic.name: _MM_CRC32_U16
intrinsic.desc: Starting with the initial value in crc, accumulates a CRC32 value for unsigned 16-bit integer v, and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp1[15:0] := v[0:15] // bit reflection tmp2[31:0] := crc[0:31] // bit reflection tmp3[47:0] := tmp1[15:0] << 32 tmp4[47:0] := tmp2[31:0] << 16 tmp5[47:0] := tmp3[47:0] XOR tmp4[47:0] tmp6[31:0] := tmp5[47:0] MOD2 0x11EDC6F41 dst[31:0] := tmp6[0:31] // bit reflection

intrinsic.name: _MM_CRC32_U32
intrinsic.desc: Starting with the initial value in crc, accumulates a CRC32 value for unsigned 32-bit integer v, and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp1[31:0] := v[0:31] // bit reflection tmp2[31:0] := crc[0:31] // bit reflection tmp3[63:0] := tmp1[31:0] << 32 tmp4[63:0] := tmp2[31:0] << 32 tmp5[63:0] := tmp3[63:0] XOR tmp4[63:0] tmp6[31:0] := tmp5[63:0] MOD2 0x11EDC6F41 dst[31:0] := tmp6[0:31] // bit reflection

intrinsic.name: _MM_CRC32_U64
intrinsic.desc: Starting with the initial value in crc, accumulates a CRC32 value for unsigned 64-bit integer v, and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp1[63:0] := v[0:63] // bit reflection tmp2[31:0] := crc[0:31] // bit reflection tmp3[95:0] := tmp1[31:0] << 32 tmp4[95:0] := tmp2[63:0] << 64 tmp5[95:0] := tmp3[95:0] XOR tmp4[95:0] tmp6[31:0] := tmp5[95:0] MOD2 0x11EDC6F41 dst[31:0] := tmp6[0:31] // bit reflection

intrinsic.name: _MM_CRC32_U8
intrinsic.desc: Starting with the initial value in crc, accumulates a CRC32 value for unsigned 8-bit integer v, and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp1[7:0] := v[0:7] // bit reflection tmp2[31:0] := crc[0:31] // bit reflection tmp3[39:0] := tmp1[7:0] << 32 tmp4[39:0] := tmp2[31:0] << 8 tmp5[39:0] := tmp3[39:0] XOR tmp4[39:0] tmp6[31:0] := tmp5[39:0] MOD2 0x11EDC6F41 dst[31:0] := tmp6[0:31] // bit reflection

intrinsic.name: _MM_CSQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed complex single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVT_PI2PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers in b to packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements, store the results in the lower 2 elements of dst, and copy the upper 2 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVT_PS2PI
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 32-bit integers, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP32_To_Int32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVT_ROUNDI32_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the 32-bit integer b to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ConvertUnsignedInt64_To_FP64(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTEPU64_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a to packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 l := j*32 dst[l+31:l] := ConvertUnsignedInt64_To_FP32(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Zero extend packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a to packed 16-bit integers, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTPI32X2_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers in a to packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements, store the results in the lower 2 elements of dst, then covert the packed 32-bit integers in a to single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element, and store the results in the upper 2 elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := Convert_Int32_To_FP32(a[31:0]) dst[63:32] := Convert_Int32_To_FP32(a[63:32]) dst[95:64] := Convert_Int32_To_FP32(b[31:0]) dst[127:96] := Convert_Int32_To_FP32(b[63:32])

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTT_ROUNDSS_I32
intrinsic.desc: Convert the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a 32-bit integer with truncation, and store the result in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := Convert_FP32_To_Int32_Truncate(a[31:0])

intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := Convert_FP32_To_Int64_Truncate(a[31:0])

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 32*j k := 64*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP64_To_Int32_Truncate(a[k+63:k]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTU32_SD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the unsigned 32-bit integer b to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := Convert_UnsignedInt32_To_FP64(b[31:0]) dst[127:64] := a[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTU32_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the unsigned 32-bit integer b to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := Convert_UnsignedInt32_To_FP32(b[31:0]) dst[127:32] := a[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTU64_SD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the unsigned 64-bit integer b to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := Convert_UnsignedInt64_To_FP64(b[63:0]) dst[127:64] := a[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTU64_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the unsigned 64-bit integer b to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := Convert_UnsignedInt64_To_FP32(b[63:0]) dst[127:32] := a[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTUSEPI16_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 8-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 16*j l := 8*j dst[l+7:l] := Saturate_UnsignedInt16_To_Int8(a[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTUSEPI32_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 16-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j k := 16*j dst[k+15:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt32_To_Int16(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTUSEPI32_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 8-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j k := 8*j dst[k+7:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt32_To_Int8(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTUSEPI64_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 16-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j k := 16*j dst[k+15:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt64_To_Int16(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTUSEPI64_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 32-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j k := 32*j dst[k+31:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt64_To_Int32(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_CVTUSEPI64_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 8-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j k := 8*j dst[k+7:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt64_To_Int8(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DBSAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst. Four SADs are performed on four 8-bit quadruplets for each 64-bit lane. The first two SADs use the lower 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a, and the last two SADs use the uppper 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a. Quadruplets from b are selected according to the control in imm8, and each SAD in each 64-bit lane uses the selected quadruplet at 8-bit offsets.

intrinsic.name: _MM_DELAY_32
intrinsic.desc: Stalls a thread without blocking other threads for 32-bit unsigned integer r1 clock cycles.
intrinsic.oper: BlockThread(r1)

intrinsic.name: _MM_DELAY_64
intrinsic.desc: Stalls a thread without blocking other threads for 64-bit unsigned integer r1 clock cycles.
intrinsic.oper: BlockThread(r1)

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 8-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 8*j dst[i+7:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+7:i] / b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 8*j dst[i+7:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+7:i] / b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Divide the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a by the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Divide the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a by the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_SD
intrinsic.desc: Divide the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a by the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_DIV_SS
intrinsic.desc: Divide the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a by the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_DP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Conditionally multiply the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the high 4 bits in imm8, sum the four products, and conditionally store the sum in dst using the low 4 bits of imm8.
intrinsic.oper:
DP(a[127:0], b[127:0], imm8[7:0]) { FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF imm8[(4+j)%8]] temp[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] ELSE temp[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR
sum[63:0] := temp[127:64] + temp[63:0]
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF imm8[j%8] tmpdst[i+63:i] := sum[63:0] ELSE tmpdst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR RETURN tmpdst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := DP(a[127:0], b[127:0], imm8[7:0])

intrinsic.name: _MM_DP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Conditionally multiply the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the high 4 bits in imm8, sum the four products, and conditionally store the sum in dst using the low 4 bits of imm8.
intrinsic.oper:
DP(a[127:0], b[127:0], imm8[7:0]) { FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF imm8[(4+j)%8] temp[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ELSE temp[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR
sum[31:0] := (temp[127:96] + temp[95:64]) + (temp[63:32] + temp[31:0])
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF imm8[j%8] tmpdst[i+31:i] := sum[31:0] ELSE tmpdst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR RETURN tmpdst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := DP(a[127:0], b[127:0], imm8[7:0])

intrinsic.name: _MM_EMPTY
intrinsic.desc: Empty the MMX state, which marks the x87 FPU registers as available for use by x87 instructions. This instruction must be used at the end of all MMX technology procedures.

intrinsic.name: _MM_ERF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ERF_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ERFC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the complementary error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 - ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ERFC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the complementary error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 - ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ERFCINV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse complementary error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 / (1.0 - ERF(a[i+63:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ERFCINV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse complementary error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 / (1.0 - ERF(a[i+31:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ERFINV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 / ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ERFINV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 / ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := e^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := e^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXP10_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 10 raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 10^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXP10_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 10 raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 10^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXP2_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 2^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXP2_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 2^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXPM1_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, subtract one from each element, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := e^(a[i+63:i]) - 1.0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXPM1_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, subtract one from each element, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := e^(a[i+31:i]) - 1.0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXTRACT_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Extract a 16-bit integer from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in the lower element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXTRACT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Extract a 32-bit integer from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXTRACT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Extract a 64-bit integer from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXTRACT_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Extract an 8-bit integer from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in the lower element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXTRACT_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Extract a 16-bit integer from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in the lower element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_EXTRACT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FIXUPIMM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 64-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i], c[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FIXUPIMM_PS
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 32-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN L= 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[31:0], src2[31:0], src3[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[31:0] := ((src2[30:23] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[31:0] CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i], c[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FIXUPIMM_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the lower 64-bit integer in c, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }
dst[63:0] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[63:0], b[63:0], c[63:0], imm8[7:0]) dst[127:64] := a[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FIXUPIMM_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Fix up the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the lower 32-bit integer in c, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN L= 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[31:0], src2[31:0], src3[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[31:0] := ((src2[30:23] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[31:0] CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
dst[31:0] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[31:0], b[31:0], c[31:0], imm8[7:0]) dst[127:32] := a[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Fix up the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the lower 64-bit integer in c, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC

INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }
dst[63:0] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[63:0], b[63:0], c[63:0], imm8[7:0]) dst[127:64] := a[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FIXUPIMM_SS
intrinsic.desc: Fix up the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the lower 32-bit integer in c, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN L= 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[31:0], src2[31:0], src3[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[31:0] := ((src2[30:23] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[31:0] CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
