CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
dst[31:0] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[31:0], b[31:0], c[31:0], imm8[7:0]) dst[127:32] := a[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FLOOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a down to an integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FLOOR(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_FLOOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a down to an integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FLOOR(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_FLOOR_SD
intrinsic.desc: Round the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b down to an integer value, store the result as a double-precision floating-point element in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FLOOR_SS
intrinsic.desc: Round the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b down to an integer value, store the result as a single-precision floating-point element in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMADD_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMADD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMADDSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMSUB_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and subtract the lower element in c from the intermediate result. Store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMSUB_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and subtract the lower element in c from the intermediate result. Store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMSUBADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FMSUBADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FNMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FNMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FNMADD_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the negated intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FNMADD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the negated intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FNMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FNMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := -(a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FNMSUB_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and subtract the lower element in c from the negated intermediate result. Store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FNMSUB_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and subtract the lower element in c from the negated intermediate result. Store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_FPCLASS_PD_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k. imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP64(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FPCLASS_PS_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k. imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP32(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FPCLASS_SD_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the result in mask vector k. imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: k[0] := CheckFPClass_FP64(a[63:0], imm8[7:0]) k[MAX:1] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FPCLASS_SS_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the result in mask vector k. imm" can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: k[0] := CheckFPClass_FP32(a[31:0], imm8[7:0]) k[MAX:1] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_FREE
intrinsic.desc: Free aligned memory that was allocated with _mm_malloc.

intrinsic.name: _MM_GET_EXCEPTION_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Get the exception mask bits from the MXCSR control and status register. The exception mask may contain any of the following flags: _MM_MASK_INVALID, _MM_MASK_DIV_ZERO, _MM_MASK_DENORM, _MM_MASK_OVERFLOW, _MM_MASK_UNDERFLOW, _MM_MASK_INEXACT
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MXCSR & _MM_MASK_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_GET_EXCEPTION_STATE
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Get the exception state bits from the MXCSR control and status register. The exception state may contain any of the following flags: _MM_EXCEPT_INVALID, _MM_EXCEPT_DIV_ZERO, _MM_EXCEPT_DENORM, _MM_EXCEPT_OVERFLOW, _MM_EXCEPT_UNDERFLOW, _MM_EXCEPT_INEXACT
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MXCSR & _MM_EXCEPT_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_GET_FLUSH_ZERO_MODE
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Get the flush zero bits from the MXCSR control and status register. The flush zero may contain any of the following flags: _MM_FLUSH_ZERO_ON or _MM_FLUSH_ZERO_OFF
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MXCSR & _MM_FLUSH_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_GET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Get the rounding mode bits from the MXCSR control and status register. The rounding mode may contain any of the following flags: _MM_ROUND_NEAREST, _MM_ROUND_DOWN, _MM_ROUND_UP, _MM_ROUND_TOWARD_ZERO
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MXCSR & _MM_ROUND_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETCSR
intrinsic.desc: Get the unsigned 32-bit value of the MXCSR control and status register.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MXCSR

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETEXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETEXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETEXP_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETEXP_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETEXP_SD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element.

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETEXP_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element.

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETMANT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETMANT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETMANT_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[63:0], sc, interv) dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETMANT_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[31:0], sc, interv) dst[127:32] := b[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETMANT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[63:0], sc, interv) dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_GETMANT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[31:0], sc, interv) dst[127:32] := b[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_HADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HADD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 32-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 32-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HADD_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HADD_PI32
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 32-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 32-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HADDS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HADDS_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HSUB_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HSUB_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 32-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 32-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HSUB_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HSUB_PI32
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 32-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 32-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HSUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HSUBS_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_HYPOT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the length of the hypotenous of a right triangle, with the lengths of the other two sides of the triangle stored as packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SQRT(a[i+63:i]^2 + b[i+63:i]^2) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_HYPOT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the length of the hypotenous of a right triangle, with the lengths of the other two sides of the triangle stored as packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]^2 + b[i+31:i]^2) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I32GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I32GATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Gather 64-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 m := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I32GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Gather double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 m := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I32GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Gather single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I32SCATTER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 32-bit integers from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_I32SCATTER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 64-bit integers from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 l := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+31:l])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_I32SCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scatter double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 l := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+31:l])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_I32SCATTER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scatter single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_I64GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 m := j*64 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I64GATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Gather 64-bit integers from memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I64GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Gather double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I64GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Gather single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 m := j*64 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_I64SCATTER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 32-bit integers from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 l := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+63:l])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_I64SCATTER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 64-bit integers from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_I64SCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scatter double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_I64SCATTER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scatter single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale) subject to mask k (elements are not stored when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 l := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+63:l])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_IDIV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_IDIVREM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, store the truncated results in dst, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers into memory at mem_addr.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_INSERT_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 16-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM_INSERT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 32-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM_INSERT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 64-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM_INSERT_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the lower 8-bit integer from i into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM_INSERT_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 16-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM_INSERT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to tmp, then insert a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from b into tmp using the control in imm8. Store tmp to dst using the mask in imm8 (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding bit is set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_INVCBRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cube root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := InvCubeRoot(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_INVCBRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cube root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := InvCubeRoot(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_INVSQRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := InvSQRT(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_INVSQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := InvSQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_IREM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LDDQU_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Load 128-bits of integer data from unaligned memory into dst. This intrinsic may perform better than _mm_loadu_si128 when the data crosses a cache line boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LFENCE
intrinsic.desc: Perform a serializing operation on all load-from-memory instructions that were issued prior to this instruction. Guarantees that every load instruction that precedes, in program order, is globally visible before any load instruction which follows the fence in program order.

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load 128-bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from memory into dst. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD_PD1
intrinsic.desc: Load a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from memory into both elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] dst[127:64] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Load 128-bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from memory into dst. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD_PS1
intrinsic.desc: Load a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from memory into all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[63:32] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[95:64] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[127:96] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD_SD
intrinsic.desc: Load a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from memory into the lower of dst, and zero the upper element. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] dst[127:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Load 128-bits of integer data from memory into dst. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Load a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from memory into the lower of dst, and zero the upper 3 elements. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[127:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD1_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from memory into both elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] dst[127:64] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOAD1_PS
intrinsic.desc: Load a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from memory into all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[63:32] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[95:64] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[127:96] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADDUP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from memory into both elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] tmp[127:64] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from memory into the upper element of dst, and copy the lower element from a to dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := a[63:0] dst[127:64] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADH_PI
intrinsic.desc: Load 2 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory into the upper 2 elements of dst, and copy the lower 2 elements from a to dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := a[31:0] dst[63:32] := a[63:32] dst[95:64] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[127:96] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr+32]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADL_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Load 64-bit integer from memory into the first element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from memory into the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] dst[127:64] := a[127:64]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADL_PI
intrinsic.desc: Load 2 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory into the lower 2 elements of dst, and copy the upper 2 elements from a to dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[63:32] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr+32] dst[95:64] := a[95:64] dst[127:96] := a[127:96]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load 2 double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory into dst in reverse order. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr+64] dst[127:64] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Load 4 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory into dst in reverse order. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr+96] dst[63:32] := MEM[mem_addr+95:mem_addr+64] dst[95:64] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr+32] dst[127:96] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load 128-bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from memory into dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_PS
intrinsic.desc: Load 128-bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from memory into dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Load 128-bits of integer data from memory into dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_SI16
intrinsic.desc: Load unaligned 16-bit integer from memory into the first element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := MEM[mem_addr+15:mem_addr] dst[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_SI16
intrinsic.desc: Load unaligned 16-bit integer from memory into the first element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := MEM[mem_addr+15:mem_addr] dst[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_SI32
intrinsic.desc: Load unaligned 32-bit integer from memory into the first element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_SI32
intrinsic.desc: Load unaligned 32-bit integer from memory into the first element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] dst[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Load unaligned 64-bit integer from memory into the first element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOADU_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Load unaligned 64-bit integer from memory into the first element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOG_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ln(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOG_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ln(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOG10_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the base-10 logarithm of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := log10(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOG10_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the base-10 logarithm of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := log10(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOG1P_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of one plus packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ln(1.0 + a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOG1P_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of one plus packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ln(1.0 + a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOG2_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the base-2 logarithm of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := log2(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOG2_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the base-2 logarithm of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := log2(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOGB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LOGB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LZCNT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 tmp := 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+31:i] := dst[i+31:i] + 1 OD ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_LZCNT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 tmp := 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+63:i] := dst[i+63:i] + 1 OD ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed signed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate signed 32-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate 32-bit integers, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MADD_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate 32-bit integers, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MADD52HI_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the high 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[103:52]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MADD52LO_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the low 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[51:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MADDUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Vertically multiply each unsigned 8-bit integer from a with the corresponding signed 8-bit integer from b, producing intermediate signed 16-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate signed 16-bit integers, and pack the saturated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i+8]*b[i+15:i+8] + a[i+7:i]*b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MADDUBS_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Vertically multiply each unsigned 8-bit integer from a with the corresponding signed 8-bit integer from b, producing intermediate signed 16-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate signed 16-bit integers, and pack the saturated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i+8]*b[i+15:i+8] + a[i+7:i]*b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MALLOC
intrinsic.desc: Allocate size bytes of memory, aligned to the alignment specified in align, and return a pointer to the allocated memory. _mm_free should be used to free memory that is allocated with _mm_malloc.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ABS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := ABS(a[i+15:i]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ABS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ABS(a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ABS_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 64-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ABS(a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ABS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i]) ELSE dst[i+7:i] := src[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ADD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ADD_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Add the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ADDS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ALIGNR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 32-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 32-bit elements, and store the low 16 bytes (4 elements) in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: temp[255:128] := a[127:0] temp[127:0] := b[127:0] temp[255:0] := temp[255:0] >> (32*count) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := temp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ALIGNR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 32-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 64-bit elements, and store the low 16 bytes (2 elements) in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: temp[255:128] := a[127:0] temp[127:0] := b[127:0] temp[255:0] := temp[255:0] >> (64*count) FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := temp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_ALIGNR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate pairs of 16-byte blocks in a and b into a 32-byte temporary result, shift the result right by count bytes, and store the low 16 bytes in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[255:0] := ((a[127:0] << 128) OR b[127:0]) >> (count[7:0]*8)
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := tmp_dst[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := src[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_CMP_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b based on the comparison operand specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k1 using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: CASE (imm8[7:0]) OF 0: OP := _MM_CMPINT_EQ 1: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LT 2: OP := _MM_CMPINT_LE 3: OP := _MM_CMPINT_FALSE 4: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NEQ 5: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLT 6: OP := _MM_CMPINT_NLE 7: OP := _MM_CMPINT_TRUE ESAC FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k1[j] k[j] := ( a[i+15:i] OP b[i+15:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k1[j] k[j] := ( a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] ) ? 1 : 0 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_COMPRESS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Contiguously store the active 32-bit integers in a (those with their respective bit set in writemask k) to dst, and pass through the remaining elements from src.
intrinsic.oper: size := 32 m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[m+size-1:m] := a[i+31:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR dst[127:m] := src[127:m] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: size := 32 m := base_addr FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] MEM[m+size-1:m] := a[i+31:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_CONFLICT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Test each 32-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[i] FOR l := 0 to j-1 m := l*32 dst[i+l] := (a[i+31:i] == a[m+31:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+31:i+j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_CONFLICT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Test each 64-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] FOR l := 0 to j-1 m := l*64 dst[i+l] := (a[i+63:i] == a[m+63:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+63:i+j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_CVT_ROUNDPS_PH
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed half-precision (16-bit) floating-point elements, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 16*j l := 32*j IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Convert_FP32_To_FP16FP(a[l+31:l]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_CVT_ROUNDSD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_CVT_ROUNDSS_SD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 l := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := SignExtend(a[l+15:l]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j l := 32*j IF k[j] MEM[base_addr+l+31:base_addr+l] := Saturate_UnsignedInt64_To_Int32(a[i+63:i]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_CVTUSEPI64_STOREU_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 8-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the active results (those with their respective bit set in writemask k) to unaligned memory at base_addr.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_DBSAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Four SADs are performed on four 8-bit quadruplets for each 64-bit lane. The first two SADs use the lower 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a, and the last two SADs use the uppper 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a. Quadruplets from b are selected according to the control in imm8, and each SAD in each 64-bit lane uses the selected quadruplet at 8-bit offsets.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_DIV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_DIV_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Divide the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a by the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FIXUPIMM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 64-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.

enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC

FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i], c[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }

CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
IF k[0] dst[31:0] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[31:0], b[31:0], c[31:0], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[31:0] := a[31:0] FI dst[127:32] := a[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FMADD_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FMADD_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from a when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FPCLASS_PD_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k using zeromask k1 (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k1[j] k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP64(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FPCLASS_PS_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k using zeromask k1 (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k1[j] k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP32(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FPCLASS_SD_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the result in mask vector k using zeromask k1 (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set). imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: IF k1[0] k[0] := CheckFPClass_FP64(a[63:0], imm8[7:0]) ELSE k[0] := 0 FI k[MAX:1] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_FPCLASS_SS_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the result in mask vector k using zeromask k1 (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set). imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: IF k1[0] k[0] := CheckFPClass_FP32(a[31:0], imm8[7:0]) ELSE k[0] := 0 FI k[MAX:1] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_GETEXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_GETEXP_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_GETMANT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_GETMANT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_GETMANT_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.sign: __M128D src,__MMASK8 k,__M128D a,__M128D b,_MM_MANTISSA_NORM_ENUM interv,_MM_MANTISSA_SIGN_ENUM sc,INT rounding
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[63:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[63:0], sc, interv) ELSE dst[63:0] := src[63:0] FI dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[31:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[31:0], sc, interv) ELSE dst[31:0] := src[31:0] FI dst[127:32] := b[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_I32GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using mask (elements are copied from src when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] mask[i+31] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR mask[MAX:128] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_LOAD_EPI32
