intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_LZCNT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] tmp := 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+31:i] := dst[i+31:i] + 1 OD ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_LZCNT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp := 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+63:i] := dst[i+63:i] + 1 OD ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate 32-bit integers, and pack the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i+16]*b[i+31:i+16] + a[i+15:i]*b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MADD52HI_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the high 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[103:52]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MADD52LO_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the low 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[51:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MADDUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a by packed signed 8-bit integers in b, producing intermediate signed 16-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate signed 16-bit integers, and pack the saturated results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i+8]*b[i+15:i+8] + a[i+7:i]*b[i+7:i] ) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MAX_EPI16

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MOVEDUP_PD

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MUL_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MULHI_EPI16

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MULHRS_EPI16

Truncate each intermediate integer to the 18 most significant bits, round by adding 1, and store bits [16:1] to dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] tmp[31:0] := ((a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i]) >> 14) + 1 dst[i+15:i] := tmp[16:1] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MULLO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the low 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[15:0] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MULLO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit integers, and store the low 32 bits of the intermediate integers in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] tmp[63:0] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[31:0] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MULLO_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 128-bit integers, and store the low 64 bits of the intermediate integers in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp[127:0] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[63:0] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_MULTISHIFT_EPI64_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: For each 64-bit element in b, select 8 unaligned bytes using a byte-granular shift control within the corresponding 64-bit element of a, and store the 8 assembled bytes to the corresponding 64-bit element of dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR i := 0 to 1 q := i * 64 FOR j := 0 to 7 tmp8 := 0 ctrl := a[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] & 63 FOR l := 0 to 7 tmp8[l] := b[q+((ctrl+l) & 63)] ENDFOR IF k[i*8+j] dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := tmp8[7:0] ELSE dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := src[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] FI ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_OR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] OR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_OR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] OR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_OR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] BITWISE OR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_OR_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] BITWISE OR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PACKS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[15:0]) tmp_dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[31:16]) tmp_dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[47:32]) tmp_dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[63:48]) tmp_dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[79:64]) tmp_dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[95:80]) tmp_dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[111:96]) tmp_dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[127:112]) tmp_dst[71:64] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[15:0]) tmp_dst[79:72] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[31:16]) tmp_dst[87:80] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[47:32]) tmp_dst[95:88] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[63:48]) tmp_dst[103:96] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[79:64]) tmp_dst[111:104] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[95:80]) tmp_dst[119:112] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[111:96]) tmp_dst[127:120] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[127:112])
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := tmp_dst[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := src[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PACKS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[31:0]) tmp_dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[63:32]) tmp_dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[95:64]) tmp_dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[127:96]) tmp_dst[79:64] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[31:0]) tmp_dst[95:80] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[63:32]) tmp_dst[111:96] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[95:64]) tmp_dst[127:112] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[127:96])
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := tmp_dst[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PACKUS_EPI16

intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[15:0]) tmp_dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[31:16]) tmp_dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[47:32]) tmp_dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[63:48]) tmp_dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[79:64]) tmp_dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[95:80]) tmp_dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[111:96]) tmp_dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[127:112]) tmp_dst[71:64] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[15:0]) tmp_dst[79:72] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[31:16]) tmp_dst[87:80] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[47:32]) tmp_dst[95:88] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[63:48]) tmp_dst[103:96] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[79:64]) tmp_dst[111:104] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[95:80]) tmp_dst[119:112] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[111:96]) tmp_dst[127:120] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[127:112])
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := tmp_dst[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := src[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PACKUS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[31:0]) tmp_dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[63:32]) tmp_dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[95:64]) tmp_dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[127:96]) tmp_dst[79:64] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[31:0]) tmp_dst[95:80] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[63:32]) tmp_dst[111:96] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[95:64]) tmp_dst[127:112] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[127:96])
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := tmp_dst[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT4(src, control){ CASE(control[1:0]) 0: tmp[31:0] := src[31:0] 1: tmp[31:0] := src[63:32] 2: tmp[31:0] := src[95:64] 3: tmp[31:0] := src[127:96] ESAC RETURN tmp[31:0] }
tmp_dst[31:0] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[1:0]) tmp_dst[63:32] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[3:2]) tmp_dst[95:64] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[5:4]) tmp_dst[127:96] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[7:6]) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp_dst[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEVAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEVAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT4(src, control){ CASE(control[1:0]) 0: tmp[31:0] := src[31:0] 1: tmp[31:0] := src[63:32] 2: tmp[31:0] := src[95:64] 3: tmp[31:0] := src[127:96] ESAC RETURN tmp[31:0] }
tmp_dst[31:0] := SELECT4(a[127:0], b[1:0]) tmp_dst[63:32] := SELECT4(a[127:0], b[33:32]) tmp_dst[95:64] := SELECT4(a[127:0], b[65:64]) tmp_dst[127:96] := SELECT4(a[127:0], b[97:96]) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp_dst[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] off := 16*idx[i+2:i] dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+15:off] : a[off+15:off] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 off := idx[i+1:i]*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 off := idx[i]*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+1] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] off := 8*idx[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+7:off] : a[off+7:off] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEX2VAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 off := idx[i]*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+1] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEX2VAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 off := idx[i+1:i]*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 id := idx[i+2:i]*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[id+15:id] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI8

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 id := idx[i+3:i]*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := a[id+7:id] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := src[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_RANGE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_RANGE_PS

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_RANGE_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.sign: __M128D src,__MMASK8 k,__M128D a,__M128D b,INT imm8,INT rounding
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_RANGE_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.sign: __M128 src,__MMASK8 k,__M128 a,__M128 b,INT imm8,INT rounding
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_RCP14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_SCALEF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_SHUFFLE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := SignExtend(a[i+63:i] >> count[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_SRL_EPI16

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_STORE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Store packed 32-bit integers from a into memory using writemask k. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_SUB_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_SUB_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Subtract the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b from the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_SUB_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Subtract the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b from the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from src when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_SUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 32-bit integer, the corresponding bit from src, a, and b are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst using writemask k at 32-bit granularity (32-bit elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] FOR h := 0 to 31 index[2:0] := (src[i+h] << 2) OR (a[i+h] << 1) OR b[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 64-bit integer, the corresponding bit from src, a, and b are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst using writemask k at 64-bit granularity (64-bit elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] FOR h := 0 to 63 index[2:0] := (src[i+h] << 2) OR (a[i+h] << 1) OR b[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_TEST_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 16-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k (subject to writemask k) if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k1[j] k[j] := ((a[i+15:i] AND b[i+15:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k1[j] k[j] := ((a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_XOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK_XOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] off := 16*idx[i+2:i] dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+15:off] : a[off+15:off] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 off := idx[i+1:i]*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 off := idx[i]*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+1] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] off := 8*idx[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+7:off] : a[off+7:off] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_PD

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 off := idx[i]*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+1] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 off := idx[i+1:i]*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK3_FMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK3_FMADD_PS

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK3_FMADD_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst using writemask k (the element is copied from c when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASK3_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKLOAD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 32-bit integers from memory into dst using mask (elements are zeroed out when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKLOAD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 64-bit integers from memory into dst using mask (elements are zeroed out when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF mask[i+63] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKLOAD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory into dst using mask (elements are zeroed out when the high bit of the corresponding element is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF mask[i+63] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKLOAD_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKMOVE_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Conditionally store 8-bit integer elements from a into memory using mask (elements are not stored when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element) and a non-temporal memory hint.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 IF mask[i+7] MEM[mem_addr+i+7:mem_addr+i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKMOVEU_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Conditionally store 8-bit integer elements from a into memory using mask (elements are not stored when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element) and a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF mask[i+7] MEM[mem_addr+i+7:mem_addr+i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKSTORE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Store packed 32-bit integers from a into memory using mask (elements are not stored when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ABS(a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ABS_EPI64

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i]) ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ADD_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Add the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ADD_SD

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ADDS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ADDS_EPI8

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ADDS_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ALIGNR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 32-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 32-bit elements, and store the low 16 bytes (4 elements) in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: temp[255:128] := a[127:0] temp[127:0] := b[127:0] temp[255:0] := temp[255:0] >> (32*count) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := temp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ALIGNR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 32-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 64-bit elements, and store the low 16 bytes (2 elements) in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: temp[255:128] := a[127:0] temp[127:0] := b[127:0] temp[255:0] := temp[255:0] >> (64*count) FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := temp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ALIGNR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate pairs of 16-byte blocks in a and b into a 32-byte temporary result, shift the result right by count bytes, and store the low 16 bytes in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[255:0] := ((a[127:0] << 128) OR b[127:0]) >> (count[7:0]*8)
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := tmp_dst[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_AND_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_AND_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_AND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ANDNOT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of packed 32-bit integers in a and then AND with b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (NOT a[i+31:i]) AND b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ANDNOT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of packed 64-bit integers in a and then AND with b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (NOT a[i+63:i]) AND b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ANDNOT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and then AND with b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ((NOT a[i+63:i]) AND b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ANDNOT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and then AND with b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ((NOT a[i+31:i]) AND b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_AVG_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Average packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := (a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] + 1) >> 1 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_AVG_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Average packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := (a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] + 1) >> 1 ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_BROADCAST_I32X2
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the lower 2 packed 32-bit integers from a to all elements of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 n := (j mod 2)*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[n+31:n] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_BROADCASTB_EPI8

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[15:0] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_COMPRESS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Contiguously store the active 32-bit integers in a (those with their respective bit set in zeromask k) to dst, and set the remaining elements to zero.
intrinsic.oper: size := 32 m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[m+size-1:m] := a[i+31:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR dst[127:m] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_COMPRESS_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Contiguously store the active 64-bit integers in a (those with their respective bit set in zeromask k) to dst, and set the remaining elements to zero.
intrinsic.oper: size := 64 m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[m+size-1:m] := a[i+63:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR dst[127:m] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_COMPRESS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Contiguously store the active double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a (those with their respective bit set in zeromask k) to dst, and set the remaining elements to zero.
intrinsic.oper: size := 64 m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[m+size-1:m] := a[i+63:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR dst[127:m] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_COMPRESS_PS
intrinsic.desc: Contiguously store the active single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a (those with their respective bit set in zeromask k) to dst, and set the remaining elements to zero.
intrinsic.oper: size := 32 m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[m+size-1:m] := a[i+31:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR dst[127:m] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_CONFLICT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Test each 32-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[i] FOR l := 0 to j-1 m := l*32 dst[i+l] := (a[i+31:i] == a[m+31:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+31:i+j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_CONFLICT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Test each 64-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] FOR l := 0 to j-1 m := l*64 dst[i+l] := (a[i+63:i] == a[m+63:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+63:i+j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_CVT_ROUNDPS_PH
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed half-precision (16-bit) floating-point elements, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 16*j l := 32*j IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Convert_FP32_To_FP16FP(a[l+31:l]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_CVT_ROUNDSD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_CVT_ROUNDSS_SD

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_CVTEPI16_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Sign extend packed 16-bit integers in a to packed 32-bit integers, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j l := 16*j IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := SignExtend(a[l+15:l]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_CVTEPI16_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Sign extend packed 16-bit integers in the low 4 bytes of a to packed 64-bit integers, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j l := 16*j IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := SignExtend(a[l+15:l]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_CVTEPI16_EPI8

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_DBSAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Four SADs are performed on four 8-bit quadruplets for each 64-bit lane. The first two SADs use the lower 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a, and the last two SADs use the uppper 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a. Quadruplets from b are selected according to the control in imm8, and each SAD in each 64-bit lane uses the selected quadruplet at 8-bit offsets.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_DIV_PD

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := 64*j IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMADD_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMADD_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

Store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMADD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and add the intermediate result to the lower element in c. Store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMADDSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and subtract the lower element in c from the intermediate result. intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMSUBADD_PD

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_FMSUBADD_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETEXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETEXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETEXP_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[63:0] := ConvertExpFP64(b[63:0]) ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[127:64] := a[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETEXP_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[31:0] := ConvertExpFP32(b[31:0]) ELSE dst[31:0] := 0 FI dst[127:32] := a[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETEXP_SD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element.
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[63:0] := ConvertExpFP64(b[63:0]) ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[127:64] := a[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for the lower element.
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[31:0] := ConvertExpFP32(b[31:0]) ELSE dst[31:0] := 0 FI dst[127:32] := a[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETMANT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETMANT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETMANT_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.sign: __MMASK8 k,__M128D a,__M128D b,_MM_MANTISSA_NORM_ENUM interv,_MM_MANTISSA_SIGN_ENUM sc,INT rounding
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[63:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[63:0], sc, interv) ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETMANT_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.sign: __MMASK8 k,__M128 a,__M128 b,_MM_MANTISSA_NORM_ENUM interv,_MM_MANTISSA_SIGN_ENUM sc,INT rounding
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[31:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[31:0], sc, interv) ELSE dst[31:0] := 0 FI dst[127:32] := b[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETMANT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[63:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[63:0], sc, interv) ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_GETMANT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[31:0] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[31:0], sc, interv) ELSE dst[31:0] := 0 FI dst[127:32] := b[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOAD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 32-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOAD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 64-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOAD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOAD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Load packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOAD_SD
intrinsic.desc: Load a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from memory into the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and set the upper element of dst to zero. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[63:0] := MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOAD_SS
intrinsic.desc: Load a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from memory into the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and set the upper elements of dst to zero. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: IF k[0] dst[31:0] := MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] ELSE dst[31:0] := 0 FI dst[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOADU_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 16-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+15:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOADU_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 32-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+7:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOADU_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memoy into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LOADU_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LZCNT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] tmp := 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+31:i] := dst[i+31:i] + 1 OD ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_LZCNT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp := 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+63:i] := dst[i+63:i] + 1 OD ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate 32-bit integers, and pack the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i+16]*b[i+31:i+16] + a[i+15:i]*b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MADD52HI_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the high 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[103:52]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MADD52LO_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the low 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[51:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MADDUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a by packed signed 8-bit integers in b, producing intermediate signed 16-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate signed 16-bit integers, and pack the saturated results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i+8]*b[i+15:i+8] + a[i+7:i]*b[i+7:i] ) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MAX_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOV_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Move packed 16-bit integers from a into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Move packed 32-bit integers from a into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOV_PD
