intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Move packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOVE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Move the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from b to the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOVE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Move the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from b to the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOVEDUP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate even-indexed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: tmp[63:0] := a[63:0] tmp[127:64] := a[63:0] FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOVEHDUP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate odd-indexed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MOVELDUP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate even-indexed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MUL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low 32-bit integers from each packed 64-bit element in a and b, and store the signed 64-bit results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MUL_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low unsigned 32-bit integers from each packed 64-bit element in a and b, and store the unsigned 64-bit results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MUL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MUL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MUL_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MUL_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MUL_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MUL_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MULHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MULHI_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := o FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MULHRS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate signed 32-bit integers. Truncate each intermediate integer to the 18 most significant bits, round by adding 1, and store bits [16:1] to dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] tmp[31:0] := ((a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i]) >> 14) + 1 dst[i+15:i] := tmp[16:1] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 9 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MULLO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the low 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[15:0] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MULLO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit integers, and store the low 32 bits of the intermediate integers in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] tmp[63:0] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[31:0] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MULLO_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 128-bit integers, and store the low 64 bits of the intermediate integers in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp[127:0] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[63:0] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_MULTISHIFT_EPI64_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: For each 64-bit element in b, select 8 unaligned bytes using a byte-granular shift control within the corresponding 64-bit element of a, and store the 8 assembled bytes to the corresponding 64-bit element of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR i := 0 to 1 q := i * 64 FOR j := 0 to 7 tmp8 := 0 ctrl := a[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] & 63 FOR l := 0 to 7 tmp8[l] := b[q+((ctrl+l) & 63)] ENDFOR IF k[i*8+j] dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := tmp8[7:0] ELSE dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := 0 FI ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_OR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] OR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_OR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] OR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_OR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] BITWISE OR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_OR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] BITWISE OR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PACKS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[15:0]) tmp_dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[31:16]) tmp_dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[47:32]) tmp_dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[63:48]) tmp_dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[79:64]) tmp_dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[95:80]) tmp_dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[111:96]) tmp_dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[127:112]) tmp_dst[71:64] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[15:0]) tmp_dst[79:72] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[31:16]) tmp_dst[87:80] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[47:32]) tmp_dst[95:88] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[63:48]) tmp_dst[103:96] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[79:64]) tmp_dst[111:104] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[95:80]) tmp_dst[119:112] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[111:96]) tmp_dst[127:120] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[127:112])
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := tmp_dst[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PACKS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[31:0]) tmp_dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[63:32]) tmp_dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[95:64]) tmp_dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[127:96]) tmp_dst[79:64] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[31:0]) tmp_dst[95:80] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[63:32]) tmp_dst[111:96] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[95:64]) tmp_dst[127:112] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[127:96])
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := tmp_dst[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PACKUS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[15:0]) tmp_dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[31:16]) tmp_dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[47:32]) tmp_dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[63:48]) tmp_dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[79:64]) tmp_dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[95:80]) tmp_dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[111:96]) tmp_dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[127:112]) tmp_dst[71:64] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[15:0]) tmp_dst[79:72] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[31:16]) tmp_dst[87:80] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[47:32]) tmp_dst[95:88] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[63:48]) tmp_dst[103:96] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[79:64]) tmp_dst[111:104] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[95:80]) tmp_dst[119:112] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[111:96]) tmp_dst[127:120] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[127:112])
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := tmp_dst[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PACKUS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
tmp_dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[31:0]) tmp_dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[63:32]) tmp_dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[95:64]) tmp_dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[127:96]) tmp_dst[79:64] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[31:0]) tmp_dst[95:80] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[63:32]) tmp_dst[111:96] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[95:64]) tmp_dst[127:112] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[127:96])
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := tmp_dst[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT4(src, control){ CASE(control[1:0]) 0: tmp[31:0] := src[31:0] 1: tmp[31:0] := src[63:32] 2: tmp[31:0] := src[95:64] 3: tmp[31:0] := src[127:96] ESAC RETURN tmp[31:0] }
tmp_dst[31:0] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[1:0]) tmp_dst[63:32] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[3:2]) tmp_dst[95:64] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[5:4]) tmp_dst[127:96] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[7:6]) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp_dst[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEVAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEVAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT4(src, control){ CASE(control[1:0]) 0: tmp[31:0] := src[31:0] 1: tmp[31:0] := src[63:32] 2: tmp[31:0] := src[95:64] 3: tmp[31:0] := src[127:96] ESAC RETURN tmp[31:0] }
tmp_dst[31:0] := SELECT4(a[127:0], b[1:0]) tmp_dst[63:32] := SELECT4(a[127:0], b[33:32]) tmp_dst[95:64] := SELECT4(a[127:0], b[65:64]) tmp_dst[127:96] := SELECT4(a[127:0], b[97:96]) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp_dst[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] off := 16*idx[i+2:i] dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+15:off] : a[off+15:off] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 off := idx[i+1:i]*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (idx[i+2]) ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 off := idx[i]*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (idx[i+1]) ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] off := 8*idx[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+7:off] : a[off+7:off] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEX2VAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 off := idx[i]*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (idx[i+1]) ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEX2VAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 off := idx[i+1:i]*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (idx[i+2]) ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 id := idx[i+2:i]*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[id+15:id] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 id := idx[i+3:i]*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := a[id+7:id] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RANGE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RANGE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RANGE_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RANGE_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RANGE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RANGE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RCP14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RCP14_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RCP14_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RCP14_SS

The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_REDUCE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPD(src1[63:0], imm8[7:0]) { m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[63:0] := pow(2, -m) * ROUND(pow(2, m) * src1[63:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[63:0] := src1[63:0] - tmp[63:0] RETURN tmp[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ReduceArgumentPD(src[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_REDUCE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPS(src1[31:0], imm8[7:0]) { IF src1[31:0] == NAN RETURN (convert src1[31:0] to QNaN) FI
m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[31:0] := pow(2, -m)*ROUND(pow(2, m)*src1[31:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[31:0] := src1[31:0] - tmp[31:0] RETURN tmp[31:0] } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ReduceArgumentPS(src[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_REDUCE_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPD(src1[63:0], imm8[7:0]) { m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[63:0] := pow(2, -m) * ROUND(pow(2, m) * src1[63:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[63:0] := src1[63:0] - tmp[63:0] RETURN tmp[63:0] }
IF k[0] dst[63:0] := ReduceArgumentPD(a[63:0], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPD(src1[63:0], imm8[7:0]) { m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[63:0] := pow(2, -m) * ROUND(pow(2, m) * src1[63:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[63:0] := src1[63:0] - tmp[63:0] RETURN tmp[63:0] }
IF k[0] dst[63:0] := ReduceArgumentPD(a[63:0], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_REDUCE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ROL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ROLV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src >>count) OR (src << (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src >> count) OR (src << (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src >>count) OR (src << (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RORV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src >> count) OR (src << (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ROUNDSCALE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ROUNDSCALE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPS(src[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 1: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 2: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 3: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) ESAC
dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ROUNDSCALE_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Round the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
IF k[0] dst[63:0] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[63:0], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_ROUNDSCALE_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Round the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, store the result in the lower element of dst using zeromask k (the element is zeroed out when mask bit 0 is not set), and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPS(src[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 1: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 2: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 3: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) ESAC
dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
IF k[0] dst[31:0] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[31:0], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[31:0] := 0 FI dst[127:32] := b[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
IF k[0] dst[63:0] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[63:0], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[63:0] := 0 FI dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_RSQRT14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+63:i])) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_SCALEF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_SET1_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low packed 16-bit integer from a to all elements of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[15:0] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 32-bit integer a to all elements of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[31:0] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT4(src, control){ CASE(control[1:0]) 0: tmp[31:0] := src[31:0] 1: tmp[31:0] := src[63:32] 2: tmp[31:0] := src[95:64] 3: tmp[31:0] := src[127:96] ESAC RETURN tmp[31:0] }
tmp_dst[31:0] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[1:0]) tmp_dst[63:32] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[3:2]) tmp_dst[95:64] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[5:4]) tmp_dst[127:96] := SELECT4(a[127:0], imm8[7:6]) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp_dst[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle packed 8-bit integers in a according to shuffle control mask in the corresponding 8-bit element of b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] IF b[i+7] == 1 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[3:0] := b[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[index*8+7:index*8] FI ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_PD

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_SLL_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << count[63:0]) FI ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 32-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst using zeromask k at 32-bit granularity (32-bit elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_XOR_PD

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MASKZ_XOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF a[i+31:i] > b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF a[i+63:i] > b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] > b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF a[i+31:i] > b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF a[i+63:i] > b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] > b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MAX(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MAX(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_PU8
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] > b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, store the maximum value in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, store the maximum value in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, store the maximum value in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MAX_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, store the maximum value in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MFENCE
intrinsic.desc: Perform a serializing operation on all load-from-memory and store-to-memory instructions that were issued prior to this instruction. Guarantees that every memory access that precedes, in program order, the memory fence instruction is globally visible before any memory instruction which follows the fence in program order.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MIN_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] < b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MIN_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF a[i+63:i] < b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] < b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MIN_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF a[i+63:i] < b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MIN(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MIN_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] < b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MIN(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MIN_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, store the minimum value in the lower element of dst , and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MIN_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, store the minimum value in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MIN_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, store the minimum value in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.
