intrinsic.name: _MM_MINPOS_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally compute the minimum amongst the packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a, store the minimum and index in dst, and zero the remaining bits in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MMASK_I32GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MMASK_I32GATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Gather 64-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 m := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MMASK_I32GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Gather double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 m := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MMASK_I32GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Gather single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MMASK_I64GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 m := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0 dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MMASK_I64GATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Gather 64-bit integers from memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MMASK_I64GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Gather double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0 dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MMASK_I64GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Gather single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 m := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0 dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MONITOR
intrinsic.desc: Arm address monitoring hardware using the address specified in p. A store to an address within the specified address range triggers the monitoring hardware. Specify optional extensions in extensions, and optional hints in hints.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVE_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Copy the lower 64-bit integer in a to the lower element of dst, and zero the upper element.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Move the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from b to the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Move the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from b to the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEDUP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate the low double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from a, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEHDUP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate odd-indexed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEHL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Move the upper 2 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from b to the lower 2 elements of dst, and copy the upper 2 elements from a to the upper 2 elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVELDUP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate even-indexed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVELH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Move the lower 2 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from b to the upper 2 elements of dst, and copy the lower 2 elements from a to the lower 2 elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEMASK_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Create mask from the most significant bit of each 8-bit element in a, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[j] := a[i+7] ENDFOR dst[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEMASK_PD
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask dst based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF a[i+63] dst[j] := 1 ELSE dst[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEMASK_PI8
intrinsic.desc: Create mask from the most significant bit of each 8-bit element in a, and store the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[j] := a[i+7] ENDFOR dst[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEMASK_PS
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask dst based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF a[i+31] dst[j] := 1 ELSE dst[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 16-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF a[i+15] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 32-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF a[i+31] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 64-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF a[i+63] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEPI64_PI64
intrinsic.desc: Copy the lower 64-bit integer in a to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVEPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 8-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF a[i+7] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVM_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 16-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := 0xFFFF ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 32-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := 0xFFFFFFFF ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVM_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 64-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := 0xFFFFFFFFffffffff ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVM_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 8-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := 0xFF ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MOVPI64_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Copy the 64-bit integer a to the lower element of dst, and zero the upper element.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MPSADBW_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst. Eight SADs are performed using one quadruplet from b and eight quadruplets from a. One quadruplet is selected from b starting at on the offset specified in imm8. Eight quadruplets are formed from sequential 8-bit integers selected from a starting at the offset specified in imm8.
intrinsic.oper:
MPSADBW(a[127:0], b[127:0], imm8[2:0]) { a_offset := imm8[2]*32 b_offset := imm8[1:0]*32 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 k := a_offset+i l := b_offset tmp[i+15:i] := ABS(a[k+7:k] - b[l+7:l]) + ABS(a[k+15:k+8] - b[l+15:l+8]) + ABS(a[k+23:k+16] - b[l+23:l+16]) + ABS(a[k+31:k+24] - b[l+31:l+24]) ENDFOR RETURN tmp[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := MPSADBW(a[127:0], b[127:0], imm8[2:0])

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low 32-bit integers from each packed 64-bit element in a and b, and store the signed 64-bit results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low unsigned 32-bit integers from each packed 64-bit element in a and b, and store the unsigned 64-bit results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_SD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_SS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MUL_SU32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low unsigned 32-bit integers from a and b, and store the unsigned 64-bit result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULHI_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULHI_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULHI_PU16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULHRS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate signed 32-bit integers. Truncate each intermediate integer to the 18 most significant bits, round by adding 1, and store bits [16:1] to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULHRS_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate signed 32-bit integers. Truncate each intermediate integer to the 18 most significant bits, round by adding 1, and store bits [16:1] to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULLO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the low 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[15:0] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULLO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit integers, and store the low 32 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 tmp[63:0] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[31:0] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULLO_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 128-bit integers, and store the low 64 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 tmp[127:0] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULLO_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the low 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[15:0] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_MULTISHIFT_EPI64_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: For each 64-bit element in b, select 8 unaligned bytes using a byte-granular shift control within the corresponding 64-bit element of a, and store the 8 assembled bytes to the corresponding 64-bit element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR i := 0 to 1 q := i * 64 FOR j := 0 to 7 tmp8 := 0 ctrl := a[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] & 63 FOR l := 0 to 7 tmp8[l] := b[q+((ctrl+l) & 63)] ENDFOR dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := tmp8[7:0] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_MWAIT
intrinsic.desc: Hint to the processor that it can enter an implementation-dependent-optimized state while waiting for an event or store operation to the address range specified by MONITOR.

intrinsic.name: _MM_OR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] BITWISE OR b[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_OR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] BITWISE OR b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_OR_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_OR_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of 64 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_PACKS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[63:48]) dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[79:64]) dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[95:80]) dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[111:96]) dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[127:112]) dst[71:64] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[15:0]) dst[79:72] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[31:16]) dst[87:80] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[47:32]) dst[95:88] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[63:48]) dst[103:96] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[79:64]) dst[111:104] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[95:80]) dst[119:112] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[111:96]) dst[127:120] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[127:112])

intrinsic.name: _MM_PACKS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[31:0]) dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[63:32]) dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[95:64]) dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[127:96]) dst[79:64] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[31:0]) dst[95:80] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[63:32]) dst[111:96] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[95:64]) dst[127:112] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[127:96])

intrinsic.name: _MM_PACKS_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[63:48]) dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[15:0]) dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[31:16]) dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[47:32]) dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[63:48])

intrinsic.name: _MM_PACKS_PI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[31:0]) dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[63:32]) dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[31:0]) dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[63:32])

intrinsic.name: _MM_PACKS_PU16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[63:48]) dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[15:0]) dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[31:16]) dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[47:32]) dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[63:48])

intrinsic.name: _MM_PACKUS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[63:48]) dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[79:64]) dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[95:80]) dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[111:96]) dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[127:112]) dst[71:64] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[15:0]) dst[79:72] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[31:16]) dst[87:80] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[47:32]) dst[95:88] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[63:48]) dst[103:96] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[79:64]) dst[111:104] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[95:80]) dst[119:112] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[111:96]) dst[127:120] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[127:112])

intrinsic.name: _MM_PACKUS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[31:0]) dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[63:32]) dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[95:64]) dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[127:96]) dst[79:64] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[31:0]) dst[95:80] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[63:32]) dst[111:96] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[95:64]) dst[127:112] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[127:96])

intrinsic.name: _MM_PAUSE
intrinsic.desc: Provide a hint to the processor that the code sequence is a spin-wait loop. This can help improve the performance and power consumption of spin-wait loops.

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEVAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEVAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 off := 16*idx[i+2:i] dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+15:off] : a[off+15:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 off := idx[i+2:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 off := idx[i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+1] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 off := 8*idx[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+7:off] : a[off+7:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEX2VAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 off := idx[i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+1] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEX2VAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 off := idx[i+1:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 id := idx[i+2:i]*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[id+15:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 id := idx[i+3:i]*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[id+7:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_POPCNT_U32
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of bits set to 1 in unsigned 32-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := 0 FOR i := 0 to 31 IF a[i] dst := dst + 1 FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_POPCNT_U64
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of bits set to 1 in unsigned 64-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := 0 FOR i := 0 to 63 IF a[i] dst := dst + 1 FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_POW_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a raised by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i])^(b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_POW_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a raised by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i])^(b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_PREFETCH
intrinsic.desc: Fetch the line of data from memory that contains address p to a location in the cache heirarchy specified by the locality hint i.

intrinsic.name: _MM_PREFETCH
intrinsic.instr: VPREFETCH0, VPREFETCH1, VPREFETCH2, VPREFETCHNTA, VPREFETCHE0, VPREFETCHE1, VPREFETCHE2, VPREFETCHENTA
intrinsic.desc: Fetch the line of data from memory that contains address p to a location in the cache heirarchy specified by the locality hint i.

intrinsic.name: _MM_PREFETCH
intrinsic.desc: Fetch the line of data from memory that contains address p to a location in the cache heirarchy specified by the locality hint i.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RANGE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RANGE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RANGE_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_RANGE_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 1.5*2^-12.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 1.5*2^-12.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP14_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP14_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP14_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP28_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP28_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. intrinsic.name: _MM_RCP28_SS

intrinsic.name: _MM_REDUCE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPD(src1[63:0], imm8[7:0]) { m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[63:0] := pow(2, -m) * ROUND(pow(2, m) * src1[63:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[63:0] := src1[63:0] - tmp[63:0] RETURN tmp[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ReduceArgumentPD(src[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_REM_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ROL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the rounding parameter, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ROUND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_ROUNDSCALE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
dst[31:0] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[31:0], imm8[7:0]) dst[127:32] := b[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_RSQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 1.5*2^-12.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+31:i])) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_RSQRT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 1.5*2^-12.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RSQRT14_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RSQRT14_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RSQRT28_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_RSQRT28_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_RSQRT28_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28.

intrinsic.name: _MM_RSQRT28_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute differences of packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, then horizontally sum each consecutive 8 differences to produce two unsigned 16-bit integers, and pack these unsigned 16-bit integers in the low 16 bits of 64-bit elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 tmp[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+15:i] := tmp[i+7:i] + tmp[i+15:i+8] + tmp[i+23:i+16] + tmp[i+31:i+24] + tmp[i+39:i+32] + tmp[i+47:i+40] + tmp[i+55:i+48] + tmp[i+63:i+56] dst[i+63:i+16] := 0 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SAD_PU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute differences of packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, then horizontally sum each consecutive 8 differences to produce four unsigned 16-bit integers, and pack these unsigned 16-bit integers in the low 16 bits of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SCALEF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SCALEF_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[31:0] := tmp_src1[31:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[31:0])) RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SCALEF_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
dst[63:0] := SCALE(a[63:0], b[63:0]) dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SCALEF_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[31:0] := tmp_src1[31:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[31:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
dst[31:0] := SCALE(a[31:0], b[31:0]) dst[127:32] := b[127:32] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SCALEF_SD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
dst[63:0] := SCALE(a[63:0], b[63:0]) dst[127:64] := b[127:64] dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[31:0] := tmp_src1[31:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[31:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_EXCEPTION_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Set the exception mask bits of the MXCSR control and status register to the value in unsigned 32-bit integer a. The exception mask may contain any of the following flags: _MM_MASK_INVALID, _MM_MASK_DIV_ZERO, _MM_MASK_DENORM, _MM_MASK_OVERFLOW, _MM_MASK_UNDERFLOW, _MM_MASK_INEXACT
intrinsic.oper: MXCSR := a[31:0] AND ~_MM_MASK_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_EXCEPTION_STATE
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Set the exception state bits of the MXCSR control and status register to the value in unsigned 32-bit integer a. The exception state may contain any of the following flags: _MM_EXCEPT_INVALID, _MM_EXCEPT_DIV_ZERO, _MM_EXCEPT_DENORM, _MM_EXCEPT_OVERFLOW, _MM_EXCEPT_UNDERFLOW, _MM_EXCEPT_INEXACT
intrinsic.oper: MXCSR := a[31:0] AND ~_MM_EXCEPT_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_FLUSH_ZERO_MODE
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Set the flush zero bits of the MXCSR control and status register to the value in unsigned 32-bit integer a. The flush zero may contain any of the following flags: _MM_FLUSH_ZERO_ON or _MM_FLUSH_ZERO_OFF
intrinsic.oper: MXCSR := a[31:0] AND ~_MM_FLUSH_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_PD

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_PD1
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast double-precision (64-bit) floating-point value a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[63:0] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_PS1

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Set the rounding mode bits of the MXCSR control and status register to the value in unsigned 32-bit integer a. The rounding mode may contain any of the following flags: _MM_ROUND_NEAREST, _MM_ROUND_DOWN, _MM_ROUND_UP, _MM_ROUND_TOWARD_ZERO
intrinsic.oper: MXCSR := a[31:0] AND ~_MM_ROUND_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_SS

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET1_EPI16

intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m128d with all elements set to zero.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SETZERO_PS
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m128 with all elements set to zero.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SFENCE
intrinsic.desc: Perform a serializing operation on all store-to-memory instructions that were issued prior to this instruction. Guarantees that every store instruction that precedes, in program order, is globally visible before any store instruction which follows the fence in program order.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHA1MSG1_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Perform an intermediate calculation for the next four SHA1 message values (unsigned 32-bit integers) using previous message values from a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHA1MSG2_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Perform the final calculation for the next four SHA1 message values (unsigned 32-bit integers) using the intermediate result in a and the previous message values in b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHA1NEXTE_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Calculate SHA1 state variable E after four rounds of operation from the current SHA1 state variable a, add that value to the scheduled values (unsigned 32-bit integers) in b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHA1RNDS4_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Perform four rounds of SHA1 operation using an initial SHA1 state (A,B,C,D) from a and some pre-computed sum of the next 4 round message values (unsigned 32-bit integers), and state variable E from b, and store the updated SHA1 state (A,B,C,D) in dst. func contains the logic functions and round constants.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHA256MSG1_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Perform an intermediate calculation for the next four SHA256 message values (unsigned 32-bit integers) using previous message values from a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHA256MSG2_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Perform the final calculation for the next four SHA256 message values (unsigned 32-bit integers) using previous message values from a and b, and store the result in dst."

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHA256RNDS2_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Perform 2 rounds of SHA256 operation using an initial SHA256 state (C,D,G,H) from a, an initial SHA256 state (A,B,E,F) from b, and a pre-computed sum of the next 2 round message values (unsigned 32-bit integers) and the corresponding round constants from k, and store the updated SHA256 state (A,B,E,F) in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHUFFLE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHUFFLE_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle packed 8-bit integers in a according to shuffle control mask in the corresponding 8-bit element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF b[i+7] == 1 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[3:0] := b[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[index*8+7:index*8] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHUFFLE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHUFFLE_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHUFFLE_PI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle packed 8-bit integers in a according to shuffle control mask in the corresponding 8-bit element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 IF b[i+7] == 1 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[2:0] := b[i+2:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[index*8+7:index*8] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHUFFLE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHUFFLEHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in the high 64 bits of a using the control in imm8. Store the results in the high 64 bits of dst, with the low 64 bits being copied from from a to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SHUFFLELO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in the low 64 bits of a using the control in imm8. Store the results in the low 64 bits of dst, with the high 64 bits being copied from from a to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SIGN_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Negate packed 16-bit integers in a when the corresponding signed 16-bit integer in b is negative, and store the results in dst. Element in dst are zeroed out when the corresponding element in b is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF b[i+15:i] < 0 dst[i+15:i] := NEG(a[i+15:i]) ELSE IF b[i+15:i] = 0 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SIGN_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Negate packed 32-bit integers in a when the corresponding signed 32-bit integer in b is negative, and store the results in dst. Element in dst are zeroed out when the corresponding element in b is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF b[i+31:i] < 0 dst[i+31:i] := NEG(a[i+31:i]) ELSE IF b[i+31:i] = 0 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SIGN_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Negate packed 8-bit integers in a when the corresponding signed 8-bit integer in b is negative, and store the results in dst. Element in dst are zeroed out when the corresponding element in b is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF b[i+7:i] < 0 dst[i+7:i] := NEG(a[i+7:i]) ELSE IF b[i+7:i] = 0 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SIGN_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Negate packed 16-bit integers in a when the corresponding signed 16-bit integer in b is negative, and store the results in dst. Element in dst are zeroed out when the corresponding element in b is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 IF b[i+15:i] < 0 dst[i+15:i] := NEG(a[i+15:i]) ELSE IF b[i+15:i] = 0 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SIGN_PI32

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 IF b[i+31:i] < 0 dst[i+31:i] := NEG(a[i+31:i]) ELSE IF b[i+31:i] = 0 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SIGN_PI8

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 IF b[i+7:i] < 0 dst[i+7:i] := NEG(a[i+7:i]) ELSE IF b[i+7:i] = 0 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SIN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SIN(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SIN_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SIN(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SINCOS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sine and cosine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, store the sine in dst, and store the cosine into memory at mem_addr.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SIN(a[i+63:i]) MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] := COS(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SLLI_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Shift a left by imm8 bytes while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := imm8[7:0] IF tmp > 15 tmp := 16 FI dst[127:0] := a[127:0] << (tmp*8)

intrinsic.name: _MM_SLLI_SI64

intrinsic.oper: IF imm8[7:0] > 63 dst[63:0] := 0 ELSE dst[63:0] := ZeroExtend(a[63:0] << imm8[7:0]) FI

intrinsic.name: _MM_SLLV_EPI16

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << count[i+15:i]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SQRT_PD

intrinsic.name: _MM_SQRT_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SQRT_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_SQRT_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from b to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_SQRT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from b to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SQRT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+15:i] := SignExtend(a[i+15:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR
