intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE_PD1
intrinsic.desc: Store the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from a into 2 contiguous elements in memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0] MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr+64] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE_PS1
intrinsic.desc: Store the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from a into 4 contiguous elements in memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[31:0] MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr+32] := a[31:0] MEM[mem_addr+95:mem_addr+64] := a[31:0] MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr+96] := a[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Store the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits of integer data from a into memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Store the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE1_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from a into 2 contiguous elements in memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0] MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr+64] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORE1_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element from a into 4 contiguous elements in memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[31:0] MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr+32] := a[31:0] MEM[mem_addr+95:mem_addr+64] := a[31:0] MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr+96] := a[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store the upper double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from a into memory.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[127:64]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREH_PI
intrinsic.desc: Store the upper 2 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[95:64] MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr+32] := a[127:96]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREL_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Store 64-bit integer from the first element of a into memory.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element from a into memory.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREL_PI
intrinsic.desc: Store the lower 2 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[31:0] MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr+32] := a[63:32]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store 2 double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory in reverse order. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[127:64] MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr+64] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STORER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store 4 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory in reverse order. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[127:96] MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr+32] := a[95:64] MEM[mem_addr+95:mem_addr+64] := a[63:32] MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr+96] := a[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits of integer data from a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_SI16
intrinsic.desc: Store 16-bit integer from the first element of a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+15:mem_addr] := a[15:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_SI16
intrinsic.desc: Store 16-bit integer from the first element of a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+15:mem_addr] := a[15:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_SI32
intrinsic.desc: Store 32-bit integer from the first element of a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_SI32
intrinsic.desc: Store 32-bit integer from the first element of a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Store 64-bit integer from the first element of a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STOREU_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Store 64-bit integer from the first element of a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STREAM_LOAD_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Load 128-bits of integer data from memory into dst using a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STREAM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory using a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STREAM_PI
intrinsic.desc: Store 64-bits of integer data from a into memory using a non-temporal memory hint.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STREAM_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory using a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STREAM_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Store 128-bits of integer data from a into memory using a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+127:mem_addr] := a[127:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STREAM_SI32
intrinsic.desc: Store 32-bit integer a into memory using a non-temporal hint to minimize cache pollution. If the cache line containing address mem_addr is already in the cache, the cache will be updated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := a[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_STREAM_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Store 64-bit integer a into memory using a non-temporal hint to minimize cache pollution. If the cache line containing address mem_addr is already in the cache, the cache will be updated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+63:mem_addr] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 32-bit integers in b from packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 64-bit integers in b from packed 64-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] - b[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 8-bit integers in b from packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in b from packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] - b[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_PI32
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 32-bit integers in b from packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_PI8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 8-bit integers in b from packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in b from packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_ROUND_SD
intrinsic.desc: Subtract the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b from the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_ROUND_SS
intrinsic.desc: Subtract the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b from the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_SD
intrinsic.desc: Subtract the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in b from the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper element from a to the upper element of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Subtract 64-bit integer b from 64-bit integer a, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUB_SS
intrinsic.desc: Subtract the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in b from the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a, store the result in the lower element of dst, and copy the upper 3 packed elements from a to the upper elements of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUBS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 8-bit integers in b from packed 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_Int8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUBS_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 16-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUBS_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 8-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUBS_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUBS_PI8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 8-bit integers in b from packed 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_Int8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUBS_PU16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 16-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SUBS_PU8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 8-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_SVML_CEIL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a up to an integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundpd/vroundpd instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := CEIL(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SVML_CEIL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a up to an integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundps/vroundps instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := CEIL(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SVML_FLOOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a down to an integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundpd/vroundpd instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FLOOR(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SVML_FLOOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a down to an integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundps/vroundps instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FLOOR(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SVML_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the nearest integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundpd/vroundpd instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ROUND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SVML_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the nearest integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundps/vroundps instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ROUND(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SVML_SQRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. Note that this intrinsic is less efficient than _mm_sqrt_pd.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SQRT(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_SVML_SQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. Note that this intrinsic is less efficient than _mm_sqrt_ps.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TAN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TAN(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TAN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TAN(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TAND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TAND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TAND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TAND(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TANH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TANH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TANH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TANH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 32-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 FOR h := 0 to 31 index[2:0] := (a[i+h] << 2) OR (b[i+h] << 1) OR c[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 64-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 FOR h := 0 to 63 index[2:0] := (a[i+h] << 2) OR (b[i+h] << 1) OR c[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TEST_ALL_ONES
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with a 128-bit vector containing all 1's, and return 1 if the result is zero, otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.oper:
FOR j := 0 to 127 tmp[i] := 1 ENDFOR
IF ((NOT a[127:0]) AND tmp[127:0] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI RETURN CF

intrinsic.name: _MM_TEST_ALL_ZEROS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and mask, and return 1 if the result is zero, otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.oper: IF (a[127:0] AND mask[127:0] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI RETURN ZF

intrinsic.name: _MM_TEST_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 16-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 k[j] := ((a[i+15:i] AND b[i+15:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TEST_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ((a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TEST_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ((a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TEST_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 8-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 8-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ((a[i+7:i] AND b[i+7:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TEST_MIX_ONES_ZEROS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and mask, and set ZF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with mask, and set CF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return 1 if both the ZF and CF values are zero, otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.oper: IF (a[127:0] AND mask[127:0] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI IF ((NOT a[127:0]) AND mask[127:0] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI IF (ZF == 0 && CF == 0) RETURN 1 ELSE RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 128-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the CF value.
intrinsic.oper: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] AND b[127:0] IF (tmp[63] == tmp[127] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI tmp[127:0] := (NOT a[127:0]) AND b[127:0] IF (tmp[63] == tmp[127] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI RETURN CF

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 128-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the CF value.

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTC_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and set ZF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, and set CF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the CF value.
intrinsic.oper: IF (a[127:0] AND b[127:0] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI IF ((NOT a[127:0]) AND b[127:0] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI RETURN CF

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTN_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 16-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*16 k[j] := ((a[i+15:i] AND b[i+15:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTN_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 k[j] := ((a[i+31:i] NAND b[i+31:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTN_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 k[j] := ((a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:2] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTN_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 8-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 8-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 k[j] := ((a[i+7:i] AND b[i+7:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTNZC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 128-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return 1 if both the ZF and CF values are zero, otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.oper: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] AND b[127:0] IF (tmp[63] == tmp[127] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI tmp[127:0] := (NOT a[127:0]) AND b[127:0] IF (tmp[63] == tmp[127] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI IF (ZF == 0 && CF == 0) RETURN 1 ELSE RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTNZC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 128-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return 1 if both the ZF and CF values are zero, otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.oper: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] AND b[127:0] IF (tmp[31] == tmp[63] == tmp[95] == tmp[127] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI tmp[127:0] := (NOT a[127:0]) AND b[127:0] IF (tmp[31] == tmp[63] == tmp[95] == tmp[127] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI IF (ZF == 0 && CF == 0) RETURN 1 ELSE RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTNZC_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and set ZF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, and set CF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return 1 if both the ZF and CF values are zero, otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.oper: IF (a[127:0] AND b[127:0] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI IF ((NOT a[127:0]) AND b[127:0] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI IF (ZF == 0 && CF == 0) RETURN 1 ELSE RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTZ_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 128-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the ZF value.
intrinsic.oper: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] AND b[127:0] IF (tmp[63] == tmp[127] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI tmp[127:0] := (NOT a[127:0]) AND b[127:0] IF (tmp[63] == tmp[127] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI RETURN ZF

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTZ_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 128-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the ZF value.

intrinsic.name: _MM_TESTZ_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and set ZF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, and set CF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the ZF value.
intrinsic.oper: IF (a[127:0] AND b[127:0] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI IF ((NOT a[127:0]) AND b[127:0] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI RETURN ZF

intrinsic.name: _MM_TRANSPOSE4_PS
intrinsic.desc: Macro: Transpose the 4x4 matrix formed by the 4 rows of single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in row0, row1, row2, and row3, and store the transposed matrix in these vectors (row0 now contains column 0, etc.).

intrinsic.name: _MM_TRUNC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Truncate the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundpd/vroundpd instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TRUNC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Truncate the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundps/vroundps instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_TZCNT_32
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of trailing zero bits in unsigned 32-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 0 dst := 0 DO WHILE ((tmp < 32) AND a[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp + 1 dst := dst + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _MM_TZCNT_64
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of trailing zero bits in unsigned 64-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 0 dst := 0 DO WHILE ((tmp < 64) AND a[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp + 1 dst := dst + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _MM_TZCNTI_32
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of trailing bits in unsigned 32-bit integer x starting at bit a storing the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: count := 0 FOR j := a to 31 IF NOT(x[j] 1) count := count + 1 FI ENDFOR dst := count

intrinsic.name: _MM_TZCNTI_64
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of trailing bits in unsigned 64-bit integer x starting at bit a storing the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: count := 0 FOR j := a to 63 IF NOT(x[j] 1) count := count + 1 FI ENDFOR dst := count

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMIEQ_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for equality, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMIEQ_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for equality, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMIGE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMIGE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for greater-than-or-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMIGT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for greater-than, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMIGT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for greater-than, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMILE_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMILE_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for less-than-or-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMILT_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for less-than, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMILT_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for less-than, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMINEQ_SD
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a and b for not-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UCOMINEQ_SS
intrinsic.desc: Compare the lower single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a and b for not-equal, and return the boolean result (0 or 1). This instruction will not signal an exception for QNaNs.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UDIV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_UDIVREM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, store the truncated results in dst, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers into memory at mem_addr.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNDEFINED_PD
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m128d with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNDEFINED_PS
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m128 with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNDEFINED_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m128i with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNPACKHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNPACKHI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32-bit integers from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNPACKHI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 64-bit integers from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNPACKHI_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8-bit integers from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNPACKHI_PD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNPACKHI_PI16
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the high half of a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_WORDS(src1[63:0], src2[63:0]){ dst[15:0] := src1[47:32] dst[31:16] := src2[47:32] dst[47:32] := src1[63:48] dst[63:48] := src2[63:48] RETURN dst[63:0] }
dst[63:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_WORDS(a[63:0], b[63:0])

intrinsic.name: _MM_UNPACKHI_PI32

intrinsic.name: _MM_UREM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM_XOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_XOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM_XOR_SI128
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of 128 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM_XOR_SI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of 64 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ABS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := ABS(a[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ABS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ABS(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 64-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ACOSH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ACOSH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADD_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Add packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Add packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADDS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADDS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADDS_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADDS_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Alternatively add and subtract packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to/from packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] - b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ADDSUB_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ALIGNR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 64-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 32-bit elements, and store the low 32 bytes (8 elements) in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ALIGNR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 64-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 64-bit elements, and store the low 32 bytes (4 elements) in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ALIGNR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate pairs of 16-byte blocks in a and b into a 32-byte temporary result, shift the result right by count bytes, and store the low 16 bytes in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_AND_PD

intrinsic.name: _MM256_AND_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ANDNOT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and then AND with b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ANDNOT_PS

intrinsic.name: _MM256_BROADCAST_F32X2

intrinsic.name: _MM256_CONFLICT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Test each 32-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit. Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_CVTPS_PH
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed half-precision (16-bit) floating-point elements, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 16*j l := 32*j dst[i+15:i] := Convert_FP32_To_FP16FP(a[l+31:l]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_DBSAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst. Four SADs are performed on four 8-bit quadruplets for each 64-bit lane. The first two SADs use the lower 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a, and the last two SADs use the uppper 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a. Quadruplets from b are selected from within 128-bit lanes according to the control in imm8, and each SAD in each 64-bit lane uses the selected quadruplet at 8-bit offsets.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_DIV_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_DIV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 8*j dst[i+7:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+7:i] / b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0
