intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_DP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Conditionally multiply the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using the high 4 bits in imm8, sum the four products, and conditionally store the sum in dst using the low 4 bits of imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ERF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ERF_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ERFC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the complementary error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 - ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ERFC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the complementary error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 - ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ERFCINV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse complementary error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 / (1.0 - ERF(a[i+63:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ERFCINV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse complementary error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 / (1.0 - ERF(a[i+31:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ERFINV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 / ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ERFINV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 / ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := e^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := e^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXP10_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 10 raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 10^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXP10_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 10 raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 10^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXP2_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 2^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXP2_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 2^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXPM1_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, subtract one from each element, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := e^(a[i+63:i]) - 1.0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXPM1_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, subtract one from each element, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := e^(a[i+31:i]) - 1.0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACT_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Extract a 16-bit integer from a, selected with index, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Extract a 32-bit integer from a, selected with index, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Extract a 64-bit integer from a, selected with index, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACT_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Extract an 8-bit integer from a, selected with index, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACTF128_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACTF128_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACTF128_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of integer data) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACTF32X4_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACTF64X2_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACTI128_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of integer data) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACTI32X4_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 4 packed 32-bit integers) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_EXTRACTI64X2_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 2 packed 64-bit integers) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FIXUPIMM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 64-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i], c[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FIXUPIMM_PS
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 32-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN L= 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[31:0], src2[31:0], src3[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[31:0] := ((src2[30:23] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[31:0] CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i], c[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FLOOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a down to an integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FLOOR(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FLOOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a down to an integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FLOOR(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FMADDSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FMSUBADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FMSUBADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FNMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FNMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FNMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FNMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := -(a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FPCLASS_PD_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k. imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP64(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_FPCLASS_PS_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k. imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP32(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_GETEXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_GETEXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_GETMANT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_GETMANT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HADD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 32-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 32-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HADDS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HSUB_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HSUB_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 32-bit integers in a and b, and pack the signed 32-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally add adjacent pairs of single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HSUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Horizontally subtract adjacent pairs of 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and pack the signed 16-bit results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HYPOT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the length of the hypotenous of a right triangle, with the lengths of the other two sides of the triangle stored as packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SQRT(a[i+63:i]^2 + b[i+63:i]^2) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_HYPOT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the length of the hypotenous of a right triangle, with the lengths of the other two sides of the triangle stored as packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]^2 + b[i+31:i]^2) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I32GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I32GATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Gather 64-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 m := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I32GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Gather double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 m := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I32GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Gather single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I32SCATTER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 32-bit integers from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I32SCATTER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 64-bit integers from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 l := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+31:l])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I32SCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scatter double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 l := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+31:l])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I32SCATTER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scatter single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I64GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 m := j*64 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I64GATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Gather 64-bit integers from memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I64GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Gather double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I64GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Gather single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 m := j*64 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I64SCATTER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 32-bit integers from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 l := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+63:l])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I64SCATTER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 64-bit integers from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I64SCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scatter double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_I64SCATTER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scatter single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale) subject to mask k (elements are not stored when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 l := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+63:l])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_IDIV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_IDIVREM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, store the truncated results in dst, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers into memory at mem_addr.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERT_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 16-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by index.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 32-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by index.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 64-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by index.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERT_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, and insert the 8-bit integer i into dst at the location specified by index.
intrinsic.oper: dst[255:0] := a[255:0] sel := index*8 dst[sel+7:sel] := i[7:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERTF128_PD
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERTF128_PS
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERTF128_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERTF32X4
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERTF64X2
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERTI128_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of integer data) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERTI32X4
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 4 packed 32-bit integers) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INSERTI64X2
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 2 packed 64-bit integers) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INVCBRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cube root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := InvCubeRoot(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INVCBRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cube root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := InvCubeRoot(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INVSQRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := InvSQRT(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_INVSQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := InvSQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_IREM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LDDQU_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Load 256-bits of integer data from unaligned memory into dst. This intrinsic may perform better than _mm256_loadu_si256 when the data crosses a cache line boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[255:0] := MEM[mem_addr+255:mem_addr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOAD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load 256-bits (composed of 4 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from memory into dst. mem_addr must be aligned on a 32-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[255:0] := MEM[mem_addr+255:mem_addr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOAD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Load 256-bits (composed of 8 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from memory into dst. mem_addr must be aligned on a 32-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[255:0] := MEM[mem_addr+255:mem_addr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOAD_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Load 256-bits of integer data from memory into dst. mem_addr must be aligned on a 32-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[255:0] := MEM[mem_addr+255:mem_addr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOADU_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load 256-bits (composed of 4 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from memory into dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[255:0] := MEM[mem_addr+255:mem_addr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOADU_PS
intrinsic.desc: Load 256-bits (composed of 8 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from memory into dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[255:0] := MEM[mem_addr+255:mem_addr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOADU_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Load 256-bits of integer data from memory into dst. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[255:0] := MEM[mem_addr+255:mem_addr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOADU2_M128
intrinsic.desc: Load two 128-bit values (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from memory, and combine them into a 256-bit value in dst. hiaddr and loaddr do not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[loaddr+127:loaddr] dst[255:128] := MEM[hiaddr+127:hiaddr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOADU2_M128D
intrinsic.desc: Load two 128-bit values (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from memory, and combine them into a 256-bit value in dst. hiaddr and loaddr do not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[loaddr+127:loaddr] dst[255:128] := MEM[hiaddr+127:hiaddr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOADU2_M128I
intrinsic.desc: Load two 128-bit values (composed of integer data) from memory, and combine them into a 256-bit value in dst. hiaddr and loaddr do not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: dst[127:0] := MEM[loaddr+127:loaddr] dst[255:128] := MEM[hiaddr+127:hiaddr] dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOG_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ln(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOG_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ln(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOG10_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the base-10 logarithm of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := log10(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOG10_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the base-10 logarithm of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := log10(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOG1P_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of one plus packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ln(1.0 + a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOG1P_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the natural logarithm of one plus packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ln(1.0 + a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOG2_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the base-2 logarithm of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := log2(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOG2_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the base-2 logarithm of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := log2(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOGB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LOGB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LZCNT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 tmp := 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+31:i] := dst[i+31:i] + 1 OD ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_LZCNT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 tmp := 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+63:i] := dst[i+63:i] + 1 OD ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed signed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate signed 32-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate 32-bit integers, and pack the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MADD52HI_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the high 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[103:52]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MADD52LO_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the low 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[51:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MADDUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Vertically multiply each unsigned 8-bit integer from a with the corresponding signed 8-bit integer from b, producing intermediate signed 16-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate signed 16-bit integers, and pack the saturated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i+8]*b[i+15:i+8] + a[i+7:i]*b[i+7:i] ) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ABS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := ABS(a[i+15:i]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ABS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ABS(a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ABS_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 64-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ABS(a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ABS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i]) ELSE dst[i+7:i] := src[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ADD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ADD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ADD_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := src[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Add packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Add packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] + b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ADDS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 16-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16( a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] ) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ADDS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Add packed 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.oper: size := 32 m := base_addr FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] MEM[m+size-1:m] := a[i+31:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_CONFLICT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Test each 32-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[i] FOR l := 0 to j-1 m := l*32 dst[i+l] := (a[i+31:i] == a[m+31:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+31:i+j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_CONFLICT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Test each 64-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed half-precision (16-bit) floating-point elements, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_DBSAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Four SADs are performed on four 8-bit quadruplets for each 64-bit lane. The first two SADs use the lower 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a, and the last two SADs use the uppper 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a. Quadruplets from b are selected from within 128-bit lanes according to the control in imm8, and each SAD in each 64-bit lane uses the selected quadruplet at 8-bit offsets.

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 64*j IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_EXPAND_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load contiguous active 32-bit integers from a (those with their respective bit set in mask k), and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[m+31:m] m := m + 32 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_EXTRACTF32X4_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: CASE imm8[7:0] of 0: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] 1: tmp[127:0] := a[255:128] ESAC FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_EXTRACTF64X2_PD

intrinsic.oper:
CASE imm8[7:0] of 0: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] 1: tmp[127:0] := a[255:128] ESAC
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FIXUPIMM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 64-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i], c[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FIXUPIMM_PS
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 32-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN L= 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[31:0], src2[31:0], src3[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[31:0] := ((src2[30:23] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[31:0] CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i], c[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FMADDSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FMSUBADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FMSUBADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FNMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FNMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := -(a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FNMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FNMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := -(a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FPCLASS_PD_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k using zeromask k1 (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k1[j] k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP64(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_FPCLASS_PS_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k using zeromask k1 (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k1[j] k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP32(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_GETEXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_GETEXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_GETMANT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_GETMANT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_I32GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using mask (elements are copied from src when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] mask[i+31] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR mask[MAX:256] := 0 dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_I32GATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Gather 64-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using mask (elements are copied from src when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 m := j*32 IF mask[i+63] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] mask[i+63] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR mask[MAX:256] := 0 dst[MAX:256] := 0

Gathered elements are merged into dst using mask (elements are copied from src when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 m := j*32 IF mask[i+63] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] mask[i+63] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR mask[MAX:256] := 0 dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_I32GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Gather single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using mask (elements are copied from src when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_I32SCATTER_EPI32
intrinsic.sign: VOID_PTR base_addr,__MMASK8 k,__M256I vindex,__M256I a,CONST_INT scale
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 32-bit integers from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale) subject to mask k (elements are not stored when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] := a[i+31:i] k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.sign: VOID_PTR base_addr,__MMASK8 k,__M256I vindex,__M256I a,CONST_INT scale
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 64-bit integers from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale) subject to mask k (elements are not stored when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] := a[i+63:i] k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Scatter single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale) subject to mask k (elements are not stored when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 l := j*64 IF k[j] MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+63:l])*scale] := a[i+31:i] k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_INSERTF32X4
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to tmp, then insert 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from b into tmp at the location specified by imm8. Store tmp to dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: tmp[255:0] := a[255:0] CASE (imm8[1:0]) of 0: tmp[127:0] := b[127:0] 1: tmp[255:128] := b[127:0] ESAC FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_LZCNT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] tmp := 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+31:i] := dst[i+31:i] + 1 OD ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_MADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate 32-bit integers, and pack the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_MADD52HI_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the high 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp[127:0] := ZeroExtend64(b[i+51:i]) * ZeroExtend64(c[i+51:i]) dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] + ZeroExtend64(tmp[103:52]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_MADDUBS_EPI16

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_MUL_EPI32

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_MULHRS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate signed 32-bit integers. Truncate each intermediate integer to the 18 most significant bits, round by adding 1, and store bits [16:1] to dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] tmp[31:0] := ((a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i]) >> 14) + 1 dst[i+15:i] := tmp[16:1] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_MULTISHIFT_EPI64_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: For each 64-bit element in b, select 8 unaligned bytes using a byte-granular shift control within the corresponding 64-bit element of a, and store the 8 assembled bytes to the corresponding 64-bit element of dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR i := 0 to 3 q := i * 64 FOR j := 0 to 7 tmp8 := 0 ctrl := a[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] & 63 FOR l := 0 to 7 tmp8[l] := b[q+((ctrl+l) & 63)] ENDFOR IF k[i*8+j] dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := tmp8[7:0] ELSE dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := src[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] FI ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_PERMUTEX_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a across lanes lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT4(src, control){ CASE(control[1:0]) 0: tmp[63:0] := src[63:0] 1: tmp[63:0] := src[127:64] 2: tmp[63:0] := src[191:128] 3: tmp[63:0] := src[255:192] ESAC RETURN tmp[63:0] }
tmp_dst[63:0] := SELECT4(a[255:0], imm8[1:0]) tmp_dst[127:64] := SELECT4(a[255:0], imm8[3:2]) tmp_dst[191:128] := SELECT4(a[255:0], imm8[5:4]) tmp_dst[255:192] := SELECT4(a[255:0], imm8[7:6]) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp_dst[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

tmp_dst[63:0] := SELECT4(a[255:0], imm8[1:0]) tmp_dst[127:64] := SELECT4(a[255:0], imm8[3:2]) tmp_dst[191:128] := SELECT4(a[255:0], imm8[5:4]) tmp_dst[255:192] := SELECT4(a[255:0], imm8[7:6]) FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp_dst[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] off := 16*idx[i+3:i] dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+15:off] : a[off+15:off] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 id := idx[i+3:i]*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[id+15:id] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_RANGE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_RCP14_PD

The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_REDUCE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPD(src1[63:0], imm8[7:0]) { m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[63:0] := pow(2, -m) * ROUND(pow(2, m) * src1[63:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[63:0] := src1[63:0] - tmp[63:0] RETURN tmp[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ReduceArgumentPD(src[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_REDUCE_PS

intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPS(src1[31:0], imm8[7:0]) { IF src1[31:0] == NAN RETURN (convert src1[31:0] to QNaN) FI
m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[31:0] := pow(2, -m)*ROUND(pow(2, m)*src1[31:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[31:0] := src1[31:0] - tmp[31:0] RETURN tmp[31:0] } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ReduceArgumentPS(src[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ROL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ROR_EPI64
