intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src >> count) OR (src << (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ROUNDSCALE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_ROUNDSCALE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPS(src[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 1: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 2: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 3: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) ESAC
dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_RSQRT14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+63:i])) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_RSQRT14_PS

The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+31:i])) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_SCALEF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_SCALEF_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[31:0] := tmp_src1[31:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[31:0])) RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_SHUFFLE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_SHUFFLE_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle packed 8-bit integers in a according to shuffle control mask in the corresponding 8-bit element of b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k[j] IF b[i+7] == 1 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[3:0] := b[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[index*8+7:index*8] FI ELSE dst[i+7:i] := src[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_SLL_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 32-bit integer, the corresponding bit from src, a, and b are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst using writemask k at 32-bit granularity (32-bit elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] FOR h := 0 to 31 index[2:0] := (src[i+h] << 2) OR (a[i+h] << 1) OR b[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_TEST_EPI16_MASK

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k1[j] k[j] := ((a[i+15:i] AND b[i+15:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_TESTN_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k (subject to writemask k) if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k1[j] k[j] := ((a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_TESTN_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k (subject to writemask k) if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k1[j] k[j] := ((a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_TESTN_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 8-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 8-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k (subject to writemask k) if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k1[j] k[j] := ((a[i+7:i] AND b[i+7:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_UNPACKHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_XOR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_XOR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_XOR_PD

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK_XOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] off := 16*idx[i+3:i] dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+15:off] : a[off+15:off] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 off := idx[i+2:i]*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 off := idx[i+1:i]*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from a when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k[j] off := 8*idx[i+4:i] dst[i+7:i] := idx[i+5] ? b[off+7:off] : a[off+7:off] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 off := idx[i+1:i]*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK2_PERMUTEX2VAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from idx when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 off := idx[i+2:i]*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FMADDSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FMSUBADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FMSUBADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FNMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FNMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := -(a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := c[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FNMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := c[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASK3_FNMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst using writemask k (elements are copied from c when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKLOAD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 32-bit integers from memory into dst using mask (elements are zeroed out when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Load packed 64-bit integers from memory into dst using mask (elements are zeroed out when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element).

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF mask[i+63] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKSTORE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Store packed 32-bit integers from a into memory using mask (elements are not stored when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKSTORE_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Store packed 64-bit integers from a into memory using mask (elements are not stored when the highest bit is not set in the corresponding element).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF mask[i+63] MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] := a[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKSTORE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using mask.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF mask[i+31] MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] := a[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_ABS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := ABS(a[i+15:i]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_ALIGNR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 64-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 32-bit elements, and store the low 32 bytes (8 elements) in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: temp[511:256] := a[255:0] temp[255:0] := b[255:0] temp[511:0] := temp[511:0] >> (32*count) FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := temp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_ALIGNR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate pairs of 16-byte blocks in a and b into a 32-byte temporary result, shift the result right by count bytes, and store the low 16 bytes in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*128 tmp[255:0] := ((a[i+127:i] << 128) OR b[i+127:i]) >> (count[7:0]*8) tmp_dst[i+127:i] := tmp[127:0] ENDFOR
FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := tmp_dst[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: size := 32 m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[m+size-1:m] := a[i+31:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR dst[255:m] := 0 dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_CONFLICT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Test each 32-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[i] FOR l := 0 to j-1 m := l*32 dst[i+l] := (a[i+31:i] == a[m+31:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+31:i+j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 16*j l := 32*j IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Convert_FP32_To_FP16FP(a[l+31:l]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_DBSAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Four SADs are performed on four 8-bit quadruplets for each 64-bit lane. The first two SADs use the lower 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a, and the last two SADs use the uppper 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a. Quadruplets from b are selected from within 128-bit lanes according to the control in imm8, and each SAD in each 64-bit lane uses the selected quadruplet at 8-bit offsets.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_DIV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 64*j IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_DIV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_EXPAND_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load contiguous active 32-bit integers from a (those with their respective bit set in mask k), and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[m+31:m] m := m + 32 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_EXTRACTF32X4_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: CASE imm8[7:0] of 0: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] 1: tmp[127:0] := a[255:128] ESAC FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_EXTRACTF64X2_PD

intrinsic.oper:
CASE imm8[7:0] of 0: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] 1: tmp[127:0] := a[255:128] ESAC
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_EXTRACTI32X4_EPI32

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_EXTRACTI64X2_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 2 packed 64-bit integers) from a, selected with imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
CASE imm8[7:0] of 0: tmp[127:0] := a[127:0] 1: tmp[127:0] := a[255:128] ESAC
FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FIXUPIMM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 64-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i], c[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FIXUPIMM_PS
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 32-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN L= 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[31:0], src2[31:0], src3[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[31:0] := ((src2[30:23] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[31:0] CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i], c[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FMADDSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FMSUBADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FMSUBADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively subtract and add packed elements in c from/to the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FNMADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FNMADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, add the negated intermediate result to packed elements in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := -(a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FNMSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_FNMSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := -(a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_GETEXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_GETEXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_GETMANT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_GETMANT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_INSERTF32X4
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to tmp, then insert 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from b into tmp at the location specified by imm8. Store tmp to dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: tmp[255:0] := a[255:0] CASE (imm8[1:0]) of 0: tmp[127:0] := b[127:0] 1: tmp[255:128] := b[127:0] ESAC FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_INSERTF64X2
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to tmp, then insert 128 bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from b into tmp at the location specified by imm8. Store tmp to dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: tmp[255:0] := a[255:0] CASE (imm8[1:0]) of 0: tmp[127:0] := b[127:0] 1: tmp[255:128] := b[127:0] ESAC FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Copy a to tmp, then insert 128 bits (composed of 4 packed 32-bit integers) from b into tmp at the location specified by imm8. Store tmp to dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: tmp[255:0] := a[255:0] CASE (imm8[1:0]) of 0: tmp[127:0] := b[127:0] 1: tmp[255:128] := b[127:0] ESAC FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_INSERTI64X2
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to tmp, then insert 128 bits (composed of 2 packed 64-bit integers) from b into tmp at the location specified by imm8. Store tmp to dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: tmp[255:0] := a[255:0] CASE (imm8[1:0]) of 0: tmp[127:0] := b[127:0] 1: tmp[255:128] := b[127:0] ESAC FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOAD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 32-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr must be aligned on a 32-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOAD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 64-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr must be aligned on a 32-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOAD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr must be aligned on a 32-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOADU_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 16-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+15:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOADU_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 32-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOADU_EPI64

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOADU_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Load packed 8-bit integers from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+7:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOADU_PD
intrinsic.desc: Load packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memoy into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+63:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LOADU_PS
intrinsic.desc: Load packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory into dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LZCNT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] tmp := 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+31:i] := dst[i+31:i] + 1 OD ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_LZCNT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Counts the number of leading zero bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] tmp := 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 DO WHILE (tmp >= 0 AND a[i+tmp] == 0) tmp := tmp - 1 dst[i+63:i] := dst[i+63:i] + 1 OD ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_MADD_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers. Horizontally add adjacent pairs of intermediate 32-bit integers, and pack the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i+16]*b[i+31:i+16] + a[i+15:i]*b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_MADD52HI_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed unsigned 52-bit integers in each 64-bit element of b and c to form a 104-bit intermediate result. Add the high 52-bit unsigned integer from the intermediate result with the corresponding unsigned 64-bit integer in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_ROUNDSCALE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPS(src[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 1: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 2: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 3: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) ESAC
dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_RSQRT14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+63:i])) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_RSQRT14_PS

The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+31:i])) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_SCALEF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_SCALEF_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Shuffle packed 8-bit integers in a according to shuffle control mask in the corresponding 8-bit element of b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k[j] IF b[i+7] == 1 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[3:0] := b[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[index*8+7:index*8] FI ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_SUB_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := src[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 32-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst using zeromask k at 32-bit granularity (32-bit elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] FOR h := 0 to 31 index[2:0] := (a[i+h] << 2) OR (b[i+h] << 1) OR c[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MASKZ_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 64-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst using zeromask k at 64-bit granularity (64-bit elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] FOR h := 0 to 63 index[2:0] := (a[i+h] << 2) OR (b[i+h] << 1) OR c[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MMASK_I32GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst using writemask k (elements are copied from src when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := src[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0 dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 m := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] k[j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := src[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0 dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 dst[j] := a[i+7] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVEMASK_PD
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask dst based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF a[i+63] dst[j] := 1 ELSE dst[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:4] := 0
