intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask dst based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF a[i+31] dst[j] := 1 ELSE dst[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVEPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 16-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF a[i+15] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVEPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 32-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF a[i+31] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVEPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 64-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF a[i+63] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVEPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 8-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF a[i+7] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVM_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 16-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := 0xFFFF ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 32-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := 0xFFFFFFFF ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVM_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 64-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := 0xFFFFFFFFffffffff ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MOVM_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 8-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := 0xFF ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MPSADBW_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst. Eight SADs are performed for each 128-bit lane using one quadruplet from b and eight quadruplets from a. One quadruplet is selected from b starting at on the offset specified in imm8. Eight quadruplets are formed from sequential 8-bit integers selected from a starting at the offset specified in imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MUL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low 32-bit integers from each packed 64-bit element in a and b, and store the signed 64-bit results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MUL_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low unsigned 32-bit integers from each packed 64-bit element in a and b, and store the unsigned 64-bit results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MUL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MUL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MULHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MULHI_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MULHRS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate signed 32-bit integers. Truncate each intermediate integer to the 18 most significant bits, round by adding 1, and store bits [16:1] to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MULLO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the low 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[15:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MULLO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit integers, and store the low 32 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 tmp[63:0] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MULLO_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 128-bit integers, and store the low 64 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 tmp[127:0] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_MULTISHIFT_EPI64_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: For each 64-bit element in b, select 8 unaligned bytes using a byte-granular shift control within the corresponding 64-bit element of a, and store the 8 assembled bytes to the corresponding 64-bit element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR i := 0 to 3 q := i * 64 FOR j := 0 to 7 tmp8 := 0 ctrl := a[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] & 63 FOR l := 0 to 7 tmp8[l] := b[q+((ctrl+l) & 63)] ENDFOR dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := tmp8[7:0] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_OR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] BITWISE OR b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_OR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] BITWISE OR b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_OR_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of 256 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PACKS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[63:48]) dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[79:64]) dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[95:80]) dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[111:96]) dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[127:112]) dst[71:64] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[15:0]) dst[79:72] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[31:16]) dst[87:80] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[47:32]) dst[95:88] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[63:48]) dst[103:96] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[79:64]) dst[111:104] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[95:80]) dst[119:112] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[111:96]) dst[127:120] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[127:112]) dst[135:128] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[143:128]) dst[143:136] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[159:144]) dst[151:144] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[175:160]) dst[159:152] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[191:176]) dst[167:160] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[207:192]) dst[175:168] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[223:208]) dst[183:176] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[239:224]) dst[191:184] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[255:240]) dst[199:192] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[143:128]) dst[207:200] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[159:144]) dst[215:208] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[175:160]) dst[223:216] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[191:176]) dst[231:224] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[207:192]) dst[239:232] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[223:208]) dst[247:240] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[239:224]) dst[255:248] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (b[255:240]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PACKS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[31:0]) dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[63:32]) dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[95:64]) dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[127:96]) dst[79:64] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[31:0]) dst[95:80] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[63:32]) dst[111:96] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[95:64]) dst[127:112] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[127:96]) dst[143:128] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[159:128]) dst[159:144] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[191:160]) dst[175:160] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[223:192]) dst[191:176] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (a[255:224]) dst[207:192] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[159:128]) dst[223:208] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[191:160]) dst[239:224] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[223:192]) dst[255:240] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16 (b[255:224]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PACKUS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[63:48]) dst[39:32] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[79:64]) dst[47:40] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[95:80]) dst[55:48] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[111:96]) dst[63:56] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[127:112]) dst[71:64] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[15:0]) dst[79:72] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[31:16]) dst[87:80] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[47:32]) dst[95:88] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[63:48]) dst[103:96] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[79:64]) dst[111:104] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[95:80]) dst[119:112] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[111:96]) dst[127:120] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[127:112]) dst[135:128] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[143:128]) dst[143:136] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[159:144]) dst[151:144] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[175:160]) dst[159:152] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[191:176]) dst[167:160] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[207:192]) dst[175:168] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[223:208]) dst[183:176] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[239:224]) dst[191:184] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (a[255:240]) dst[199:192] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[143:128]) dst[207:200] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[159:144]) dst[215:208] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[175:160]) dst[223:216] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[191:176]) dst[231:224] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[207:192]) dst[239:232] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[223:208]) dst[247:240] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[239:224]) dst[255:248] := Saturate_Int16_To_UnsignedInt8 (b[255:240]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PACKUS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers from a and b to packed 16-bit integers using unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[31:0]) dst[31:16] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[63:32]) dst[47:32] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[95:64]) dst[63:48] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[127:96]) dst[79:64] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[31:0]) dst[95:80] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[63:32]) dst[111:96] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[95:64]) dst[127:112] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[127:96]) dst[143:128] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[159:128]) dst[159:144] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[191:160]) dst[175:160] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[223:192]) dst[191:176] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (a[255:224]) dst[207:192] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[159:128]) dst[223:208] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[191:160]) dst[239:224] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[223:192]) dst[255:240] := Saturate_Int32_To_UnsignedInt16 (b[255:224]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTE2F128_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTE2F128_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTE2F128_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of integer data) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTE2X128_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of integer data) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTE4X64_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a across lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTE4X64_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a across lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEVAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEVAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEVAR8X32_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 id := idx[i+2:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[id+31:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEVAR8X32_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 id := idx[i+2:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[id+31:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEX_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a across lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEX_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a across lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 off := 16*idx[i+3:i] dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+15:off] : a[off+15:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 off := idx[i+2:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 off := idx[i+1:i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 off := 8*idx[i+4:i] dst[i+7:i] := idx[i+6] ? b[off+5:off] : a[off+7:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEX2VAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 off := idx[i+1:i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+2] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEX2VAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 off := idx[i+2:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 id := idx[i+3:i]*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[id+15:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 id := idx[i+2:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[id+31:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 id := idx[i+1:i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[id+63:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 id := idx[i+4:i]*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[id+7:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEXVAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 id := idx[i+1:i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[id+63:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_PERMUTEXVAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 id := idx[i+2:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[id+31:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_POW_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a raised by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i])^(b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_POW_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a raised by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i])^(b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_RANGE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_RANGE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_RCP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 1.5*2^-12.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_RCP14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_RCP14_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REDUCE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPD(src1[63:0], imm8[7:0]) { m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[63:0] := pow(2, -m) * ROUND(pow(2, m) * src1[63:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[63:0] := src1[63:0] - tmp[63:0] RETURN tmp[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ReduceArgumentPD(src[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REDUCE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPS(src1[31:0], imm8[7:0]) { IF src1[31:0] == NAN RETURN (convert src1[31:0] to QNaN) FI
m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[31:0] := pow(2, -m)*ROUND(pow(2, m)*src1[31:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[31:0] := src1[31:0] - tmp[31:0] RETURN tmp[31:0] } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ReduceArgumentPS(src[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REM_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REM_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REM_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 8-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 8*j dst[i+7:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+7:i] / b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REM_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REM_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REM_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_REM_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 8*j dst[i+7:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+7:i] / b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROL_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROLV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROLV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src >>count) OR (src << (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src >> count) OR (src << (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_RORV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src >>count) OR (src << (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_RORV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src >> count) OR (src << (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using the rounding parameter, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ROUND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using the rounding parameter, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ROUND(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROUNDSCALE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ROUNDSCALE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPS(src[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 1: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 2: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 3: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) ESAC
dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_RSQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 1.5*2^-12.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+31:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute differences of packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, then horizontally sum each consecutive 8 differences to produce four unsigned 16-bit integers, and pack these unsigned 16-bit integers in the low 16 bits of 64-bit elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 tmp[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR FOR j := 0 to 4 i := j*64 dst[i+15:i] := tmp[i+7:i] + tmp[i+15:i+8] + tmp[i+23:i+16] + tmp[i+31:i+24] + tmp[i+39:i+32] + tmp[i+47:i+40] + tmp[i+55:i+48] + tmp[i+63:i+56] dst[i+63:i+16] := 0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SCALEF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SCALEF_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[31:0] := tmp_src1[31:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[31:0])) RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET_EPI16
intrinsic.sign: SHORT e15,SHORT e14,SHORT e13,SHORT e12,SHORT e11,SHORT e10,SHORT e9,SHORT e8,SHORT e7,SHORT e6,SHORT e5,SHORT e4,SHORT e3,SHORT e2,SHORT e1,SHORT e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 16-bit integers in dst with the supplied values.

intrinsic.sign: INT e7,INT e6,INT e5,INT e4,INT e3,INT e2,INT e1,INT e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 32-bit integers in dst with the supplied values.

intrinsic.desc: Set packed 64-bit integers in dst with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET_EPI8
intrinsic.sign: CHAR e31,CHAR e30,CHAR e29,CHAR e28,CHAR e27,CHAR e26,CHAR e25,CHAR e24,CHAR e23,CHAR e22,CHAR e21,CHAR e20,CHAR e19,CHAR e18,CHAR e17,CHAR e16,CHAR e15,CHAR e14,CHAR e13,CHAR e12,CHAR e11,CHAR e10,CHAR e9,CHAR e8,CHAR e7,CHAR e6,CHAR e5,CHAR e4,CHAR e3,CHAR e2,CHAR e1,CHAR e0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET_M128I

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET_PS
intrinsic.sign: FLOAT e7,FLOAT e6,FLOAT e5,FLOAT e4,FLOAT e3,FLOAT e2,FLOAT e1,FLOAT e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET1_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 16-bit integer a to all all elements of dst. This intrinsic may generate the vpbroadcastw.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[15:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET1_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 32-bit integer a to all elements of dst. This intrinsic may generate the vpbroadcastd.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET1_EPI64X
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 64-bit integer a to all elements of dst. This intrinsic may generate the vpbroadcastq.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET1_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 8-bit integer a to all elements of dst. This intrinsic may generate the vpbroadcastb.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[7:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET1_PD
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast double-precision (64-bit) floating-point value a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SET1_PS
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast single-precision (32-bit) floating-point value a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.sign: SHORT e15,SHORT e14,SHORT e13,SHORT e12,SHORT e11,SHORT e10,SHORT e9,SHORT e8,SHORT e7,SHORT e6,SHORT e5,SHORT e4,SHORT e3,SHORT e2,SHORT e1,SHORT e0

intrinsic.sign: CHAR e31,CHAR e30,CHAR e29,CHAR e28,CHAR e27,CHAR e26,CHAR e25,CHAR e24,CHAR e23,CHAR e22,CHAR e21,CHAR e20,CHAR e19,CHAR e18,CHAR e17,CHAR e16,CHAR e15,CHAR e14,CHAR e13,CHAR e12,CHAR e11,CHAR e10,CHAR e9,CHAR e8,CHAR e7,CHAR e6,CHAR e5,CHAR e4,CHAR e3,CHAR e2,CHAR e1,CHAR e0

intrinsic.sign: FLOAT e7,FLOAT e6,FLOAT e5,FLOAT e4,FLOAT e3,FLOAT e2,FLOAT e1,FLOAT e0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SETZERO_PD
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m256d with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SETZERO_PS
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m256 with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SETZERO_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m256i with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SHUFFLE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SHUFFLE_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a within 128-bit lanes according to shuffle control mask in the corresponding 8-bit element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*8 IF b[i+7] == 1 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[3:0] := b[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[index*8+7:index*8] FI IF b[128+i+7] == 1 dst[128+i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[3:0] := b[128+i+3:128+i] dst[128+i+7:i] := a[128+index*8+7:128+index*8] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SHUFFLE_F32X4
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 4 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT2(src, control){ CASE(control[0]) 0: tmp[127:0] := src[127:0] 1: tmp[127:0] := src[255:128] ESAC RETURN tmp[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := SELECT2(a[255:0], imm8[0]) dst[255:128] := SELECT2(b[255:0], imm8[1]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SIGN_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Negate packed 16-bit integers in a when the corresponding signed 16-bit integer in b is negative, and store the results in dst. Element in dst are zeroed out when the corresponding element in b is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 IF b[i+15:i] < 0 dst[i+15:i] := NEG(a[i+15:i]) ELSE IF b[i+15:i] = 0 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_STORE_PD

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SUBS_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 16-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SUBS_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 8-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SVML_CEIL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a up to an integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundpd/vroundpd instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := CEIL(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SVML_CEIL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a up to an integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundps/vroundps instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := CEIL(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SVML_FLOOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a down to an integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundpd/vroundpd instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FLOOR(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SVML_FLOOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a down to an integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundps/vroundps instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FLOOR(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SVML_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the nearest integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundpd/vroundpd instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ROUND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SVML_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the nearest integer value, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundps/vroundps instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ROUND(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SVML_SQRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. Note that this intrinsic is less efficient than _mm_sqrt_pd.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SQRT(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_SVML_SQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. Note that this intrinsic is less efficient than _mm_sqrt_ps.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TAN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TAN(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TAN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TAN(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TAND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TAND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TAND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TAND(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TANH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TANH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TANH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TANH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 32-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 FOR h := 0 to 31 index[2:0] := (a[i+h] << 2) OR (b[i+h] << 1) OR c[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 64-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 FOR h := 0 to 63 index[2:0] := (a[i+h] << 2) OR (b[i+h] << 1) OR c[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TEST_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 16-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TEST_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 k[j] := ((a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TEST_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 k[j] := ((a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TEST_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 8-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 8-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 k[j] := ((a[i+7:i] AND b[i+7:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 256-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the CF value.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 256-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the CF value.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTC_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and set ZF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, and set CF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the CF value.
intrinsic.oper: IF (a[255:0] AND b[255:0] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI IF ((NOT a[255:0]) AND b[255:0] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI RETURN CF

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTN_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 16-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTN_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 k[j] := ((a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTN_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 k[j] := ((a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:4] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTN_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 8-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 8-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*8 k[j] := ((a[i+7:i] AND b[i+7:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTNZC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 256-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return 1 if both the ZF and CF values are zero, otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.oper: tmp[255:0] := a[255:0] AND b[255:0] IF (tmp[63] == tmp[127] == tmp[191] == tmp[255] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI tmp[255:0] := (NOT a[255:0]) AND b[255:0] IF (tmp[63] == tmp[127] == tmp[191] == tmp[255] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI IF (ZF == 0 && CF == 0) RETURN 1 ELSE RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTNZC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 256-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return 1 if both the ZF and CF values are zero, otherwise return 0.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTNZC_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and set ZF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, and set CF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return 1 if both the ZF and CF values are zero, otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.oper: IF (a[255:0] AND b[255:0] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI IF ((NOT a[255:0]) AND b[255:0] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI IF (ZF == 0 && CF == 0) RETURN 1 ELSE RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTZ_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 256-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 64-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the ZF value.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTZ_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) in a and b, producing an intermediate 256-bit value, and set ZF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, producing an intermediate value, and set CF to 1 if the sign bit of each 32-bit element in the intermediate value is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the ZF value.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TESTZ_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 256 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and set ZF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set ZF to 0. Compute the bitwise NOT of a and then AND with b, and set CF to 1 if the result is zero, otherwise set CF to 0. Return the ZF value.
intrinsic.oper: IF (a[255:0] AND b[255:0] == 0) ZF := 1 ELSE ZF := 0 FI IF ((NOT a[255:0]) AND b[255:0] == 0) CF := 1 ELSE CF := 0 FI RETURN ZF

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TRUNC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Truncate the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundpd/vroundpd instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_TRUNC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Truncate the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. This intrinsic may generate the roundps/vroundps instruction.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UDIV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UDIVREM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, store the truncated results in dst, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers into memory at mem_addr.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) MEM[mem_addr+i+31:mem_addr+i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNDEFINED_PD
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m256d with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNDEFINED_PS
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m256 with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNDEFINED_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m256i with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKHI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[31:0] := src1[95:64] dst[63:32] := src2[95:64] dst[95:64] := src1[127:96] dst[127:96] := src2[127:96] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKHI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 64-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[63:0] := src1[127:64] dst[127:64] := src2[127:64] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKHI_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKHI_PD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[63:0] := src1[127:64] dst[127:64] := src2[127:64] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKHI_PS
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[31:0] := src1[95:64] dst[63:32] := src2[95:64] dst[95:64] := src1[127:96] dst[127:96] := src2[127:96] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKLO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKLO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKLO_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 64-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[63:0] := src1[63:0] dst[127:64] := src2[63:0] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKLO_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKLO_PD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[63:0] := src1[63:0] dst[127:64] := src2[63:0] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UNPACKLO_PS
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_UREM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_XOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_XOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM256_XOR_SI256
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of 256 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ZEROALL
intrinsic.desc: Zero the contents of all XMM or YMM registers.
intrinsic.oper: YMM0[MAX:0] := 0 YMM1[MAX:0] := 0 YMM2[MAX:0] := 0 YMM3[MAX:0] := 0 YMM4[MAX:0] := 0 YMM5[MAX:0] := 0 YMM6[MAX:0] := 0 YMM7[MAX:0] := 0 IF 64-bit mode YMM8[MAX:0] := 0 YMM9[MAX:0] := 0 YMM10[MAX:0] := 0 YMM11[MAX:0] := 0 YMM12[MAX:0] := 0 YMM13[MAX:0] := 0 YMM14[MAX:0] := 0 YMM15[MAX:0] := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _MM256_ZEROUPPER
intrinsic.desc: Zero the upper 128 bits of all YMM registers; the lower 128-bits of the registers are unmodified.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ABS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := ABS(a[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ABS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ABS(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ABS_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 64-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ABS(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ABS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute value of packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the unsigned results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ABS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Finds the absolute value of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in v2, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ABS(v2[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ABS_PS
intrinsic.desc: Finds the absolute value of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in v2, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ABS(v2[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ACOS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse cosine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ACOS(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ACOS_PS

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ADD_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Add packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CBRT_PD

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 k[j] := (a[i+31:i] != NaN AND b[i+31:i] != NaN) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CMPUNORD_PD_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if either is NaN, and store the results in mask vector k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 k[j] := (a[i+63:i] == NaN OR b[i+63:i] == NaN) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CMPUNORD_PS_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b to see if either is NaN, and store the results in mask vector k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CONFLICT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Test each 32-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit. Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 FOR k := 0 to j-1 m := k*32 dst[i+k] := (a[i+31:i] == a[m+31:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+31:i+j] := 0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CONFLICT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Test each 64-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit. Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 FOR k := 0 to j-1 m := k*64 dst[i+k] := (a[i+63:i] == a[m+63:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+63:i+j] := 0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_COS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the cosine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVT_ROUNDEPI32_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers in a to packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_Int32_To_FP32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVT_ROUNDPD_PSLO
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element conversion of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in v2 to packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements, storing the results in dst. Results are written to the lower half of dst, and the upper half locations are set to '0'. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 k := j*32 dst[k+31:k] := Float64ToFloat32(v2[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 m := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP16_To_FP32(a[m+15:m]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed unsigned 32-bit integers, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP32_To_UnsignedInt32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTFXPNT_ROUND_ADJUSTEPI32_PS
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element conversion of packed 32-bit integer elements in v2 to packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements and performing an optional exponent adjust using expadj, storing the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := Int32ToFloat32(v2[i+31:i]) CASE expadj OF _MM_EXPADJ_NONE: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**0 _MM_EXPADJ_4: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**4 _MM_EXPADJ_5: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**5 _MM_EXPADJ_8: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**8 _MM_EXPADJ_16: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**16 _MM_EXPADJ_24: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**24 _MM_EXPADJ_31: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**31 _MM_EXPADJ_32: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**32 ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTFXPNT_ROUND_ADJUSTEPU32_PS
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element conversion of packed 32-bit unsigned integer elements in v2 to packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements and performing an optional exponent adjust using expadj, storing the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := UInt32ToFloat32(v2[i+31:i]) CASE expadj OF _MM_EXPADJ_NONE: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**0 _MM_EXPADJ_4: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**4 _MM_EXPADJ_5: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**5 _MM_EXPADJ_8: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**8 _MM_EXPADJ_16: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**16 _MM_EXPADJ_24: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**24 _MM_EXPADJ_31: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**31 _MM_EXPADJ_32: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**32 ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTFXPNT_ROUND_ADJUSTPS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element conversion of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v2 to packed 32-bit integer elements and performs an optional exponent adjust using expadj, storing the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := Float32ToInt32(v2[i+31:i]) CASE expadj OF _MM_EXPADJ_NONE: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**0 _MM_EXPADJ_4: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**4 _MM_EXPADJ_5: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**5 _MM_EXPADJ_8: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**8 _MM_EXPADJ_16: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**16 _MM_EXPADJ_24: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**24 _MM_EXPADJ_31: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**31 _MM_EXPADJ_32: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**32 ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTFXPNT_ROUND_ADJUSTPS_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element conversion of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v2 to packed 32-bit unsigned integer elements and performing an optional exponent adjust using expadj, storing the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := Float32ToUInt32(v2[i+31:i]) CASE expadj OF _MM_EXPADJ_NONE: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] 0 _MM_EXPADJ_4: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] 4 _MM_EXPADJ_5: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] 5 _MM_EXPADJ_8: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] 8 _MM_EXPADJ_16: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] 16 _MM_EXPADJ_24: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] 24 _MM_EXPADJ_31: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] 31 _MM_EXPADJ_32: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] 32 ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTFXPNT_ROUNDPD_EPI32LO
intrinsic.desc: Performs an element-by-element conversion of elements in packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point vector v2 to 32-bit integer elements, storing them in the lower half of dst. The elements in the upper half of dst are set to 0. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 k := j*32 dst[k+31:k] := Float64ToInt32(v2[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 k := j*32 dst[k+31:k] := Float64ToInt32(v2[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0
