intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTPS_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed unsigned 64-bit integers, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 l := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP32_To_UnsignedInt64(a[l+31:l]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTPS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j k := 32*j dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP32_To_FP64(a[k+31:k]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTPS_PH
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed half-precision (16-bit) floating-point elements, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 16*j l := 32*j dst[i+15:i] := Convert_FP32_To_FP16FP(a[l+31:l]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTPSLO_PD
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element conversion of the lower half of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v2 to packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 k := j*64 dst[k+63:k] := Float32ToFloat64(v2[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTSEPI16_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers in a to packed 8-bit integers with signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 16*j l := 8*j dst[l+7:l] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8(a[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTSEPI32_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers in a to packed 16-bit integers with signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j k := 16*j dst[k+15:k] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int16(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTSEPI32_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 32-bit integers in a to packed 8-bit integers with signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j k := 8*j dst[k+7:k] := Saturate_Int32_To_Int8(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTSEPI64_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 64-bit integers in a to packed 16-bit integers with signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j k := 16*j dst[k+15:k] := Saturate_Int64_To_Int16(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTSEPI64_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 64-bit integers in a to packed 32-bit integers with signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j k := 32*j dst[k+31:k] := Saturate_Int64_To_Int32(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTSEPI64_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 64-bit integers in a to packed 8-bit integers with signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j k := 8*j dst[k+7:k] := Saturate_Int64_To_Int8(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTT_ROUNDPD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 32-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*i k := 64*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP64_To_IntegerTruncate(a[k+63:k]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTT_ROUNDPD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 64-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP64_To_Int64_Truncate(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTT_ROUNDPD_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed unsigned 32-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*i k := 64*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP64_To_UnsignedIntegerTruncate(a[k+63:k]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTT_ROUNDPD_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed unsigned 64-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP64_To_UnsignedInt64_Truncate(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTT_ROUNDPS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 32-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*i dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP32_To_IntegerTruncate(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTT_ROUNDPS_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 64-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 l := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP32_To_Int64_Truncate(a[l+31:l]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTT_ROUNDPS_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed unsigned 64-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 l := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP32_To_UnsignedInt64_Truncate(a[l+31:l]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 32-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j k := 64*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP64_To_Int32_Truncate(a[k+63:k]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTTPD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 64-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP64_To_Int64_Truncate(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 32*j k := 64*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP64_To_UnsignedInt32_Truncate(a[k+63:k]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTTPD_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed unsigned 64-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP64_To_UnsignedInt64_Truncate(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 32-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP32_To_Int32_Truncate(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTTPS_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed 64-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 l := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP32_To_Int64_Truncate(a[l+31:l]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed unsigned 32-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := Convert_FP32_To_UnsignedInt32_Truncate(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTTPS_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to packed unsigned 64-bit integers with truncation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 l := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := Convert_FP32_To_UnsignedInt64_Truncate(a[l+31:l]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTUSEPI16_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 8-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 16*j l := 8*j dst[l+7:l] := Saturate_UnsignedInt16_To_Int8(a[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_CVTUSEPI32_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 16-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j k := 16*j dst[k+15:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt32_To_Int16(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 8-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j k := 8*j dst[k+7:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt32_To_Int8(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 16-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j k := 16*j dst[k+15:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt64_To_Int16(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:128] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 32-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j k := 32*j dst[k+31:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt64_To_Int32(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Convert packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a to packed unsigned 8-bit integers with unsigned saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j k := 8*j dst[k+7:k] := Saturate_UnsignedInt64_To_Int8(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DBSAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst. Four SADs are performed on four 8-bit quadruplets for each 64-bit lane. The first two SADs use the lower 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a, and the last two SADs use the uppper 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a. Quadruplets from b are selected from within 128-bit lanes according to the control in imm8, and each SAD in each 64-bit lane uses the selected quadruplet at 8-bit offsets.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 8-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := 8*j dst[i+7:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+7:i] / b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the truncated results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := 8*j dst[i+7:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+7:i] / b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, =and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_DIV_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ERF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ERF_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ERFC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the complementary error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 - ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ERFC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the complementary error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 - ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ERFCINV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse complementary error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 / (1.0 - ERF(a[i+63:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ERFCINV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse complementary error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 / (1.0 - ERF(a[i+31:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ERFINV_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse error function of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 1.0 / ERF(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ERFINV_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse error function of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 1.0 / ERF(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := e^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := e^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP10_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 10 raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 10^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP10_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 10 raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 10^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP2_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := 2^(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP2_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := 2^(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP223_PS
intrinsic.desc: Approximates the base-2 exponent of the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v2 with eight bits for sign and magnitude and 24 bits for the fractional part. Results are stored in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := exp223(v2[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP2A23_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-23.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP2A23_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-23.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP2A23_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-23. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXP2A23_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate exponential value of 2 raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-23. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXPM1_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, subtract one from each element, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := e^(a[i+63:i]) - 1.0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXPM1_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of e raised to the power of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, subtract one from each element, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := e^(a[i+31:i]) - 1.0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTLOAD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Depending on bc, loads 1, 4, or 16 elements of type and size determined by conv from memory address mt and converts all elements to 32-bit integer elements, storing the results in dst. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: addr = MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 CASE bc OF _MM_BROADCAST32_NONE: CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: n := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := addr[n+31:n] _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToInt32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToInt32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToInt32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToInt32(addr[n+15:n]) ESAC _MM_BROADCAST_1X16: CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: n := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := addr[31:0] _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToInt32(addr[7:0]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToInt32(addr[7:0]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToInt32(addr[15:0]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToInt32(addr[15:0]) ESAC _MM_BROADCAST_4X16: mod := j%4 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: n := mod*32 dst[i+31:i] := addr[n+31:n] _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: n := mod*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToInt32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: n := mod*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToInt32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: n := mod*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToInt32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: n := mod*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToInt32(addr[n+15:n]) ESAC ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTLOAD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Depending on bc, loads 1, 4, or 8 elements of type and size determined by conv from memory address mt and converts all elements to 64-bit integer elements, storing the results in dst. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: addr = MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 CASE bc OF _MM_BROADCAST64_NONE: CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: n := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := addr[n+63:n] ESAC _MM_BROADCAST_1X8: CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: n := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := addr[63:0] ESAC _MM_BROADCAST_4X8: mod := j%4 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: n := mod*64 dst[i+63:i] := addr[n+63:n] ESAC ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTLOAD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Depending on bc, loads 1, 4, or 8 elements of type and size determined by conv from memory address mt and converts all elements to double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements, storing the results in dst. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: addr = MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 CASE bc OF _MM_BROADCAST64_NONE: CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PD_NONE: n := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := addr[n+63:n] ESAC _MM_BROADCAST_1X8: CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PD_NONE: n := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := addr[63:0] ESAC _MM_BROADCAST_4X8: mod := j%4 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PD_NONE: n := mod*64 dst[i+63:i] := addr[n+63:n] ESAC ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTLOAD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Depending on bc, loads 1, 4, or 16 elements of type and size determined by conv from memory address mt and converts all elements to single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements, storing the results in dst. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: addr = MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 CASE bc OF _MM_BROADCAST32_NONE: CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PS_NONE: n := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := addr[n+31:n] _MM_UPCONV_PS_FLOAT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := Float16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToFloat32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToFloat32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) ESAC _MM_BROADCAST_1X16: CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PS_NONE: n := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := addr[31:0] _MM_UPCONV_PS_FLOAT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := Float16ToFloat32(addr[15:0]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToFloat32(addr[7:0]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToFloat32(addr[7:0]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToFloat32(addr[15:0]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToFloat32(addr[15:0]) ESAC _MM_BROADCAST_4X16: mod := j%4 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PS_NONE: n := mod*32 dst[i+31:i] := addr[n+31:n] _MM_UPCONV_PS_FLOAT16: n := mod*16 dst[i+31:i] := Float16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT8: n := mod*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToFloat32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT8: n := mod*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToFloat32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT16: n := mod*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT16: n := mod*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) ESAC ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTLOADUNPACKHI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Loads the high-64-byte-aligned portion of the byte/word/doubleword stream starting at element-aligned address mt-64, up-converted depending on the value of conv, and expanded into packed 32-bit integers in dst. The initial values of dst are copied from src. Only those converted doublewords that occur at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (mt-64) are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those doublewords are taken from src. hint indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTLOADUNPACKHI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Loads the high-64-byte-aligned portion of the quadword stream starting at element-aligned address mt-64, up-converted depending on the value of conv, and expanded into packed 64-bit integers in dst. The initial values of dst are copied from src. Only those converted quadwords that occur at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (mt-64) are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those quadwords are taken from src. hint indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTLOADUNPACKHI_PD

The initial values of dst are copied from src. Only those converted quadwords that occur at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (mt-64) are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those quadwords are taken from src. hint indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTLOADUNPACKHI_PS

The initial values of dst are copied from src. Only those converted quadwords that occur at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (mt-64) are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those quadwords are taken from src. hint indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.

Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those doublewords are taken from src. hint indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.

The initial values of dst are copied from src. Only those converted quad that occur before first 64-byte-aligned address following mt are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those quadwords are taken from src. hint indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.

The initial values of dst are copied from src. Only those converted doublewords that occur before first 64-byte-aligned address following mt are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those doublewords are taken from src. hint indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTPACKSTOREHI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts and stores packed 32-bit integer elements of v1 into a byte/word/doubleword stream according to conv at a logically mapped starting address (mt-64), storing the high-64-byte elements of that stream (those elemetns of the stream that map at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (m5-64)). hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTPACKSTOREHI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts and stores packed 64-bit integer elements of v1 into a quadword stream according to conv at a logically mapped starting address (mt-64), storing the high-64-byte elements of that stream (those elemetns of the stream that map at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (m5-64)). hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTPACKSTOREHI_PD
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts and stores packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements of v1 into a quadword stream according to conv at a logically mapped starting address (mt-64), storing the high-64-byte elements of that stream (those elemetns of the stream that map at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (m5-64)). hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTPACKSTOREHI_PS
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts and stores packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements of v1 into a byte/word/doubleword stream according to conv at a logically mapped starting address (mt-64), storing the high-64-byte elements of that stream (those elemetns of the stream that map at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (m5-64)). hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTPACKSTORELO_EPI32

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTPACKSTORELO_EPI64

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTRACTF32X4_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTRACTF32X8_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract 256 bits (composed of 8 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTRACTF64X2_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTRACTF64X4_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract 256 bits (composed of 4 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTRACTI32X4_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 4 packed 32-bit integers) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTRACTI32X8_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Extract 256 bits (composed of 8 packed 32-bit integers) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTRACTI64X2_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Extract 128 bits (composed of 2 packed 64-bit integers) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTRACTI64X4_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Extract 256 bits (composed of 4 packed 64-bit integers) from a, selected with imm8, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTSTORE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Downconverts packed 32-bit integer elements stored in v to a smaller type depending on conv and stores them in memory location mt. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_NONE: addr[i+31:i] := v[i+31:i] _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT8: n := j*8 addr[n+7:n] := Int32ToUInt8(v[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT8: n := j*8 addr[n+7:n] := Int32ToSInt8(v[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := Int32ToUInt16(v[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := Int32ToSInt16(v[i+31:i]) ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTSTORE_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Downconverts packed 64-bit integer elements stored in v to a smaller type depending on conv and stores them in memory location mt. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI64_NONE: addr[i+63:i] := v[i+63:i] ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTSTORE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Downconverts packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements stored in v to a smaller type depending on conv and stores them in memory location mt. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_NONE: addr[i+63:i] := v[i+63:i] ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_EXTSTORE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Downconverts packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements stored in v to a smaller type depending on conv and stores them in memory location mt. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_NONE: addr[i+31:i] := v[i+31:i] _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_FLOAT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := Float32ToFloat16(v[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_UINT8: n := j*8 addr[n+7:n] := Float32ToUInt8(v[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_SINT8: n := j*8 addr[n+7:n] := Float32ToSInt8(v[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_UINT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := Float32ToUInt16(v[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_SINT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := Float32ToSInt16(v[i+31:i]) ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_FIXUPIMM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 64-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i], c[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_FIXUPIMM_PS
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 32-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN L= 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[31:0], src2[31:0], src3[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[31:0] := ((src2[30:23] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[31:0] CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i], c[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_FIXUPIMM_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 64-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst. imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }

intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN L= 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[31:0], src2[31:0], src3[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[31:0] := ((src2[30:23] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[31:0] CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }

intrinsic.name: _MM512_FNMSUB_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := -(a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_FNMSUB_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, subtract packed elements in c from the negated intermediate result, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := -(a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_FPCLASS_PD_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k. imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP64(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_FPCLASS_PS_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Test packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a for special categories specified by imm8, and store the results in mask vector k. imm can be a combination of: 0x01 // QNaN 0x02 // Positive Zero 0x04 // Negative Zero 0x08 // Positive Infinity 0x10 // Negative Infinity 0x20 // Denormal 0x40 // Negative 0x80 // SNaN
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 k[j] := CheckFPClass_FP32(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GETEXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GETEXP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GETEXP_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GETEXP_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to a single-precision (32-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ConvertExpFP32(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GETMANT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GETMANT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GETMANT_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GETMANT_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GMAX_PD
intrinsic.desc: Determines the maximum of each pair of corresponding elements in packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FpMax(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GMAX_PS
intrinsic.desc: Determines the maximum of each pair of corresponding elements in packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FpMax(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GMAXABS_PS
intrinsic.desc: Determines the maximum of the absolute elements of each pair of corresponding elements of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FpMax(Abs(a[i+31:i]), Abs(b[i+31:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GMIN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Determines the minimum of each pair of corresponding elements in packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := FpMin(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_GMIN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Determines the minimum of each pair of corresponding elements in packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FpMin(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_HYPOT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the length of the hypotenous of a right triangle, with the lengths of the other two sides of the triangle stored as packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SQRT(a[i+63:i]^2 + b[i+63:i]^2) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_HYPOT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the length of the hypotenous of a right triangle, with the lengths of the other two sides of the triangle stored as packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]^2 + b[i+31:i]^2) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32EXTGATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Up-converts 16 memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale using conv to 32-bit integer elements and stores them in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: dst[i+31:i] := addr[i+31:i] _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: n := j*7 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToUInt32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: n := j*7 dst[i+31:i] := Int8ToInt32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToUInt32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := Int16ToInt32(addr[n+15:n]) ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32EXTGATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Up-converts 16 memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale using conv to single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements and stores them in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PS_NONE: dst[i+31:i] := addr[i+31:i] _MM_UPCONV_PS_FLOAT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := Float16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToFloat32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToFloat32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32EXTSCATTER_EPI32
intrinsic.sign: VOID_PTR mv,__M512I index,__M512I v1,_MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_ENUM conv,INT scale,INT hint
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts 16 packed 32-bit integer elements in v1 using conv and stores them in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_NONE: addr[i+31:i] := v1[i+31:i] _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT8: n := j*8 addr[n+7:n] := UInt32ToUInt8(v1[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT8: n := j*8 addr[n+7:n] := SInt32ToSInt8(v1[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := UInt32ToUInt16(v1[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := SInt32ToSInt16(v1[n+15:n]) ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32EXTSCATTER_PS
intrinsic.sign: VOID_PTR mv,__M512I index,__M512 v1,_MM_DOWNCONV_PS_ENUM conv,INT scale,INT scale
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts 16 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v1 and stores them in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale using conv.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_NONE: n := j*32 addr[i+31:i] := v1[n+31:n] _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_FLOAT16: i := j*16 addr[i+15:i] := Float32ToFloat16(v1[n+31:n]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_UINT8: i := j*8 addr[i+7:i] := Float32ToUInt8(v1[n+31:n]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_SINT8: i := j*8 addr[i+7:i] := Float32ToSInt8(v1[n+31:n]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_UINT16: i := j*8 addr[i+15:i] := Float32ToUInt16(v1[n+31:n]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_SINT16: i := j*8 addr[i+15:i] := Float32ToSInt16(v1[n+31:n]) ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32GATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Gather 64-bit integers from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 m := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Gather double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 m := j*32 dst[i+63:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[m+31:m])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Gather single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32LOEXTGATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Up-converts 8 double-precision (64-bit) memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in the lower half of index scaled by scale using conv to 64-bit integer elements and stores them in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*64 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: dst[i+63:i] := addr[i+63:i] ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32LOEXTGATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Up-converts 8 double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in the lower half of index scaled by scale using conv to 64-bit floating-point elements and stores them in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*64 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PD_NONE: dst[i+63:i] := addr[i+63:i] ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32LOEXTSCATTER_EPI64
intrinsic.sign: VOID_PTR mv,__M512I index,__M512I v1,_MM_DOWNCONV_EPI64_ENUM conv,INT scale,INT hint
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts 8 packed 64-bit integer elements in v1 and stores them in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale using conv.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*64 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI64_NONE: addr[i+63:i] := v1[i+63:i] ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32LOEXTSCATTER_PD
intrinsic.sign: VOID_PTR mv,__M512I index,__M512D v1,_MM_DOWNCONV_PD_ENUM conv,INT scale,INT hint
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts 8 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in v1 and stores them in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale using conv.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*64 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_PD_NONE: addr[i+63:i] := v1[i+63:i] ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32LOGATHER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Loads 8 64-bit integer elements from memory starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in the lower half of index scaled by scale and stores them in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] dst[i+63:i] := addr[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32LOGATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Loads 8 double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements stored at memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in the lower half of index scaled by scale them in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] dst[i+63:i] := addr[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32LOSCATTER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Stores 8 packed 64-bit integer elements located in v1 and stores them in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*64 addr[i+63:i] := v1[k+63:j] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32LOSCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Stores 8 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in v1 and to memory locations starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*64 addr[i+63:i] := v1[k+63:j] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32SCATTER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 32-bit integers from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32SCATTER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 64-bit integers from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 l := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+31:l])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32SCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scatter double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 l := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+31:l])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I32SCATTER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scatter single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 32-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+31:i])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64EXTGATHER_EPI32LO
intrinsic.desc: Up-converts 8 single-precision (32-bit) memory locations starting at location mv at packed 64-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale using conv to 32-bit integer elements and stores them in dst. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: dst[i+31:i] := addr[i+31:i] _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToInt32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToInt32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToInt32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToInt32(addr[n+15:n]) ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: dst[i+63:i] := addr[i+63:i] ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64EXTGATHER_PSLO
intrinsic.desc: Up-converts 8 memory locations starting at location mv at packed 64-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale using conv to single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements and stores them in the lower half of dst. hint indicates to the processor whether the load is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_PS_NONE: dst[i+31:i] := addr[i+31:i] _MM_UPCONV_PS_FLOAT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := Float16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := UInt8ToFloat32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT8: n := j*8 dst[i+31:i] := SInt8ToFloat32(addr[n+7:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_UINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := UInt16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) _MM_UPCONV_PS_SINT16: n := j*16 dst[i+31:i] := SInt16ToFloat32(addr[n+15:n]) ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64EXTSCATTER_EPI32LO

intrinsic.sign: VOID_PTR mv,__M512I index,__M512 v1,_MM_DOWNCONV_PS_ENUM conv,INT scale,INT hint
intrinsic.desc: Down-converts 8 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v1 using conv and stores them in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 64-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale. hint indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 CASE conv OF _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_NONE: addr[i+31:i] := v1[i+31:i] _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_FLOAT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := Float32ToFloat16(v1[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_UINT8: n := j*8 addr[n+7:n] := Float32ToUInt8(v1[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_SINT8: n := j*8 addr[n+7:n] := Float32ToSInt8(v1[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_UINT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := Float32ToUInt16(v1[i+31:i]) _MM_DOWNCONV_PS_SINT16: n := j*16 addr[n+15:n] := Float32ToSInt16(v1[i+31:i]) ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64GATHER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Gather 32-bit integers from memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 m := j*64 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64GATHER_EPI32LO
intrinsic.desc: Loads 8 32-bit integer memory locations starting at location mv at packed 64-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale to dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := addr[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

Gathered elements are merged into dst. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 m := j*64 dst[i+31:i] := MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Loads 8 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point memory locations starting at location mv at packed 64-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64SCATTER_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 32-bit integers from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 l := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+63:l])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64SCATTER_EPI32LO
intrinsic.desc: Stores 8 packed 32-bit integer elements in v1 in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 64-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] addr[i+31:i] := v1[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64SCATTER_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Scatter 64-bit integers from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64SCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scatter double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[i+63:i])*scale] := a[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64SCATTER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scatter single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a into memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale) subject to mask k (elements are not stored when the corresponding mask bit is not set). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 l := j*64 MEM[base_addr + SignExtend(vindex[l+63:l])*scale] := a[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_I64SCATTER_PSLO
intrinsic.desc: Stores 8 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v in memory locations starting at location mv at packed 64-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*32 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] addr[i+31:i] := v[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INSERTF32X4
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 4 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INSERTF32X8
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 256 bits (composed of 8 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INSERTF64X2
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 2 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INSERTF64X4
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 256 bits (composed of 4 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INSERTI32X4
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 4 packed 32-bit integers) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INSERTI32X8
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 256 bits (composed of 8 packed 32-bit integers) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INSERTI64X2
intrinsic.desc: Copy a to dst, then insert 128 bits (composed of 2 packed 64-bit integers) from b into dst at the location specified by imm8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INSERTI64X4

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INT2MASK
intrinsic.desc: Converts integer mask into bitmask, storing the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := mask[15:0]

intrinsic.desc: Converts integer mask into bitmask, storing the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INVSQRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := InvSQRT(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_INVSQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the inverse square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := InvSQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KAND
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 16-bit masks a and b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KAND
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of 16-bit masks a and b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KANDN
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of 16-bit masks a and then AND with b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KANDN
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of 16-bit masks a and then AND with b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KANDNR
intrinsic.desc: Performs a bitwise AND operation between NOT of k2 and k1, storing the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KCONCATHI_64
intrinsic.desc: Packs masks k1 and k2 into the high 32 bits of dst. The rest of dst is set to 0.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KCONCATLO_64
intrinsic.desc: Packs masks k1 and k2 into the low 32 bits of dst. The rest of dst is set to 0.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KEXTRACT_64
intrinsic.desc: Extracts 16-bit value b from 64-bit integer a, storing the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KMERGE2L1H
intrinsic.desc: Move the high element from k1 to the low element of k1, and insert the low element of k2 into the high element of k1.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KMERGE2L1L
intrinsic.desc: Insert the low element of k2 into the high element of k1.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KMOV
intrinsic.desc: Copy 16-bit mask a to k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KMOV
intrinsic.desc: Copy 16-bit mask a to k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KMOVLHB
intrinsic.desc: Inserts the low byte of mask k2 into the high byte of dst, and copies the low byte of k1 to the low byte of dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KNOT
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of 16-bit mask a, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KNOT
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of 16-bit mask a, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KOR
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of 16-bit masks a and b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KOR
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of 16-bit masks a and b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KORTESTC
intrinsic.desc: Performs bitwise OR between k1 and k2, storing the result in dst. CF flag is set if dst consists of all 1's.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := k1[15:0] | k2[15:0] IF PopCount(dst[15:0]) = 16 SetCF() FI

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KORTESTC
intrinsic.desc: Performs bitwise OR between k1 and k2, storing the result in dst. CF flag is set if dst consists of all 1's.
intrinsic.oper: dst[15:0] := k1[15:0] | k2[15:0] IF PopCount(dst[15:0]) = 16 SetCF() FI

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KORTESTZ
intrinsic.desc: Performs bitwise OR between k1 and k2, storing the result in dst. ZF flag is set if dst is 0.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KORTESTZ
intrinsic.desc: Performs bitwise OR between k1 and k2, storing the result in dst. ZF flag is set if dst is 0.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KSWAPB
intrinsic.desc: Moves high byte from k2 to low byte of k1, and moves low byte of k2 to high byte of k1.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KUNPACKB
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8 bits from masks a and b, and store the 16-bit result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KUNPACKD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32 bits from masks a and b, and store the 64-bit result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KUNPACKW
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16 bits from masks a and b, and store the 32-bit result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KXNOR
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XNOR of 16-bit masks a and b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KXNOR
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XNOR of 16-bit masks a and b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KXOR
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of 16-bit masks a and b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_KXOR
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of 16-bit masks a and b, and store the result in k.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_LOAD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Load 512-bits (composed of 16 packed 32-bit integers) from memory into dst. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[511:0] := MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_LOAD_EPI64

intrinsic.oper: dst[511:0] := MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_LOAD_PD

intrinsic.oper: dst[511:0] := MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Load 512-bits of integer data from memory into dst. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[511:0] := MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_LOADU_PD

intrinsic.oper: dst[511:0] := MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_LOADU_PS
