intrinsic.desc: Add packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b using saturation, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8( a[i+7:i] + b[i+7:i] ) ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ALIGNR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 128-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 32-bit elements, and stores the low 64 bytes (16 elements) in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: temp[1023:512] := a[511:0] temp[511:0] := b[511:0] temp[1023:0] := temp[1023:0] >> (32*count) FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := temp[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ALIGNR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate a and b into a 128-byte immediate result, shift the result right by count 64-bit elements, and stores the low 64 bytes (8 elements) in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: temp[1023:512] := a[511:0] temp[511:0] := b[511:0] temp[1023:0] := temp[1023:0] >> (64*count) FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := temp[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ALIGNR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Concatenate pairs of 16-byte blocks in a and b into a 32-byte temporary result, shift the result right by count bytes, and store the low 16 bytes in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 tmp[255:0] := ((a[i+127:i] << 128) OR b[i+127:i]) >> (count[7:0]*8) tmp_dst[i+127:i] := tmp[127:0] ENDFOR
FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := tmp_dst[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_AND_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] AND b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ANDNOT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NOT of packed 32-bit integers in a and then AND with b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := (NOT a[i+31:i]) AND b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := (a[i+15:i] + b[i+15:i] + 1) >> 1 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the lower 2 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a to all elements of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 n := (j mod 2)*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[n+31:n] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_COMPRESS_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Contiguously store the active 32-bit integers in a (those with their respective bit set in zeromask k) to dst, and set the remaining elements to zero.
intrinsic.oper: size := 32 m := 0 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[m+size-1:m] := a[i+31:i] m := m + size FI ENDFOR dst[511:m] := 0 dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_CONFLICT_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Test each 32-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[i] FOR l := 0 to j-1 m := l*32 dst[i+l] := (a[i+31:i] == a[m+31:m]) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR dst[i+31:i+j] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_CONFLICT_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Test each 64-bit element of a for equality with all other elements in a closer to the least significant bit using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Each element's comparison forms a zero extended bit vector in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_CVT_ROUNDEPI32_PS

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := Convert_Int32_To_FP32(a[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_DBSAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sum of absolute differences (SADs) of quadruplets of unsigned 8-bit integers in a compared to those in b, and store the 16-bit results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). The first two SADs use the lower 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a, and the last two SADs use the uppper 8-bit quadruplet of the lane from a. Quadruplets from b are selected from within 128-bit lanes according to the control in imm8, and each SAD in each 64-bit lane uses the selected quadruplet at 8-bit offsets.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_FIXUPIMM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 64-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.
intrinsic.oper:
enum TOKEN_TYPE { QNAN_TOKEN := 0, SNAN_TOKEN := 1, ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN := 2, ONE_VALUE_TOKEN := 3, NEG_INF_TOKEN := 4, POS_INF_TOKEN := 5, NEG_VALUE_TOKEN := 6, POS_VALUE_TOKEN := 7 } FIXUPIMMPD(src1[63:0], src2[63:0], src3[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ tsrc[63:0] := ((src2[62:52] == 0) AND (MXCSR.DAZ == 1)) ? 0.0 : src2[63:0] CASE(tsrc[63:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) QNAN_TOKEN:j := 0 SNAN_TOKEN:j := 1 ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 2 ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 3 NEG_INF_TOKEN: j := 4 POS_INF_TOKEN: j := 5 NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 6 POS_VALUE_TOKEN: j := 7 ESAC
token_response[3:0] := src3[3+4*j:4*j]
CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[63:0] := src1[63:0] 1 : dest[63:0] := tsrc[63:0] 2 : dest[63:0] := QNaN(tsrc[63:0]) 3 : dest[63:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[63:0] := -INF 5 : dest[63:0] := +INF 6 : dest[63:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[63:0] := -0 8 : dest[63:0] := +0 9 : dest[63:0] := -1 10: dest[63:0] := +1 11: dest[63:0] := 12 12: dest[63:0] := 90.0 13: dest[63:0] := PI/2 14: dest[63:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[63:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i], c[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Fix up packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b using packed 32-bit integers in c, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). imm8 is used to set the required flags reporting.

CASE(token_response[3:0]) of 0 : dest[31:0] := src1[31:0] 1 : dest[31:0] := tsrc[31:0] 2 : dest[31:0] := QNaN(tsrc[31:0]) 3 : dest[31:0] := QNAN_Indefinite 4 : dest[31:0] := -INF 5 : dest[31:0] := +INF 6 : dest[31:0] := tsrc.sign? INF : +INF 7 : dest[31:0] := -0 8 : dest[31:0] := +0 9 : dest[31:0] := -1 10: dest[31:0] := +1 11: dest[31:0] := 12 12: dest[31:0] := 90.0 13: dest[31:0] := PI/2 14: dest[31:0] := MAX_FLOAT 15: dest[31:0] := -MAX_FLOAT ESAC
CASE(tsrc[31:0] of TOKEN_TYPE) ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[0] then set #ZE ZERO_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[1] then set #IE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[2] then set #ZE ONE_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[3] then set #IE SNAN_TOKEN: if imm8[4] then set #IE NEG_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[5] then set #IE NEG_VALUE_TOKEN: if imm8[6] then set #IE POS_INF_TOKEN: if imm8[7] then set #IE ESAC RETURN dest[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := FIXUPIMMPD(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i], c[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_FMADD_PD

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_FMADDSUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_FMADDSUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) - c[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) + c[i+31:i] FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_FMADDSUB_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, alternatively add and subtract packed elements in c to/from the intermediate result, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF (j is even) dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) - c[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i]) + c[i+63:i] FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_GETEXP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Convert the exponent of each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to a double-precision (64-bit) floating-point number representing the integer exponent, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates floor(log2(x)) for each element.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ConvertExpFP64(a[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_GETMANT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Normalize the mantissas of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). This intrinsic essentially calculates (2^k)*|x.significand|, where k depends on the interval range defined by interv and the sign depends on sc and the source sign. The mantissa is normalized to the interval specified by interv, which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_NORM_1_2 // interval [1, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_2 // interval [0.5, 2) _MM_MANT_NORM_p5_1 // interval [0.5, 1) _MM_MANT_NORM_p75_1p5 // interval [0.75, 1.5)The sign is determined by sc which can take the following values: _MM_MANT_SIGN_src // sign = sign(src) _MM_MANT_SIGN_zero // sign = 0 _MM_MANT_SIGN_nan // dst = NaN if sign(src) = 1
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+63:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := GetNormalizedMantissa(a[i+31:i], sc, interv) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_INSERTF32X4

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_RANGE_PD

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_RANGE_ROUND_PD

intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := ReduceArgumentPD(src[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ROL_EPI32

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ROLV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ROR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src >>count) OR (src << (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ROR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src >> count) OR (src << (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ROUNDSCALE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.oper:

M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 1: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 2: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 3: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) ESAC
dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_ROUNDSCALE_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_RSQRT14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set). The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+63:i])) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SCALEF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:

FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SET1_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low packed 16-bit integer from a to all elements of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := a[15:0] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SET1_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 32-bit integer a to all elements of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[31:0] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SET1_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 64-bit integer a to all elements of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[63:0] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SET1_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 8-bit integer a to all elements of dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := a[7:0] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle packed 8-bit integers in a according to shuffle control mask in the corresponding 8-bit element of b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF k[j] IF b[i+7] == 1 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[3:0] := b[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[index*8+7:index*8] FI ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_F32X4
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 4 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_F64X2
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 2 double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_I32X4
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 4 32-bit integers) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_I64X2
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 2 64-bit integers) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLEHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in the high 64 bits of 128-bit lanes of a using the control in imm8. Store the results in the high 64 bits of 128-bit lanes of dst, with the low 64 bits of 128-bit lanes being copied from from a to dst, using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SHUFFLELO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in the low 64 bits of 128-bit lanes of a using the control in imm8. Store the results in the low 64 bits of 128-bit lanes of dst, with the high 64 bits of 128-bit lanes being copied from from a to dst, using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SLL_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF k[j] IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << count[63:0]) FI ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SLL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] IF count[63:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] << count[63:0]) FI ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SLL_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] IF count[63:0] > 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+63:i] << count[63:0]) FI ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_SLLI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_UNPACKLO_PD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_UNPACKLO_PS
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_XOR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_XOR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_XOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MASKZ_XOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst using zeromask k (elements are zeroed out when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF a[i+31:i] > b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF a[i+63:i] > b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] > b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] > b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF a[i+31:i] > b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF a[i+63:i] > b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] > b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MAX(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MAX(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MAX(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAX_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed maximum values in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MAX(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MAXABS_PS
intrinsic.desc: Determines the maximum of the absolute elements of each pair of corresponding elements of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := FpMax(Abs(a[i+31:i]), Abs(b[i+31:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] < b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF a[i+63:i] < b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF a[i+15:i] < b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] ELSE dst[i+15:i] := b[i+15:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF a[i+31:i] < b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] ELSE dst[i+31:i] := b[i+31:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF a[i+63:i] < b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] ELSE dst[i+63:i] := b[i+63:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF a[i+7:i] < b[i+7:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] ELSE dst[i+7:i] := b[i+7:i] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MIN(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MIN(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := MIN(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MIN_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compare packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store packed minimum values in dst. Pass __MM_FROUND_NO_EXC to sae to suppress all exceptions.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := MIN(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVEDUP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate even-indexed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from a, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVEHDUP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate odd-indexed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVELDUP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Duplicate even-indexed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from a, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVEPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 16-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF a[i+15] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVEPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 32-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF a[i+31] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:16] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVEPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 64-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF a[i+63] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVEPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Set each bit of mask register k based on the most significant bit of the corresponding packed 8-bit integer in a.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF a[i+7] k[j] := 1 ELSE k[j] := 0 FI ENDFOR k[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVM_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 16-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := 0xFFFF ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 32-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF k[j] dst[i+31:i] := 0xFFFFFFFF ELSE dst[i+31:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVM_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 64-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF k[j] dst[i+63:i] := 0xFFFFFFFFffffffff ELSE dst[i+63:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MOVM_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Set each packed 8-bit integer in dst to all ones or all zeros based on the value of the corresponding bit in k.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF k[j] dst[i+7:i] := 0xFF ELSE dst[i+7:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MUL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low 32-bit integers from each packed 64-bit element in a and b, and store the signed 64-bit results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MUL_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the low unsigned 32-bit integers from each packed 64-bit element in a and b, and store the unsigned 64-bit results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MUL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MUL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MUL_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MUL_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULHI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element multiplication between packed 32-bit integer elements in a and b and stores the high 32 bits of each result into dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) >> 32 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULHI_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the high 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[31:16] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULHI_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element multiplication between packed unsigned 32-bit integer elements in a and b and stores the high 32 bits of each result into dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i]) >> 32 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULHRS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate signed 32-bit integers. Truncate each intermediate integer to the 18 most significant bits, round by adding 1, and store bits [16:1] to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULLO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit integers, and store the low 16 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 tmp[31:0] := a[i+15:i] * b[i+15:i] dst[i+15:i] := tmp[15:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULLO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit integers, and store the low 32 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 tmp[63:0] := a[i+31:i] * b[i+31:i] dst[i+31:i] := tmp[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULLO_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Multiply the packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 128-bit integers, and store the low 64 bits of the intermediate integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 tmp[127:0] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] dst[i+63:i] := tmp[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULLOX_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Multiplies elements in packed 64-bit integer vectors a and b together, storing the lower 64 bits of the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] * b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_MULTISHIFT_EPI64_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: For each 64-bit element in b, select 8 unaligned bytes using a byte-granular shift control within the corresponding 64-bit element of a, and store the 8 assembled bytes to the corresponding 64-bit element of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR i := 0 to 7 q := i * 64 FOR j := 0 to 7 tmp8 := 0 ctrl := a[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] & 63 FOR l := 0 to 7 tmp8[l] := b[q+((ctrl+l) & 63)] ENDFOR dst[q+j*8+7:q+j*8] := tmp8[7:0] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_NEARBYINT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Rounds each packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point element in a to the nearest integer value and stores the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := NearbyInt(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_NEARBYINT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Rounds each packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a to the nearest integer value and stores the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := NearbyInt(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_OR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] OR b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_OR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the resut in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] OR b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_OR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] BITWISE OR b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_OR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] BITWISE OR b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_OR_SI512
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise OR of 512 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Convert packed 16-bit integers from a and b to packed 8-bit integers using signed saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[7:0] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[15:0]) dst[15:8] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[31:16]) dst[23:16] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 (a[47:32]) dst[31:24] := Saturate_Int16_To_Int8 intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKSTOREHI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed 32-bit integer elements of v1 into a doubleword stream at a logically mapped starting address (mt-64), storing the high-64-byte elements of that stream (those elements of the stream that map at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (m5-64)).
intrinsic.oper: storeOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false addr = mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 15 IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF ((addr + (storeOffset + 1)*4) % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary = true FI ELSE i := j*32 MEM[addr + storeOffset*4] := v1[i+31:i] FI storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKSTOREHI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed 64-bit integer elements of v1 into a quadword stream at a logically mapped starting address (mt-64), storing the high-64-byte elements of that stream (those elemetns of the stream that map at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (m5-64)).
intrinsic.oper: storeOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false addr = mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 7 IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF ((addr + (storeOffset + 1)*8) % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary = true FI ELSE i := j*64 MEM[addr + storeOffset*8] := v1[i+63:i] FI storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKSTOREHI_PD

intrinsic.oper: storeOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false addr = mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 7 IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF ((addr + (storeOffset + 1)*8) % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary = true FI ELSE i := j*64 MEM[addr + storeOffset*4] := v1[i+63:i] FI storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKSTOREHI_PS
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements of v1 into a doubleword stream at a logically mapped starting address (mt-64), storing the high-64-byte elements of that stream (those elemetns of the stream that map at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (m5-64)).
intrinsic.oper: storeOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false addr = mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 15 IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF ((addr + (storeOffset + 1)*4) % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary = true FI ELSE i := j*32 MEM[addr + storeOffset*4] := v1[i+31:i] FI storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKSTORELO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed 32-bit integer elements of v1 into a doubleword stream at a logically mapped starting address mt, storing the low-64-byte elements of that stream (those elements of the stream that map before the first 64-byte-aligned address follwing mt).
intrinsic.oper: storeOffset := 0 addr = mt FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 MEM[addr + storeOffset*4] := v1[i+31:i] storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 IF ((addr + storeOffset*4) % 64) == 0 BREAK FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKSTORELO_EPI64

intrinsic.oper: storeOffset := 0 addr = mt FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 MEM[addr + storeOffset*8] := v1[i+63:i] storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 IF ((addr + storeOffset*8) % 64) == 0 BREAK FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKSTORELO_PD
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements of v1 into a quadword stream at a logically mapped starting address mt, storing the low-64-byte elements of that stream (those elements of the stream that map before the first 64-byte-aligned address follwing mt).

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PACKSTORELO_PS
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements of v1 into a doubleword stream at a logically mapped starting address mt, storing the low-64-byte elements of that stream (those elements of the stream that map before the first 64-byte-aligned address follwing mt).
