intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTE4F128_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Permutes 128-bit blocks of the packed 32-bit integer vector a using constant imm8. The results are stored in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT4(src, control) { CASE control[1:0] OF 0: tmp[127:0] := src[127:0] 1: tmp[127:0] := src[255:128] 2: tmp[127:0] := src[383:256] 3: tmp[127:0] := src[511:384] ESAC RETURN tmp[127:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 n := j*2 dst[i+127:i] := SELECT4(a[511:0], imm8[n+1:n]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTE4F128_PS
intrinsic.desc: Permutes 128-bit blocks of the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using constant imm8. The results are stored in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SELECT4(src, control) { CASE control[1:0] OF 0: tmp[127:0] := src[127:0] 1: tmp[127:0] := src[255:128] 2: tmp[127:0] := src[383:256] 3: tmp[127:0] := src[511:384] ESAC RETURN tmp[127:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 n := j*2 dst[i+127:i] := SELECT4(a[511:0], imm8[n+1:n]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEVAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst. Note that this intrinsic shuffles across 128-bit lanes, unlike past intrinsics that use the permutevar name. This intrinsic is identical to _mm512_permutexvar_epi32, and it is recommended that you use that intrinsic name.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 id := idx[i+3:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[id+31:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEVAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEVAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEX_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a within 256-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEX_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a within 256-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 off := 16*idx[i+4:i] dst[i+15:i] := idx[i+5] ? b[off+15:off] : a[off+15:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 off := idx[i+3:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 off := idx[i+2:i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEX2VAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 off := 8*idx[i+5:i] dst[i+7:i] := idx[i+6] ? b[off+7:off] : a[off+7:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEX2VAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 off := idx[i+2:i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := idx[i+3] ? b[off+63:off] : a[off+63:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEX2VAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b across lanes using the corresponding selector and index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 off := idx[i+3:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := idx[i+4] ? b[off+31:off] : a[off+31:off] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 id := idx[i+4:i]*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[id+15:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 id := idx[i+3:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[id+31:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 64-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 id := idx[i+2:i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[id+63:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEXVAR_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 8-bit integers in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 id := idx[i+5:i]*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[id+7:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEXVAR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 id := idx[i+2:i]*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[id+63:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PERMUTEXVAR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a across lanes using the corresponding index in idx.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 id := idx[i+3:i]*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[id+31:id] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_POW_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a raised by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (a[i+63:i])^(b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_POW_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the exponential value of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a raised by packed elements in b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (a[i+31:i])^(b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I32EXTGATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Prefetches a set of 16 single-precision (32-bit) memory locations pointed by base address mv and 32-bit integer index vector index with scale scale to L1 or L2 level of cache depending on the value of hint. The hint parameter may be 1 (_MM_HINT_T0) for prefetching to L1 cache, or 2 (_MM_HINT_T1) for prefetching to L2 cache. The conv parameter specifies the granularity used by compilers to better encode the instruction. It should be the same as the conv parameter specified for the subsequent gather intrinsic.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] i := j*32 CASE hint OF _MM_HINT_T0: PrefetchL1WithT0Hint(addr[i+31:i]) _MM_HINT_T1: PrefetchL2WithT1Hint(addr[i+31:i]) ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I32EXTSCATTER_PS
intrinsic.sign: VOID_PTR mv,__M512I index,_MM_UPCONV_PS_ENUM conv,INT scale,INT hint
intrinsic.desc: Prefetches a set of 16 single-precision (32-bit) memory locations pointed by base address mv and 32-bit integer index vector index with scale scale to L1 or L2 level of cache depending on the value of hint, with a request for exclusive ownership. The hint parameter may be one of the following: _MM_HINT_T0 = 1 for prefetching to L1 cache, _MM_HINT_T1 = 2 for prefetching to L2 cache, _MM_HINT_T2 = 3 for prefetching to L2 cache non-temporal, _MM_HINT_NTA = 0 for prefetching to L1 cache non-temporal. The conv parameter specifies the granularity used by compilers to better encode the instruction. It should be the same as the conv parameter specified for the subsequent scatter intrinsic.
intrinsic.oper: cachev := 0 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] CASE hint OF _MM_HINT_T0: PrefetchL1WithT0Hint(addr[i+31:i]) _MM_HINT_T1: PrefetchL2WithT1Hint(addr[i+31:i]) _MM_HINT_T2: PrefetchL2WithT1HintNonTemporal(addr[i+31:i]) _MM_HINT_NTA: PrefetchL1WithT0HintNonTemporal(addr[i+31:i]) ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I32GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Prefetch double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 32-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged in cache. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8. The hint parameter may be 1 (_MM_HINT_T0) for prefetching to L1 cache, or 2 (_MM_HINT_T1) for prefetching to L2 cache.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I32GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Prefetches 16 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in memory starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale. The hint parameter may be 1 (_MM_HINT_T0) for prefetching to L1 cache, or 2 (_MM_HINT_T1) for prefetching to L2 cache.
intrinsic.oper: cachev := 0 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] cachev[i+31:i] := addr[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I32SCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Prefetch double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements with intent to write using 32-bit indices. The hint parameter may be 1 (_MM_HINT_T0) for prefetching to L1 cache, or 2 (_MM_HINT_T1) for prefetching to L2 cache. 64-bit elements are brought into cache from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 32-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I32SCATTER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Prefetches 16 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in memory starting at location mv at packed 32-bit integer indices stored in index scaled by scale. The hint parameter may be 1 (_MM_HINT_T0) for prefetching to L1 cache, or 2 (_MM_HINT_T1) for prefetching to L2 cache.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 addr := MEM[mv + index[j] * scale] CASE hint OF _MM_HINT_T0: PrefetchL1WithT0Hint(addr[i+31:i]) _MM_HINT_T1: PrefetchL2WithT1Hint(addr[i+31:i]) _MM_HINT_T2: PrefetchL2WithT1HintNonTemporal(addr[i+31:i]) _MM_HINT_NTA: PrefetchL1WithT0HintNonTemporal(addr[i+31:i]) ESAC ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I64GATHER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Prefetch double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from memory into cache level specified by hint using 64-bit indices. 64-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8. The hint parameter may be 1 (_MM_HINT_T0) for prefetching to L1 cache, or 2 (_MM_HINT_T1) for prefetching to L2 cache.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I64GATHER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Prefetch single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from memory using 64-bit indices. 32-bit elements are loaded from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). Gathered elements are merged in cache. scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8. The hint parameter may be 1 (_MM_HINT_T0) for prefetching to L1 cache, or 2 (_MM_HINT_T1) for prefetching to L2 cache.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I64SCATTER_PD
intrinsic.desc: Prefetch double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements with intent to write into memory using 64-bit indices. The hint parameter may be 1 (_MM_HINT_T0) for prefetching to L1 cache, or 2 (_MM_HINT_T1) for prefetching to L2 cache. 64-bit elements are brought into cache from addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_PREFETCH_I64SCATTER_PS
intrinsic.desc: Prefetch single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements with intent to write into memory using 64-bit indices. Elements are prefetched into cache level hint, where hint is 0 or 1. 32-bit elements are stored at addresses starting at base_addr and offset by each 64-bit element in vindex (each index is scaled by the factor in scale). scale should be 1, 2, 4 or 8.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RANGE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RANGE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RANGE_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RANGE_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Calculate the max, min, absolute max, or absolute min (depending on control in imm8) for packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst. imm8[1:0] specifies the operation control: 00 = min, 01 = max, 10 = absolute max, 11 = absolute min. imm8[3:2] specifies the sign control: 00 = sign from a, 01 = sign from compare result, 10 = clear sign bit, 11 = set sign bit. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RCP14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RCP14_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RCP23_PS
intrinsic.desc: Approximates the reciprocals of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to 23 bits of precision, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0/a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RCP28_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RCP28_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RCP28_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RCP28_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RECIP_PD
intrinsic.desc: Computes the reciprocal of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := (1 / a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RECIP_PS
intrinsic.desc: Computes the reciprocal of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := (1 / a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_ADD_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 32-bit integers in a by addition. Returns the sum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: sum[31:0] := 0 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 sum[31:0] := sum[31:0] + a[i+31:i] ENDFOR RETURN sum[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_ADD_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 64-bit integers in a by addition. Returns the sum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: sum[63:0] := 0 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 sum[63:0] := sum[63:0] + a[i+63:i] ENDFOR RETURN sum[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_ADD_PD
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by addition. Returns the sum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: sum[63:0] := 0 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 sum[63:0] := sum[63:0] + a[i+63:i] ENDFOR RETURN sum[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_ADD_PS
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by addition. Returns the sum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: sum[31:0] := 0 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 sum[31:0] := sum[31:0] + a[i+31:i] ENDFOR RETURN sum[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_AND_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 32-bit integers in a by bitwise AND. Returns the bitwise AND of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: reduced[31:0] := 0xFFFFFFFF FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 reduced[31:0] := reduced[31:0] AND a[i+31:i] ENDFOR RETURN reduced[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_AND_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 64-bit integers in a by bitwise AND. Returns the bitwise AND of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: reduced[63:0] := 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 reduced[63:0] := reduced[63:0] AND a[i+63:i] ENDFOR RETURN reduced[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_GMAX_PD
intrinsic.desc: Determines the maximum element of the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements stored in a and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: max = a[63:0] FOR j := 1 to 7 i := j*64 dst = FpMax(max, a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst := max

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_GMAX_PS
intrinsic.desc: Determines the maximum element of the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements stored in a and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: max = a[31:0] FOR j := 1 to 15 i := j*32 dst = FpMax(max, a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst := max

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_GMIN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Determines the minimum element of the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements stored in a and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: min = a[63:0] FOR j := 1 to 7 i := j*64 dst = FpMin(min, a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst := min

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_GMIN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Determines the minimum element of the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements stored in a and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: min = a[31:0] FOR j := 1 to 15 i := j*32 dst = FpMin(min, a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst := min

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MAX_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 32-bit integers in a by maximum. Returns the maximum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: max[31:0] := MIN_INT FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 max[31:0] := MAXIMUM(max[31:0], a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR RETURN max[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MAX_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 64-bit integers in a by maximum. Returns the maximum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: max[63:0] := MIN_INT FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 max[63:0] := MAXIMUM(max[63:0], a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR RETURN max[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MAX_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by maximum. Returns the maximum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: max[31:0] := 0 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 max[31:0] := MAXIMUM(max[31:0], a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR RETURN max[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MAX_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a by maximum. Returns the maximum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: max[63:0] := 0 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 max[63:0] := MAXIMUM(max[63:0], a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR RETURN max[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MAX_PD
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by maximum. Returns the maximum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: max[63:0] := MIN_DOUBLE FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 max[63:0] := MAXIMUM(max[63:0], a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR RETURN max[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MAX_PS
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by maximum. Returns the maximum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: max[31:0] := MIN_FLOAT FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 max[31:0] := MAXIMUM(max[31:0], a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR RETURN max[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MIN_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 32-bit integers in a by minimum. Returns the minimum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: min[31:0] := MAX_INT FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 min[31:0] := MINIMUM(min[31:0], a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR RETURN min[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MIN_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 64-bit integers in a by minimum. Returns the minimum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: min[63:0] := MAX_INT FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 min[63:0] := MINIMUM(min[63:0], a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR RETURN min[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MIN_EPU32
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by minimum. Returns the minimum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: min[31:0] := MAX_UINT FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 min[31:0] := MINIMUM(min[31:0], a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR RETURN min[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MIN_EPU64
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a by minimum. Returns the minimum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: min[63:0] := MAX_UINT FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 min[63:0] := MINIMUM(min[63:0], a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR RETURN min[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MIN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by minimum. Returns the minimum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: min[63:0] := MAX_DOUBLE FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 min[63:0] := MINIMUM(min[63:0], a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR RETURN min[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MIN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by minimum. Returns the minimum of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: min[31:0] := MAX_INT FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 min[31:0] := MINIMUM(min[31:0], a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR RETURN min[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MUL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 32-bit integers in a by multiplication. Returns the product of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: prod[31:0] := 1 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 prod[31:0] := prod[31:0] * a[i+31:i] ENDFOR RETURN prod[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MUL_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 64-bit integers in a by multiplication. Returns the product of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: prod[63:0] := 1 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 prod[63:0] := prod[63:0] * a[i+63:i] ENDFOR RETURN prod[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MUL_PD
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by multiplication. Returns the product of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: prod[63:0] := 1 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 prod[63:0] := prod[63:0] * a[i+63:i] ENDFOR RETURN prod[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_MUL_PS
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by multiplication. Returns the product of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: prod[31:0] := 1 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 prod[31:0] := prod[31:0] * a[i+31:i] ENDFOR RETURN prod[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_OR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 32-bit integers in a by bitwise OR. Returns the bitwise OR of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: reduced[31:0] := 0 FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 reduced[31:0] := reduced[31:0] OR a[i+31:i] ENDFOR RETURN reduced[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_OR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Reduce the packed 64-bit integers in a by bitwise OR. Returns the bitwise OR of all elements in a.
intrinsic.oper: reduced[63:0] := 0 FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 reduced[63:0] := reduced[63:0] OR a[i+63:i] ENDFOR RETURN reduced[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPD(src1[63:0], imm8[7:0]) { m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[63:0] := pow(2, -m) * ROUND(pow(2, m) * src1[63:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[63:0] := src1[63:0] - tmp[63:0] RETURN tmp[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ReduceArgumentPD(src[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REDUCE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Extract the reduced argument of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a by the number of bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
ReduceArgumentPS(src1[31:0], imm8[7:0]) { IF src1[31:0] == NAN RETURN (convert src1[31:0] to QNaN) FI
m := imm8[7:4] // number of fraction bits after the binary point to be preserved rc := imm8[1:0] // round control rc_src := imm8[2] // round ccontrol source spe := 0 tmp[31:0] := pow(2, -m)*ROUND(pow(2, m)*src1[31:0], spe, rc_source, rc) tmp[31:0] := src1[31:0] - tmp[31:0] RETURN tmp[31:0] } FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ReduceArgumentPS(src[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ReduceArgumentPD(src[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.oper:

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REM_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REM_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := 32*j dst[i+31:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+31:i] / b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REM_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := 64*j dst[i+63:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+63:i] / b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Divide packed 8-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := 8*j dst[i+7:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+7:i] / b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_REM_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := 16*j dst[i+15:i] := REMAINDER(a[i+15:i] / b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 32-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.

intrinsic.desc: Divide packed unsigned 64-bit integers in a by packed elements in b, and store the remainders as packed unsigned 32-bit integers in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RINT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Rounds the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the nearest even integer value and stores the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RoundToNearestEven(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RINT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Rounds the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the nearest even integer value and stores the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := RoundToNearestEven(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROL_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROLV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROLV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the left by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src << count) OR (src >> (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := LEFT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src >>count) OR (src << (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROR_EPI64

intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src >> count) OR (src << (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RORV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 32-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 32 RETURN (src >>count) OR (src << (32 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_DWORDS(a[i+31:i], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RORV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Rotate the bits in each packed 64-bit integer in a to the right by the number of bits specified in the corresponding element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(src, count_src){ count := count_src modulo 64 RETURN (src >> count) OR (src << (64 - count)) } FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RIGHT_ROTATE_QWORDS(a[i+63:i], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the nearest integer value using expadj and in the direction of rounding, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ROUND(a[i+31:i]) CASE expadj OF _MM_EXPADJ_NONE: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**0 _MM_EXPADJ_4: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**4 _MM_EXPADJ_5: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**5 _MM_EXPADJ_8: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**8 _MM_EXPADJ_16: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**16 _MM_EXPADJ_24: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**24 _MM_EXPADJ_31: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**31 _MM_EXPADJ_32: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**32 ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROUNDFXPNT_ADJUST_PD
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element rounding of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using expadj and in the direction of rounding and stores results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ROUND(a[i+63:i]) CASE expadj OF _MM_EXPADJ_NONE: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**0 _MM_EXPADJ_4: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**4 _MM_EXPADJ_5: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**5 _MM_EXPADJ_8: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**8 _MM_EXPADJ_16: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**16 _MM_EXPADJ_24: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**24 _MM_EXPADJ_31: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**31 _MM_EXPADJ_32: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**32 ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROUNDFXPNT_ADJUST_PS
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element rounding of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using expadj and in the direction of rounding and stores results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ROUND(a[i+31:i]) CASE expadj OF _MM_EXPADJ_NONE: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**0 _MM_EXPADJ_4: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**4 _MM_EXPADJ_5: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**5 _MM_EXPADJ_8: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**8 _MM_EXPADJ_16: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**16 _MM_EXPADJ_24: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**24 _MM_EXPADJ_31: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**31 _MM_EXPADJ_32: dst[i+31:i] = dst[i+31:i] * 2**32 ESAC ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROUNDSCALE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPD(src[63:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 1: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 2: tmp[63:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) 3: tmp[63:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[63:0]) ESAC
dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROUNDSCALE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
RoundTo_IntegerPS(src[31:0], imm8[7:0]){ IF(imm8[2] == 1) rounding_direction := MXCSR.RC //Use the rounding mode specified by MXCSR.RC ELSE rounding_direction := imm8[1:0] //Use the rounding mode specified by imm8[1:0] FI
M := imm8[7:4] // The scaling factor (number of fraction bits to round to)
CASE(rounding_direction) 0: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_even_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 1: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_smaller_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 2: tmp[31:0] := round_to_equal_or_larger_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) 3: tmp[31:0] := round_to_nearest_smallest_magnitude_integer(2^M * src[31:0]) ESAC
dst[31:0] := 2^-M * tmp[31:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPS(a[i+31:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROUNDSCALE_ROUND_PD

dst[63:0] := 2^-M * tmp[63:0] // scale back down
IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[63:0] != dst[63:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := RoundTo_IntegerPD(a[i+63:i], imm8[7:0]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_ROUNDSCALE_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Round packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to the number of fraction bits specified by imm8, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

IF imm8[3] == 0 //check SPE IF src[31:0] != dst[31:0] //check if precision has been lost set_precision() //set #PE FI FI RETURN dst[31:0] }

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RSQRT14_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+63:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RSQRT14_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-14.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := APPROXIMATE(1.0 / SQRT(a[i+31:i])) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RSQRT23_PS
intrinsic.desc: Calculates the reciprocal square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a to 23 bits of accuracy and stores the result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := Sqrt(1.0 / a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RSQRT28_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RSQRT28_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RSQRT28_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_RSQRT28_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the approximate reciprocal square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, store the results in dst. The maximum relative error for this approximation is less than 2^-28. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SAD_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Compute the absolute differences of packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a and b, then horizontally sum each consecutive 8 differences to produce eight unsigned 16-bit integers, and pack these unsigned 16-bit integers in the low 16 bits of 64-bit elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 tmp[i+7:i] := ABS(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+15:i] := tmp[i+7:i] + tmp[i+15:i+8] + tmp[i+23:i+16] + tmp[i+31:i+24] + tmp[i+39:i+32] + tmp[i+47:i+40] + tmp[i+55:i+48] + tmp[i+63:i+56] dst[i+63:i+16] := 0 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SBB_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element three-input subtraction of packed 32-bit integer elements of v3 as well as the corresponding bit from k from v2. The borrowed value from the subtraction difference for the nth element is written to the nth bit of borrow (borrow flag). Results are stored in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := v2[i+31:i] - v3[i+31:i] - k[j] borrow[j] := Borrow(v2[i+31:i] - v3[i+31:i] - k[j]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SBBR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element three-input subtraction of packed 32-bit integer elements of v2 as well as the corresponding bit from k from v3. The borrowed value from the subtraction difference for the nth element is written to the nth bit of borrow (borrow flag). Results are stored in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := v3[i+31:i] - v2[i+31:i] - k[j] borrow[j] := Borrow(v2[i+31:i] - v3[i+31:i] - k[j]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SCALE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scales each single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a by multiplying it by 2**exponent, where the exponent is the corresponding 32-bit integer element in b, storing results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] * Pow(2, b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SCALE_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scales each single-precision (32-bit) floating-point element in a by multiplying it by 2**exponent, where the exponenet is the corresponding 32-bit integer element in b, storing results in dst. Intermediate elements are rounded using rounding. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] * Pow(2, b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SCALEF_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SCALEF_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[31:0] := tmp_src1[31:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[31:0])) RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SCALEF_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[63:0] := tmp_src1[63:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[63:0])) RETURN dst[63:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SCALE(a[i+63:0], b[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SCALEF_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Scale the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a using values from b, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper:
SCALE(src1, src2){ IF (src2 == NaN) IF (src2 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src2) FI ELSE IF (src1 == NaN) IF (src1 == SNaN) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI IF (src2 != INF) RETURN QNAN(src1) FI ELSE tmp_src2 := src2 tmp_src1 := src1 IF (src2 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src2 := 0 FI IF (src1 is denormal AND MXCSR.DAZ) tmp_src1 := 0 FI FI dst[31:0] := tmp_src1[31:0] * POW(2, FLOOR(tmp_src2[31:0])) RETURN dst[31:0] }
FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SCALE(a[i+31:0], b[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET_EPI32
intrinsic.sign: INT e15,INT e14,INT e13,INT e12,INT e11,INT e10,INT e9,INT e8,INT e7,INT e6,INT e5,INT e4,INT e3,INT e2,INT e1,INT e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 32-bit integers in dst with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET_EPI64
intrinsic.sign: __INT64 e7,__INT64 e6,__INT64 e5,__INT64 e4,__INT64 e3,__INT64 e2,__INT64 e1,__INT64 e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 64-bit integers in dst with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET_PD
intrinsic.sign: DOUBLE e7,DOUBLE e6,DOUBLE e5,DOUBLE e4,DOUBLE e3,DOUBLE e2,DOUBLE e1,DOUBLE e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET_PS
intrinsic.sign: FLOAT e15,FLOAT e14,FLOAT e13,FLOAT e12,FLOAT e11,FLOAT e10,FLOAT e9,FLOAT e8,FLOAT e7,FLOAT e6,FLOAT e5,FLOAT e4,FLOAT e3,FLOAT e2,FLOAT e1,FLOAT e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET1_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast the low packed 16-bit integer from a to all all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[15:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET1_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 32-bit integer a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET1_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 64-bit integer a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET1_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast 8-bit integer a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[7:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET1_PD
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast double-precision (64-bit) floating-point value a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[63:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET1_PS
intrinsic.desc: Broadcast single-precision (32-bit) floating-point value a to all elements of dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[31:0] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET4_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 32-bit integers in dst with the repeated 4 element sequence.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET4_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 64-bit integers in dst with the repeated 4 element sequence.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET4_PD
intrinsic.desc: Set packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the repeated 4 element sequence.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SET4_PS
intrinsic.desc: Set packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the repeated 4 element sequence.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETR_EPI32
intrinsic.sign: INT e15,INT e14,INT e13,INT e12,INT e11,INT e10,INT e9,INT e8,INT e7,INT e6,INT e5,INT e4,INT e3,INT e2,INT e1,INT e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 32-bit integers in dst with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETR_EPI64
intrinsic.sign: __INT64 e7,__INT64 e6,__INT64 e5,__INT64 e4,__INT64 e3,__INT64 e2,__INT64 e1,__INT64 e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 64-bit integers in dst with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETR_PD
intrinsic.sign: DOUBLE e7,DOUBLE e6,DOUBLE e5,DOUBLE e4,DOUBLE e3,DOUBLE e2,DOUBLE e1,DOUBLE e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETR_PS
intrinsic.sign: FLOAT e15,FLOAT e14,FLOAT e13,FLOAT e12,FLOAT e11,FLOAT e10,FLOAT e9,FLOAT e8,FLOAT e7,FLOAT e6,FLOAT e5,FLOAT e4,FLOAT e3,FLOAT e2,FLOAT e1,FLOAT e0
intrinsic.desc: Set packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETR4_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 32-bit integers in dst with the repeated 4 element sequence in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETR4_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Set packed 64-bit integers in dst with the repeated 4 element sequence in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETR4_PD
intrinsic.desc: Set packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the repeated 4 element sequence in reverse order.
