intrinsic.desc: Set packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in dst with the repeated 4 element sequence in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETZERO
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512 with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETZERO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512i with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETZERO_PD
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512d with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETZERO_PS
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512 with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SETZERO_SI512
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512i with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 32-bit integers in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLE_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle packed 8-bit integers in a according to shuffle control mask in the corresponding 8-bit element of b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 IF b[i+7] == 1 dst[i+7:i] := 0 ELSE index[3:0] := b[i+3:i] dst[i+7:i] := a[index*8+7:index*8] FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLE_F32X4
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 4 single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLE_F64X2
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 2 double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLE_I32X4
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 4 32-bit integers) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLE_I64X2
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 128-bits (composed of 2 64-bit integers) selected by imm8 from a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a within 128-bit lanes using the control in imm8, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLEHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in the high 64 bits of 128-bit lanes of a using the control in imm8. Store the results in the high 64 bits of 128-bit lanes of dst, with the low 64 bits of 128-bit lanes being copied from from a to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SHUFFLELO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shuffle 16-bit integers in the low 64 bits of 128-bit lanes of a using the control in imm8. Store the results in the low 64 bits of 128-bit lanes of dst, with the high 64 bits of 128-bit lanes being copied from from a to dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SIN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SIN(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SIN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SIN(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SINCOS_PD
intrinsic.desc: Computes the sine and cosine of the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and stores the results of the sine computation in dst and the results of the cosine computation in cos_res.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SIN(a[i+63:i]) cos_res[i+63:i] := COS(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0 cos_res[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SINCOS_PS
intrinsic.desc: Computes the sine and cosine of the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and stores the results of the sine computation in dst and the results of the cosine computation in cos_res.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SIN(a[i+31:i]) cos_res[i+31:i] := COS(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0 cos_res[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SIND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SIND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SIND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the sine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SIND(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SINH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic sine of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SINH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SINH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic sine of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SINH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLL_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF count[63:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] << count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLL_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a left by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF count[63:0] > 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+63:i] << count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLLI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF imm8[7:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLLI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a left by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF imm8[7:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] << imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLLI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a left by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF imm8[7:0] > 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+63:i] << imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLLV_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a left by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] << count[i+15:i]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLLV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a left by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] << count[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SLLV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a left by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+63:i] << count[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SQRT_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SQRT(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SQRT_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SQRT_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SQRT(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SQRT_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the square root of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SQRT(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRA_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+15:i] := SignExtend(a[i+15:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRA_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF count[63:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+31:i] := SignExtend(a[i+31:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRA_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF count[63:0] > 63 dst[i+63:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+63:i] := SignExtend(a[i+63:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRAI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF imm8[7:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+15:i] := SignExtend(a[i+15:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRAI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF imm8[7:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+31:i] := SignExtend(a[i+31:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRAI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF imm8[7:0] > 63 dst[i+63:i] := SignBit ELSE dst[i+63:i] := SignExtend(a[i+63:i] << imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRAV_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := SignExtend(a[i+15:i] >> count[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRAV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := SignExtend(a[i+31:i] >> count[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRAV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a right by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in sign bits, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := SignExtend(a[i+63:i] >> count[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRL_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF count[63:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRL_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF count[63:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRL_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a right by count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF count[63:0] > 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+63:i] >> count[63:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRLI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF imm8[7:0] > 15 dst[i+15:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRLI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 IF imm8[7:0] > 31 dst[i+31:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRLI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a right by imm8 while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 IF imm8[7:0] > 63 dst[i+63:i] := 0 ELSE dst[i+63:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+63:i] >> imm8[7:0]) FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRLV_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 16-bit integers in a right by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 IF k[j] dst[i+15:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+15:i] >> count[i+15:i]) ELSE dst[i+15:i] := 0 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRLV_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 32-bit integers in a right by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+31:i] >> count[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SRLV_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Shift packed 64-bit integers in a right by the amount specified by the corresponding element in count while shifting in zeros, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ZeroExtend(a[i+63:i] >> count[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits (composed of 16 packed 32-bit integers) from a into memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORE_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits (composed of 8 packed 64-bit integers) from a into memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits (composed of 8 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits (composed of 16 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORE_SI512
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits of integer data from a into memory. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORENR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from v to memory address mt with a no-read hint to the processor.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 addr[i+63:i] := v[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORENR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from v to memory address mt with a no-read hint to the processor.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 addr[i+31:i] := v[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORENRNGO_PD
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from v to memory address mt with a no-read hint and using a weakly-ordered memory consistency model (stores performed with this function are not globally ordered, and subsequent stores from the same thread can be observed before them).
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 addr[i+63:i] := v[i+63:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STORENRNGO_PS
intrinsic.desc: Stores packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from v to memory address mt with a no-read hint and using a weakly-ordered memory consistency model (stores performed with this function are not globally ordered, and subsequent stores from the same thread can be observed before them).
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[mt] FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 addr[i+31:i] := v[i+31:i] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STOREU_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits (composed of 8 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STOREU_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits (composed of 16 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STOREU_SI512
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits of integer data from a into memory. mem_addr does not need to be aligned on any particular boundary.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STREAM_LOAD_SI512
intrinsic.desc: Load 512-bits of integer data from memory into dst using a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: dst[511:0] := MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STREAM_PD
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits (composed of 8 packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory using a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STREAM_PS
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits (composed of 16 packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements) from a into memory using a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_STREAM_SI512
intrinsic.desc: Store 512-bits of integer data from a into memory using a non-temporal memory hint. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary or a general-protection exception may be generated.
intrinsic.oper: MEM[mem_addr+511:mem_addr] := a[511:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUB_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUB_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 32-bit integers in b from packed 32-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUB_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 64-bit integers in b from packed 64-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] - b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUB_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 8-bit integers in b from packed 8-bit integers in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUB_PD
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in b from packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] - b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUB_PS
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in b from packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUB_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in b from packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] - b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUB_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in b from packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] - b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element subtraction of packed 32-bit integer elements in v2 from v3 storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := v3[i+31:i] - v2[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element subtraction of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in v2 from v3 storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := v3[i+63:i] - v2[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element subtraction of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v2 from v3 storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := v3[i+31:i] - v2[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBR_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element subtraction of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in v2 from v3 storing the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := v3[i+63:i] - v2[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBR_ROUND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element subtraction of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v2 from v3 storing the results in dst. Rounding is done according to the rounding parameter, which can be one of: (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEAREST_INT |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round to nearest, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_NEG_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round down, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_POS_INF |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // round up, and suppress exceptions (_MM_FROUND_TO_ZERO |_MM_FROUND_NO_EXC) // truncate, and suppress exceptions _MM_FROUND_CUR_DIRECTION // use MXCSR.RC; see _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := v3[i+31:i] - v2[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBRSETB_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element subtraction of packed 32-bit integer elements in v2 from v3, storing the results in dst and v2. The borrowed value from the subtraction difference for the nth element is written to the nth bit of borrow (borrow flag).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := v3[i+31:i] - v2[i+31:i] borrow[j] := Borrow(v3[i+31:i] - v2[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBS_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 16-bit integers in b from packed 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_Int16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBS_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed 8-bit integers in b from packed 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_Int8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBS_EPU16
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 16-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 16-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 31 i := j*16 dst[i+15:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt16(a[i+15:i] - b[i+15:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBS_EPU8
intrinsic.desc: Subtract packed unsigned 8-bit integers in b from packed unsigned 8-bit integers in a using saturation, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 dst[i+7:i] := Saturate_To_UnsignedInt8(a[i+7:i] - b[i+7:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SUBSETB_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Performs element-by-element subtraction of packed 32-bit integer elements in v3 from v2, storing the results in dst and the nth borrow bit in the nth position of borrow (borrow flag).
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := v2[i+31:i] - v3[i+31:i] borrow[j] := Borrow(v2[i+31:i] - v3[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SVML_ROUND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Round the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a to the nearest integer value, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := ROUND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SWIZZLE_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Performs a swizzle transformation of each of the four groups of packed 4x 32-bit integer elements in v using swizzle parameter s, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: CASE s OF _MM_SWIZ_REG_NONE: dst[511:0] := v[511:0] _MM_SWIZ_REG_DCBA: dst[511:0] := v[511:0] _MM_SWIZ_REG_CDAB: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+31:i] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_BADC: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+127:i+96] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+63:i+32] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_AAAA: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+31:i] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_BBBB: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+63:i+32] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_CCCC: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+95:i+64] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_DDDD: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+127:i+96] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+127:i+96] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+127:i+96] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+127:i+96] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_DACB: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+127:i+96] ENDFOR ESAC dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SWIZZLE_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Performs a swizzle transformation of each of the two groups of packed 4x64-bit integer elements in v using swizzle parameter s, storing the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SWIZZLE_PD
intrinsic.desc: Performs a swizzle transformation of each of the two groups of packed 4x double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in v using swizzle parameter s, storing the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_SWIZZLE_PS
intrinsic.desc: Performs a swizzle transformation of each of the four groups of packed 4xsingle-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in v using swizzle parameter s, storing the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: CASE s OF _MM_SWIZ_REG_NONE: dst[511:0] := v[511:0] _MM_SWIZ_REG_DCBA: dst[511:0] := v[511:0] _MM_SWIZ_REG_CDAB: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+31:i] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_BADC: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+127:i+96] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+63:i+32] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_AAAA: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+31:i] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_BBBB: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+63:i+32] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_CCCC: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+95:i+64] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_DDDD: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+127:i+96] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+127:i+96] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+127:i+96] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+127:i+96] ENDFOR _MM_SWIZ_REG_DACB: FOR j := 0 to 3 i := j*128 dst[i+31:i] := v[i+63:i+32] dst[i+63:i+32] := v[i+95:i+64] dst[i+95:i+64] := v[i+31:i] dst[i+127:i+96] := v[i+127:i+96] ENDFOR ESAC dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TAN_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TAN(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TAN_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TAN(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TAND_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TAND(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TAND_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in degrees, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TAND(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TANH_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic tangent of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TANH(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TANH_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the hyperbolic tangent of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a expressed in radians, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TANH(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 32-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 FOR h := 0 to 31 index[2:0] := (a[i+h] << 2) OR (b[i+h] << 1) OR c[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TERNARYLOGIC_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Bitwise ternary logic that provides the capability to implement any three-operand binary function; the specific binary function is specified by value in imm8. For each bit in each packed 64-bit integer, the corresponding bit from a, b, and c are used to form a 3 bit index into imm8, and the value at that bit in imm8 is written to the corresponding bit in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 FOR h := 0 to 63 index[2:0] := (a[i+h] << 2) OR (b[i+h] << 1) OR c[i+h] dst[i+h] := imm8[index[2:0]] ENDFOR ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TEST_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 16-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TEST_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TEST_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 k[j] := ((a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TEST_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise AND of packed 8-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 8-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is non-zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 k[j] := ((a[i+7:i] AND b[i+7:i]) != 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TESTN_EPI16_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 16-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 16-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TESTN_EPI32_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 32-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TESTN_EPI64_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 64-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 k[j] := ((a[i+63:i] AND b[i+63:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:8] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TESTN_EPI8_MASK
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise NAND of packed 8-bit integers in a and b, producing intermediate 8-bit values, and set the corresponding bit in result mask k if the intermediate value is zero.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 63 i := j*8 k[j] := ((a[i+7:i] AND b[i+7:i]) == 0) ? 1 : 0 ENDFOR k[MAX:64] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TRUNC_PD
intrinsic.desc: Truncate the packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results as packed double-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+63:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_TRUNC_PS
intrinsic.desc: Truncate the packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a, and store the results as packed single-precision floating-point elements in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := TRUNCATE(a[i+31:i]) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNDEFINED
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512 with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNDEFINED_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512i with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNDEFINED_PD
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512d with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNDEFINED_PS
intrinsic.desc: Return vector of type __m512 with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKHI_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKHI_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[31:0] := src1[95:64] dst[63:32] := src2[95:64] dst[95:64] := src1[127:96] dst[127:96] := src2[127:96] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[383:256] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[383:256], b[383:256]) dst[511:384] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[511:384], b[511:384]) dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKHI_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 64-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[63:0] := src1[127:64] dst[127:64] := src2[127:64] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[383:256] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[383:256], b[383:256]) dst[511:384] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[511:384], b[511:384]) dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKHI_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8-bit integers from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKHI_PD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[63:0] := src1[127:64] dst[127:64] := src2[127:64] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[383:256] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[383:256], b[383:256]) dst[511:384] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_QWORDS(a[511:384], b[511:384]) dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKHI_PS
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from the high half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[31:0] := src1[95:64] dst[63:32] := src2[95:64] dst[95:64] := src1[127:96] dst[127:96] := src2[127:96] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[383:256] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[383:256], b[383:256]) dst[511:384] := INTERLEAVE_HIGH_DWORDS(a[511:384], b[511:384]) dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKLO_EPI16
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 16-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKLO_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 32-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKLO_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 64-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[63:0] := src1[63:0] dst[127:64] := src2[63:0] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[383:256] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[383:256], b[383:256]) dst[511:384] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[511:384], b[511:384]) dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKLO_EPI8
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave 8-bit integers from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKLO_PD
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper:
INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(src1[127:0], src2[127:0]){ dst[63:0] := src1[63:0] dst[127:64] := src2[63:0] RETURN dst[127:0] }
dst[127:0] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[127:0], b[127:0]) dst[255:128] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[255:128], b[255:128]) dst[383:256] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[383:256], b[383:256]) dst[511:384] := INTERLEAVE_QWORDS(a[511:384], b[511:384]) dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_UNPACKLO_PS
intrinsic.desc: Unpack and interleave single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements from the low half of each 128-bit lane in a and b, and store the results in dst.

intrinsic.name: _MM512_XOR_EPI32
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed 32-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_XOR_EPI64
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed 64-bit integers in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_XOR_PD
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed double-precision (64-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := a[i+63:i] XOR b[i+63:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_XOR_PS
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of packed single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in a and b, and store the results in dst.
intrinsic.oper: FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := a[i+31:i] XOR b[i+31:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _MM512_XOR_SI512
intrinsic.desc: Compute the bitwise XOR of 512 bits (representing integer data) in a and b, and store the result in dst.

intrinsic.name: _PDEP_U32
intrinsic.desc: Deposit contiguous low bits from unsigned 32-bit integer a to dst at the corresponding bit locations specified by mask; all other bits in dst are set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := a dst := 0 m := 0 k := 0 DO WHILE m < 32 IF mask[m] = 1 dst[m] := tmp[k] k := k + 1 FI m := m + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _PDEP_U64
intrinsic.desc: Deposit contiguous low bits from unsigned 64-bit integer a to dst at the corresponding bit locations specified by mask; all other bits in dst are set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := a dst := 0 m := 0 k := 0 DO WHILE m < 64 IF mask[m] = 1 dst[m] := tmp[k] k := k + 1 FI m := m + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _PEXT_U32
intrinsic.desc: Extract bits from unsigned 32-bit integer a at the corresponding bit locations specified by mask to contiguous low bits in dst; the remaining upper bits in dst are set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := a dst := 0 m := 0 k := 0 DO WHILE m < 32 IF mask[m] = 1 dst[k] := tmp[m] k := k + 1 FI m := m + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _PEXT_U64
intrinsic.desc: Extract bits from unsigned 64-bit integer a at the corresponding bit locations specified by mask to contiguous low bits in dst; the remaining upper bits in dst are set to zero.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := a dst := 0 m := 0 k := 0 DO WHILE m < 64 IF mask[m] = 1 dst[k] := tmp[m] k := k + 1 FI m := m + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _POPCNT32
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of bits set to 1 in 32-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := 0 FOR i := 0 to 31 IF a[i] dst := dst + 1 FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _POPCNT64
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of bits set to 1 in 64-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := 0 FOR i := 0 to 63 IF a[i] dst := dst + 1 FI ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _RDPMC
intrinsic.desc: Read the Performance Monitor Counter (PMC) specified by a, and store up to 64-bits in dst. The width of performance counters is implementation specific.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := ReadPMC(a)

intrinsic.name: _RDRAND16_STEP
intrinsic.desc: Read a hardware generated 16-bit random value and store the result in val. Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.

intrinsic.name: _RDRAND32_STEP
intrinsic.desc: Read a hardware generated 32-bit random value and store the result in val. Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.

intrinsic.name: _RDRAND64_STEP
intrinsic.desc: Read a hardware generated 64-bit random value and store the result in val. Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.

intrinsic.name: _RDSEED16_STEP
intrinsic.desc: Read a 16-bit NIST SP800-90B and SP800-90C compliant random value and store in val. Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.oper: IF HW_NRND_GEN.ready = 1 THEN val[15:0] := HW_NRND_GEN.data RETURN 1 ELSE val[15:0] := 0 RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _RDSEED32_STEP
intrinsic.desc: Read a 32-bit NIST SP800-90B and SP800-90C compliant random value and store in val. Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.oper: IF HW_NRND_GEN.ready = 1 THEN val[31:0] := HW_NRND_GEN.data RETURN 1 ELSE val[31:0] := 0 RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _RDSEED64_STEP
intrinsic.desc: Read a 64-bit NIST SP800-90B and SP800-90C compliant random value and store in val. Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.oper: IF HW_NRND_GEN.ready = 1 THEN val[63:0] := HW_NRND_GEN.data RETURN 1 ELSE val[63:0] := 0 RETURN 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _RDTSC
intrinsic.desc: Copy the current 64-bit value of the processor's time-stamp counter into dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := TimeStampCounter

intrinsic.name: _READFSBASE_U32
intrinsic.desc: Read the FS segment base register and store the 32-bit result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := FS_Segment_Base_Register; dst[63:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _READFSBASE_U64
intrinsic.desc: Read the FS segment base register and store the 64-bit result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := FS_Segment_Base_Register;

intrinsic.name: _READGSBASE_U32
intrinsic.desc: Read the GS segment base register and store the 32-bit result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[31:0] := GS_Segment_Base_Register; dst[63:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _READGSBASE_U64
intrinsic.desc: Read the GS segment base register and store the 64-bit result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := GS_Segment_Base_Register;

intrinsic.name: _ROTL
intrinsic.desc: Shift the bits of unsigned 32-bit integer a left by the number of bits specified in shift, rotating the most-significant bit to the least-significant bit location, and store the unsigned result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a count := shift BITWISE AND 31 DO WHILE (count > 0) tmp[0] := dst[31] dst := (dst << 1) OR tmp[0] count := count - 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _ROTR
intrinsic.desc: Shift the bits of unsigned 32-bit integer a right by the number of bits specified in shift, rotating the least-significant bit to the most-significant bit location, and store the unsigned result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a count := shift BITWISE AND 31 DO WHILE (count > 0) tmp[31] := dst[0] dst := (dst >> 1) OR tmp[31] count := count - 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _ROTWL
intrinsic.desc: Shift the bits of unsigned 16-bit integer a left by the number of bits specified in shift, rotating the most-significant bit to the least-significant bit location, and store the unsigned result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a count := shift BITWISE AND 15 DO WHILE (count > 0) tmp[0] := dst[15] dst := (dst << 1) OR tmp[0] count := count - 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _ROTWR
intrinsic.desc: Shift the bits of unsigned 16-bit integer a right by the number of bits specified in shift, rotating the least-significant bit to the most-significant bit location, and store the unsigned result in dst.
intrinsic.oper: dst := a count := shift BITWISE AND 15 DO WHILE (count > 0) tmp[15] := dst[0] dst := (dst >> 1) OR tmp[15] count := count - 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _STOREBE_I16
intrinsic.desc: Stores word-sized (16-bit) data to address ptr in big-endian format.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[ptr] FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*8 addr[i+7:i] := data[15-i:15-i-7] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _STOREBE_I32
intrinsic.desc: Stores double word-sized (32-bit) data to address ptr in big-endian format.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[ptr] FOR j := 0 to 4 i := j*8 addr[i+7:i] := data[31-i:31-i-7] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _STOREBE_I64
intrinsic.desc: Stores quad word-sized (64-bit) data to address ptr in big-endian format.
intrinsic.oper: addr := MEM[ptr] FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*8 addr[i+7:i] := data[63-i:63-i-7] ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _SUBBORROW_U32
intrinsic.desc: Add unsigned 8-bit borrow b_in (carry flag) to unsigned 32-bit integer a, and subtract the result from unsigned 32-bit integer b. Store the unsigned 32-bit result in out, and the carry-out in dst (carry or overflow flag).

intrinsic.name: _SUBBORROW_U64
intrinsic.desc: Add unsigned 8-bit borrow b_in (carry flag) to unsigned 64-bit integer a, and subtract the result from unsigned 64-bit integer b. Store the unsigned 64-bit result in out, and the carry-out in dst (carry or overflow flag).

intrinsic.name: _TZCNT_U32
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of trailing zero bits in unsigned 32-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 0 dst := 0 DO WHILE ((tmp < 32) AND a[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp + 1 dst := dst + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _TZCNT_U64
intrinsic.desc: Count the number of trailing zero bits in unsigned 64-bit integer a, and return that count in dst.
intrinsic.oper: tmp := 0 dst := 0 DO WHILE ((tmp < 64) AND a[tmp] = 0) tmp := tmp + 1 dst := dst + 1 OD

intrinsic.name: _WRITEFSBASE_U32
intrinsic.desc: Write the unsigned 32-bit integer a to the FS segment base register.
intrinsic.oper: FS_Segment_Base_Register[31:0] := a[31:0]; FS_Segment_Base_Register[63:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _WRITEFSBASE_U64
intrinsic.desc: Write the unsigned 64-bit integer a to the FS segment base register.
intrinsic.oper: FS_Segment_Base_Register[63:0] := a[63:0];

intrinsic.name: _WRITEGSBASE_U32
intrinsic.desc: Write the unsigned 32-bit integer a to the GS segment base register.
intrinsic.oper: GS_Segment_Base_Register[31:0] := a[31:0]; GS_Segment_Base_Register[63:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _WRITEGSBASE_U64
intrinsic.desc: Write the unsigned 64-bit integer a to the GS segment base register.
intrinsic.oper: GS_Segment_Base_Register[63:0] := a[63:0];

intrinsic.name: _XABORT
intrinsic.desc: Force an RTM abort. The EAX register is updated to reflect an XABORT instruction caused the abort, and the imm8 parameter will be provided in bits [31:24] of EAX. Following an RTM abort, the logical processor resumes execution at the fallback address computed through the outermost XBEGIN instruction.
intrinsic.oper: IF RTM_ACTIVE = 0 // nop ELSE // restore architectural register state // discard memory updates performed in transaction // update EAX with status and imm8 value RTM_NEST_COUNT := 0 RTM_ACTIVE := 0 IF 64-bit Mode RIP := fallbackRIP ELSE EIP := fallbackEIP FI FI

intrinsic.name: _XBEGIN
intrinsic.desc: Specify the start of an RTM code region. If the logical processor was not already in transactional execution, then this call causes the logical processor to transition into transactional execution. On an RTM abort, the logical processor discards all architectural register and memory updates performed during the RTM execution, restores architectural state, and starts execution beginning at the fallback address computed from the outermost XBEGIN instruction.
intrinsic.oper:
IF RTM_NEST_COUNT < MAX_RTM_NEST_COUNT RTM_NEST_COUNT := RTM_NEST_COUNT + 1 IF RTM_NEST_COUNT = 1 IF 64-bit Mode fallbackRIP := RIP + SignExtend(IMM) ELSE IF 32-bit Mode fallbackEIP := EIP + SignExtend(IMM) ELSE // 16-bit Mode fallbackEIP := (EIP + SignExtend(IMM)) AND 0x0000FFFF FI
RTM_ACTIVE := 1 // enter RTM execution, record register state, start tracking memory state FI ELSE // RTM abort (see _xabort) FI

intrinsic.name: _XEND
intrinsic.desc: Specify the end of an RTM code region. If this corresponds to the outermost scope, the logical processor will attempt to commit the logical processor state atomically. If the commit fails, the logical processor will perform an RTM abort.
intrinsic.oper: IF RTM_ACTIVE = 1 RTM_NEST_COUNT := RTM_NEST_COUNT - 1 IF RTM_NEST_COUNT = 0 // try to commit transaction IF fail to commit transaction // RTM abort (see _xabort) ELSE RTM_ACTIVE = 0 FI FI FI

intrinsic.name: _XGETBV
intrinsic.desc: Copy up to 64-bits from the value of the extended control register (XCR) specified by a into dst. Currently only XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK XCR is supported.
intrinsic.oper: dst[63:0] := XCR[a]

intrinsic.name: _XRSTOR
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial restore of the enabled processor states using the state information stored in memory at mem_addr. State is restored based on bits [62:0] in rs_mask, XCR0, and mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: st_mask = mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF (rs_mask[i] AND XCR0[i]) IF st_mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: ProcessorState[x87 FPU] := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] 1: ProcessorState[SSE] := mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] DEFAULT: ProcessorState[i] := mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] ESAC ELSE // ProcessorExtendedState := Processor Supplied Values CASE (i) OF 1: MXCSR := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[SSE] ESAC FI FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XRSTOR64
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial restore of the enabled processor states using the state information stored in memory at mem_addr. State is restored based on bits [62:0] in rs_mask, XCR0, and mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: st_mask = mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF (rs_mask[i] AND XCR0[i]) IF st_mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: ProcessorState[x87 FPU] := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] 1: ProcessorState[SSE] := mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] DEFAULT: ProcessorState[i] := mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] ESAC ELSE // ProcessorExtendedState := Processor Supplied Values CASE (i) OF 1: MXCSR := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[SSE] ESAC FI FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XRSTORS
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial restore of the enabled processor states using the state information stored in memory at mem_addr. xrstors differs from xrstor in that it can restore state components corresponding to bits set in the IA32_XSS MSR; xrstors cannot restore from an xsave area in which the extended region is in the standard form. State is restored based on bits [62:0] in rs_mask, XCR0, and mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: st_mask = mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF (rs_mask[i] AND XCR0[i]) IF st_mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: ProcessorState[x87 FPU] := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] 1: ProcessorState[SSE] := mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] DEFAULT: ProcessorState[i] := mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] ESAC ELSE // ProcessorExtendedState := Processor Supplied Values CASE (i) OF 1: MXCSR := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[SSE] ESAC FI FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XRSTORS64
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial restore of the enabled processor states using the state information stored in memory at mem_addr. xrstors differs from xrstor in that it can restore state components corresponding to bits set in the IA32_XSS MSR; xrstors cannot restore from an xsave area in which the extended region is in the standard form. State is restored based on bits [62:0] in rs_mask, XCR0, and mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: st_mask = mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF (rs_mask[i] AND XCR0[i]) IF st_mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: ProcessorState[x87 FPU] := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] 1: ProcessorState[SSE] := mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] DEFAULT: ProcessorState[i] := mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] ESAC ELSE // ProcessorExtendedState := Processor Supplied Values CASE (i) OF 1: MXCSR := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[SSE] ESAC FI FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSAVE
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at mem_addr. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in save_mask and XCR0. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] BITWISE AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87 FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSAVE64
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at mem_addr. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in save_mask and XCR0. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] BITWISE AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87 FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSAVEC
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at mem_addr; xsavec differs from xsave in that it uses compaction and that it may use init optimization. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in save_mask and XCR0. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] BITWISE AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87 FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSAVEC64
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at mem_addr; xsavec differs from xsave in that it uses compaction and that it may use init optimization. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in save_mask and XCR0. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] BITWISE AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87 FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSAVEOPT
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at mem_addr. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in save_mask and XCR0. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary. The hardware may optimize the manner in which data is saved. The performance of this instruction will be equal to or better than using the XSAVE instruction.
intrinsic.oper: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] BITWISE AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87 FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] 2: mem_addr.EXT_SAVE_Area2[YMM] := ProcessorState[YMM] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSAVEOPT64
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at mem_addr. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in save_mask and XCR0. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary. The hardware may optimize the manner in which data is saved. The performance of this instruction will be equal to or better than using the XSAVE64 instruction.
intrinsic.oper: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] BITWISE AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87 FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] 2: mem_addr.EXT_SAVE_Area2[YMM] := ProcessorState[YMM] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSAVES
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at mem_addr; xsaves differs from xsave in that it can save state components corresponding to bits set in IA32_XSS MSR and that it may use the modified optimization. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in save_mask and XCR0. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] BITWISE AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87 FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSAVES64
intrinsic.desc: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at mem_addr; xsaves differs from xsave in that it can save state components corresponding to bits set in IA32_XSS MSR and that it may use the modified optimization. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in save_mask and XCR0. mem_addr must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.oper: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] BITWISE AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87 FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _XSETBV
intrinsic.desc: Copy 64-bits from val to the extended control register (XCR) specified by a. Currently only XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK XCR is supported.
intrinsic.oper: XCR[a] := val[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _XTEST
intrinsic.desc: Query the transactional execution status, return 0 if inside a transactionally executing RTM or HLE region, and return 1 otherwise.
intrinsic.oper: IF (RTM_ACTIVE = 1 OR HLE_ACTIVE = 1) dst := 0 ELSE dst := 1 FI
